loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is passionate about business. “Every business that I have managed, I have turned around to generate higher profits than ever before.”  Now with his new woodcrafts company, Eliteco, this 31-year-old father of three is ready to carve the same success for himself.

With the support of his wife who comes from a long line of wood craftsmen, Patrick intends to make Eliteco Florida’s number one producer of high quality, handmade wood decor.  “In my opinion the quality of products produced in the U.S. has dropped in favor of the assemble-yourself style of Home Depot and Lowes.  I want to change this.”

Thanks to his work history, Patrick understand what it takes to maintain a business and is currently in the initial stages of raising funds to make his dream come true.  “The largest obstacle I’ve faced has been trying to figure out how to come up with the capital to start the business.”

Over the past three months, Patrick has been purchasing some of the equipment he needs for woodwork.  However, he’s still missing some of the  most important tools, and these cost a lot of money to ship because of their fragility. Shipping can set Patrick back upwards of $500.00.  

The loan that Patrick is requesting will go to covering the costs of tools, wood and shipping.  Patrick needs this working capital to launch his business, and slowly transition from managing other people’s businesses, to taking care of his own.

loans.use: to purchase equipment and merchandise and pay for transport

loans.name: Santa Lucia Group

texts.es:
Santa Lucia es un grupo formado con 22 mujeres, ellas son jefas de familia, que quieren dar a sus seres queridos una vida digna y sin privaciones, cada una pone su mejor esfuerzo, ya que así podrán ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
Felicita es una de ellas, es una persona muy sacrificada y trabajadora, que desde muy tempranas horas del día se dedica a la venta de leche, que sale a vender desde muy tempranas horas del día. Felicita quiere seguir trabajando para poder seguir ayudando a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar leche en cantidad, y de esa forma poder cumplir con el pedido de sus clientes. Agradece por la ayuda que está recibiendo y que les será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Santa Lucia is a group formed of 22 women, who are the heads of their households, who want to give their loved ones a dignified life without hardships. Everyone puts forth her best effort, because in that way they will be able to continue improving their living conditions. 

Felicita is one of them; she is a very self-sacrificing and hard-working person, who from the very early hours of the day works selling milk. She goes out to sell at the very early hours of the day. Felicita wants to continue working and be able to continue supporting her family.

She asks for this loan to be able to purchase milk in bulk, and in this way be able to meet her customers' orders. She is thankful for the help that she is getting and which will be a great help for them.

loans.use: to purchase milk to sell.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 38 years old and married, with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

Myrna has borrowed and paid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy-and-sell rice business for two years and also earns an income from a general store.

Myrna aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Manuchehr

texts.ru: Манучехр родился в 1996 году. Он целеустремленный и умный молодой человек. Манучехр студент первого курса Университета экономики и финансы. Он учится успешно и своевременно выполняет все задания. Манучехр очень любит слушать современную музыку и играть баскетбол. Он всегда стремится к позитиву. Манучехр не женат и живет с родителями. Он обратился за займом в ИМОН, чтобы оплатить за учебный договор. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 1600 долларов США для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Manuchehr was born in 1996.  He is a driven and clever young man in his freshman year at a university specializing in economics and finance.  He's getting along well in his studies, and has no trouble finishing all his coursework on time.  He enjoys listening to contemporary music and playing basketball, and is always positive and upbeat.  He has yet to marry and lives with his parents.  Manuchehr is seeking a loan of $1600 USD from IMON to pay his university tuition, and is counting on your charity and kindness.

loans.use: pay his university tuition

loans.name: Eddie

texts.en:
Eddie has over ten years experience as a professional website designer.  Two years ago, he decided to turn his passion into a business. Chrysalis Web Development is a one-person business that creates custom websites as well as tailored online marketing and advertising services.  
  
“I have a passion for website development and this work is the perfect match for my life,” Eddie says.

In a short span of time, Eddie has consolidated a portfolio of clients. “I feel very happy with their trust in my work,” he says. With his earnings, Eddie also helps support his parents, who immigrated to the United States from the Dominican Republic many years ago. 

Eddie is now requesting a loan to help him reach out to a broader clientele. Since most of his clients find him through his website, Eddie is hoping to invest in his online presence to boost his contracts.  He can do this by buying digital advertisement space.  As a web developer, Eddie knows what it takes to succeed in online marketing, but needs the funds to get him started.  Eventually, Eddie would like to earn a Master’s degree in information technology in order to qualify to provide support for larger companies. 

Help Eddie get Chrysalis Web Development more exposure, and learn more about his services at www.chrysaliswebdevelopment.com.

loans.use: to pay for an online marketing class and marketing strategy.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bundles of pure water, milk, soap and baby food

loans.name: Makuta

texts.en:
This is 38-year-old Makuta. She is married, and has three children aged ten, seven and three years. In 2012, Makuta established her grocery business. She began her business because she wanted to develop herself and her family. Working seven days a week and 15 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,000,000 every month from this business. 

Makuta require a loan in order to purchase milk, sardines, tooth paste, sugar, bottles of pure water, and soft drinks for her business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits and improve her business. 

In the future, Makuta plans to improve her shop and educate her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items for resale.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
This is 29-year-old Hawa. She is married and has one child aged two years. In 2012, Hawa established her boutique men's wear and women’s, shoes, and creamer spray business. She began her business because she wanted to enhance her monthly profit earnings to improve her living standard. Working six days a week and nine hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,500,000 every month from this business. 

Hawa requires a loan in order to expand the business through the purchasing of more men's shirts, shoes, coats and women's shoes and coats. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits, which will help her to improve her business. 

In the future, Hawa plans to establish a big shop and to send her child to school. This business is helping her to raise her child. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase more men's and women's shirts, shoes, and coats

loans.name: Henny

texts.en:
Henny is a married woman with five children. She is 40 years old and all of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Henny has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell to her customers. Henny has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Henny would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell to her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more mobile accessories and touch lights for resale.

loans.name: Budi

texts.en:
Meet Budi. Budi live with his four family members in South Bandung, an area located in West Java province of Indonesia. Budi is married and he works as teacher.

To find another source of income, Budi also runs a small stall that sells mobile phones, mobile phone accessories, and mobile phone airtime credits.

He was introduced to Ruma by one of Ruma's staff who visited his stall and he quickly became interested to join Ruma about a month ago. Budi believes that using technology will make the business run easier. As the business continues to grow, he hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva to enable him to process more mobile services for his community on the weekends. He also hopes that he will be able to improve his business as he learns from Ruma.

Budi is pictured in the photo standing in front of his small stall, serving one of his customers. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide mobile phone services in his community.

loans.name: Cici

texts.en:
Cici is a housewife who lives with her family in West Bandung, in West Java, Indonesia.

She helps her husband run a small shop that sells rubber shoes, phone accessories, and mobile phone airtime. Cici joined Ruma about five months ago because she wanted to expand her network, learn how to use technology, and learn how to run her small stall more effectively. She is excited about expanding her business to now sell mobile airtime. She hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva to provide more mobile airtime transactions to her community on the weekends. Cici thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide mobile phone services in her community.

loans.name: Cecep

texts.en:
Cecep lives with his wife and their only child in Garut, the capital city of Garut regency located in West Java. Cecep runs a small shop that sells mobile phones, phone accessories and also mobile phone airtime credits. 

He was introduced to Ruma by a staff member who visited his stall, and he became a Ruma customer about a month ago. Cecep is excited to sell mobile airtime especially because mobile airtime is in quite high demand in his community. As the business continues to grow, he hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva to enable him to provide mobile services for his community on the weekends. 

In the photo, Cecep is standing in his small shop. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide mobile services in his community.

loans.name: Cantalicia

texts.es:
La Sra. Cantalicia es comerciante hace tiempo, tiene 63 años, esta casada con la el Señor Anselmo hace más de 30 años, es una señora muy trabajadora y responsable proviene de una familia con muchos principios y buenos valores.
Tiene una Despensa y Carnicería en su casa, además su marido se dedica a la fabricación de ladrillos, son una familia muy trabajadora todos se ayudan mutuamente para salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar una sierra para su carnicería, ya que de esa forma podrá seguir con las ventas a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Cantalicia has been a businesswoman for some time. She is 63 years old, has been married to Anselmo for over 30 years, and is a very hard-working and responsible lady who comes from a family with a lot of principles and good values.

She has a pantry and butcher's shop in her house, in addition, her husband works making bricks.  They are a very hard-working family, everyone helps each other mutually to get ahead.

She asks for this loan to be able to purchase a meat saw, since in this way she will be able to continue with the sales to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase a meat saw.

loans.name: Martha Nancy

texts.es:
Martha es una mujer de 41 años de edad, soltera, madre de 2 hijos de 6 y 4 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de carne.
Ella es emprendedora, constante, buena madre, luchadora, optimista, paciente, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su labor lo realiza en la comunidad de Huatajata, este lugar se caracteriza por el ‘trueque’ que consiste en que las Mujeres intercambian productos como; papa, chuño, kaya, por pescado cocido o charque.
Martha es de tez morena, estatura mediana, cabello negro largo trenzado, su lengua materna es el aymara y utiliza el español para el comercio. Su trabajo es la cría de ganado vacuno para el fainado y la venta de carne. Ella se ocupa de la venta de carne de res y de llama, también realiza la producción de charque (carne deshidratada). Ella sueña mejorar su calidad de vida realizando la compra de ganado para mejorar su negocio y generar mayores ingresos económicos.
Es por esos motivos que Martha solicita un préstamo para la compra de ganado y con los beneficios mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Martha is a 41-year-old single woman.  She is the mother of 2 children who are 6 and 4 years old and her business is selling meat.  She is enterprising, persevering, a good mother, tenacious, optimistic, patient, responsible and very hardworking.  She carries out her work in the community of Huatajata.  This place is characterized for its “trueque” (system of bartering) which consists of women who exchange products like potatoes, dehydrated potatoes, “kaya” (a dehydrated grain) for cooked fish or dehydrated beef. 

Martha has a dark complexion, is of medium height and has long, braided, black hair.  Her mother tongue is Aymara and she uses Spanish in her business.  Her work is the raising of livestock for slaughter and the sale of the meat.  She deals with the sale of beef and of llama.  She also produces “charque” (dehydrated beef).  

She dreams of improving her quality of life by making the livestock purchase in order to improve her business and generate greater financial income.  It is for these reasons that Martha is requesting a loan for the purchase of livestock and with the profits she wants to improve the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and with the profits to improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.name: Rosa Mistica Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Rosa Mistica está empezando el primer ciclo, es un grupo nuevo que quiere crecer e ir mejorando las condiciones de vida de cada una, además forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, con la encuesta socioeconómica.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Gilda, quien además es la presidenta del grupo, es una persona muy emprendedora que quiere dar a sus seres queridos todo lo que ella no pudo tener y que no pasen por necesidades como las que ella atravesó.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas varias, para poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas.
texts.en:
The "Rosa Mistica" ("Mystical Rose") group is beginning its first loan cycle. It is a new group whose members want to grow and improve their living conditions. Moreover, the group is part of the Poverty Elimination Program and is participating in the Poverty Stoplight socio-economic survey.

One of the members is Gilda, who is also the group's chairwoman. She is a very enterprising person who wants to provide her loved ones with everything she couldn't have and wishes that they don't have to endure the same hardships as she did.

She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of a variety of clothing items in order to be able to continue with her sales.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of clothing items for retail sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase clothing, footwear and other products for sale.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 43 years old, married, and has six children, three of whom are currently in school.

Eva is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Eva has been in the pig fattening business for 10 years now, and has borrowed twice in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Eva would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Gala

texts.en:
Gala is 52 years old and married with six children, one of whom is still in school.

Gala is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Gala requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Gala has been raising pigs for 20 years now, and has borrowed twice in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Gala would like to save money in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Lenita

texts.en:
Lenita is 54 years old and has seven children. She has a live-in partner and four of her children are still in school.

Lenita is in the agricultural business, specifically pig fattening, in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Lenita has been fattening pigs for 3 years now and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Lenita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 42 years old and has four children. She is married and all of her children are in school.

Imelda is in the agricultural business, specifically pig fattening in the Philippines. Imelda has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her pigs.

Imelda has been fattening pigs for 9 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Imelda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene has a live-in partner and three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 27 years-old and two of her children are currently in school.

Irene has a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Irene has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 46 years old and married with ten children. With five children currently in school, Irene works very hard to provide for them.

Irene runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell, like coffee, vinegar, fabric conditioner, shampoo, detergent soap, etc. Irene has been in this business for 10 years 

In the future, Irene would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, like coffee, vinegar, fabric conditioner, shampoo, detergent soap, etc.

loans.name: Jeanitte

texts.en:
Jeanitte has a live-in partner and six children. All of her children are in school. She is 35 years old and a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 7 years.

She requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell. In the future, Jeanitte would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en:
Ivan lives with his wife and their only child in East Bandung, in West Java, Indonesia.

Ivan runs a small shop that sells snack, drinks, consumer daily products, and mobile phone airtime credits. He was introduced to Ruma by one of Ruma's staff who visited his stall and he became a Ruma agent about a month ago. Ivan is excited to sell mobile airtime especially because mobile airtime is in quite high demand in his community. As the business continues to grow, he hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva to enable him to provide mobile services for his community on the weekends. In the photo, Ivan is standing in his small shop. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide mobile phone services in his community.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 53 years old and is married with three children. With one child still in school, Letecia works very hard to provide for her family.

Letecia runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Letecia has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as detergent, soap, shampoo, coffee, sugar, cereals, etc.

Letecia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Munati

texts.en:
Munati is a single mom who lives with 5 of her family members in Jember, a small city in East Java province. To support her family, she runs a small stall that sells snacks, drinks, mobile airtime, and also services bill payment for her customers. 

She knew Ruma from a Ruma agent who came to visit her stall. She was interested in providing more products to what she sells, especially because mobile airtime and bill payment services are in quite high demand. Munati decided to join Ruma about a month ago. She is optimistic and she believes that she can improve her small stall as she learns from Ruma staff. 

As the business runs, she hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva in order to provide more mobile and bill payment services for her community on the weekends. In the photo. Munati is standing in her small stall. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide bill payment and mobile services in her community.

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
El grupo Divino Niño Jesus está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de Concepción, la cual es una zona un poco alejada de la zona céntrica y aún se encuentra en crecimiento. Es una zona de difícil acceso, por lo que cada una de ellas está luchando mucho.
La Sra.  Luciana es una de las integrantes, ella es de una zona alejada del centro mismo de la ciudad donde sale a realizar limpieza en casas ajenas, aparte de ello también tiene su venta de perfumes, ella es una mujer muy sacrificada y luchadora, que día a día quiere ir ganándose la vida de una mejor manera para ayudar a su familia.
Solicita de este préstamo para la compra de perfumes varios para su venta. Y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo con su negocio y dar así a su familia lo que necesitan para tener una vida sin privaciones.
texts.en:
The Divino Niño Jesus group is in its second loan cycle in the women's committee program. It is from the city of Concepción, which is in a zone a bit far from the central zone and is growing.  It is a zone difficult to access, which causes each one of them to struggle greatly.

Luciana is one of the members, she is from a zone distant from the center of the city, where she goes out to clean houses.  Apart from this, she also sells perfumes. She is a very self-sacrificing and determined woman, who day to day wants to earn a living for herself in the best way to be able to help her family. 

She asks for this loan to purchase a variety of perfumes to sell. And, in this way, to be able to continue growing her business and, in turn, give her family what it needs to have a live without deprivation.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of perfumes to sell.

loans.name: San Antonio Group

texts.es:
17 son las mujeres que forman este grupo llamado San Antonio, son de la ciudad de Concepción, una ciudad bastante alejada de la capital del país, por lo que van luchando por ir mejorando.
La Sra.  Luci es una de las integrantes, ella es de una zona alejada del centro mismo de la ciudad donde sale a vender sus comidas, que ella misma hace y que luego sale a vender.
Solicita de este préstamo para la compra de materias primas para elaboración de comidas para su venta, y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo con su negocio y dar así a su familia lo que necesitan para tener una vida sin privaciones. Cada una de ellas está luchando para poder crecer y salir adelante, para ayudar a sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
There are 17 women who form this group called San Antonio. They are from the city of Concepción, a city quite removed from the county's capital, which causes them to struggle to get ahead.

Luci is one of the members; she is from a zone distant from the city center, where she goes out to sell food, which she makes herself and later goes out to sell. 

She asks for this loan to be able to purchase raw materials to make the food she sells and, in this way, be able to continue growing her business and, in turn, to give her family what it needs to have a life without deprivation. Each one of them is fighting to be able to grow and continue onward, to help their loved ones.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of supplies to prepare food.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.es:
La señora Lilian es propietario de una Farmacia Boticario donde se dedica a la venta de Productos Fármacos en general.
Cuenta con su propio local y todos los materiales para el desarrollo de su servicio. Su préstamo lo pide para invertirlo en la compra de productos Fármacos para aumentar su Stock y así satisfacer las necesidades de sus consumidores. 
Ella esta agradecida por la oportunidad de crecer que recibe, y que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Lilian is the owner of an apothecary pharmacy where she works selling general medicines.

She has her own retail space and all the materials to develop her service. The loan she requests is to invest in the purchase of medicine products to increase her stock and, in this way, to meet the needs of her customers.

She is grateful for this opportunity to grow that she is getting, and that it will be a great help.

loans.use: to purchase medicines to sell.

loans.name: Jelanie

texts.en:
Jelanie is 41 years old and married with six children. She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase vitamins, feeds and other supplies for her business. Jelanie has been in pig fattening for 8 years and also earns additional income from fish vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins, feeds and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Ma. Rosalina

texts.en:
Ma. Rosalina is 38 years old and married with six children who are in school. Ma. Rosalina works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a business buying and selling nipa palm roofing in the Philippines and requested an 11,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional bundles of nipa palm to sell. Ma. Rosalina has been in this business for five years.

She would like to build and to expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of nipa palm to sell

loans.name: Rosela

texts.en:
Rosela is 59 years old and single. She works very hard to earn for her future.

She runs a business making nipa palm roofing in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional bamboo and nipa leaves.

Rosela has been in this business for 20 years. 

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional bamboo and nipa leaves

loans.name: Terry

texts.en:
Terry works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business making nipa palm roofing in the Philippines.

She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more raw materials like nipa leaves and bamboo.

Terry has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials like nipa leaves and bamboo

loans.name: Aat

texts.en:
Meet Aat. Aat is single and he lives with four family members in East Bandung, a regency area that is located in West Java province. He works as a sales staff member in a private company, and he is also a mobile phone airtime credits agent. He sells mobile airtime for his community.  

He was introduced to Ruma by one of his friends and he quickly became interested in joining Ruma about a month ago. He plans to save the extra income to start his own business.  As the business continues to grow, he hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva to enable him to process more mobile services for his community on the weekends. 

Aat is pictured in the photo, standing around in his neighborhood. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide mobile services in his community.

loans.name: Rokim

texts.en:
Meet Rokim. Rokim and his family live in East Bandung, a regency area that is located in West Java province. Rokim is a micro-entrepreneur who runs a small stall, which sells mobile phone sim cards and mobile phone airtime. 

He was introduced to Ruma by one of Ruma's staff who visited his stall, and he quickly became interested in joining Ruma about a month ago. He plans to save the extra income for his child’s education.

As the business continues to grow, he hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva to enable him to process more mobile services to his community on the weekends. In the photo, Rokim is standing in his small stall. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide mobile services in his community.

loans.name: Jesica

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Jesica works hard to support her family. She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. 

Jesica is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell in her vegetable stall. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell in her vegetable stall.

loans.name: Jessa

texts.en:
Jessa works hard to support her family. She has a live-in partner and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 2 years now.

Jessa requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell. In the future, Jessa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Luciana works hard to support her family.

She has a fruit and vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Luciana is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell.

Luciana has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en:
Maria Fe is 30 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family.

Maria Fe runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Maria Fe has borrowed and repaid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 13 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Maria Fe aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is 34 years old and has four children. She is married and three of her children are currently in school.

Marife is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Marife has been vegetable farming for 4 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Marife would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Wiwi

texts.en:
Wiwi, her husband, and their only child live together in East Bandung, a regency area in West Java. Her husband works in a private company. Wiwi contributes to the support of her family by managing a small shop that sells snacks, drinks, and mobile phone airtime credits. 

She joined Ruma about a month ago because she wanted to increase her family’s income. She also wants to expand her network, learn about using technology and learn how to run her small stall more effectively. She feels really excited about expanding her business by selling mobile phone airtime credits. 

As the business runs, she hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva in order to do more transactions on weekends. Wiwi thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide mobile services in her community.

loans.name: Horticultura Group

texts.es:
El comité está conformado por 20 Señoras que apuntan a una mejor y buena calidad de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Catalina, esposa del Señor Santiago, con hijos ya mayores de edad con sus respectivas profesiones, ambos son agricultores, tiene una huerta de más o menos 16 parcelas y un enorme gallinero con 50 aves lo cual le provee de huevos y la señora los es una familia muy trabajadora que quiere salir adelante por medio de su esfuerzo.
Solicitó este préstamo para la compra de sus productos para la venta de forma ambulante, como ser balanceados para sus aves. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The committee is made up of 20 women whose goal is to have a better and good quality of life.

One of the members is Catalina, the wife of Santiago, with grown children with their own jobs, both are farmers. She has a vegetable garden of about 16 parcels and an enormous hen house with 50 birds, which provides her with eggs.  She is a woman from a very hard-working family who wants to get ahead through her own hard work.

She asks for this loan to purchase products to sell as a street vendor, such as balanced poultry feed. She is grateful for the opportunity that she is receiving to be able to continue growing.

loans.use: to purchase balanced poultry feed.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 70 years old and married with nine children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries.

Violeta has been in this business for 24 years. 

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries

loans.name: Marisa

texts.en:
Marisa is 39 years old and has a live-in partner. She has eight children. With five children currently in school, Marisa works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 14,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional stock to sell like candies, bread, hair conditioners, noodles, cooking oil, and canned goods.

Marisa has been in this business for 19 years and sells a variety of items such as candies, bread, hair conditioners, noodles, cooking oil, and canned goods. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like candies, bread, hair conditioners, noodles, cooking oil, and canned goods

loans.name: Purita

texts.en:
Purita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store in the Philippines.

She requested a 14,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Purita has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rosa Esmeralda

texts.es:
Visitar a la familia es uno de los mejores momentos de las personas, el amor, la convivencia y el intercambio de experiencias nos nutre. Para Rosa visitar a su familia era algo normal, hasta que un día tuvo la visión de aprovechar el pueblo donde vive su familia para vender ropa. Ahora a sus 63 años de edad, ya tiene un gran número de clientes, se ha extendido por todo el departamento del país. Esta madre de 12 hijos, entre las edades de 44 a 20 años de edad, ha trabajado vendiendo ropa y cosméticos bajo el sol por más de 25 años, con el propósito de llevar a su familia adelante.
Rosa está casada con un hombre que la ha apoyado siempre con los ingresos de una minidisco que tiene. Juntos han logrado brindarles comida, un techo estable y estudios a sus hijos. Sin embargo, ella quiere seguir extendiéndose a otros lugares, por lo que solicita un crédito para comprar camisetas, jeans, faldas, cosméticos y ropa interior para tener siempre mercadería que al cliente le gusta y así aumentar sus ventas. En un futuro piensa vender zapatos para atraer más clientes.
texts.en:
To visit family is one of people's best moments -- the love, harmony and exchange of experiences nurtures us. For Rosa, visiting family was a normal thing, 
until the day when she had the idea to make the most of the town where her family lives to sell clothing. Now, at 63 years old, she has a large number of customers, she has expanded to the entire department of her country. She is the mother of 12 children, between the ages of 44 and 20 years old, and has worked selling clothing and cosmetics under the sun for over 25 years, with the goal to bring her family ahead.

Rosa is married to a man who has always supported her with the income from a mini-disco that he has.  Together, they have managed to offer food, a stable roof, and education to their children. However, she always wanted to expand to other places, for which she asks for a loan to purchase shirts, jeans, skirts, cosmetics, and lingerie to always have the merchandise that her customers like, and in this way increase her sales. In the future, she plans to sell shoes to attract more customers.

loans.use: to purchase shirts, jeans, skirts, cosmetics, and lingerie.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a deep fryer and ingredients to make cakes, cheese sticks, meat arepas, and other fried foods in order to make more money and improve her quality-of-life.

loans.name: Mersalie

texts.en:
Mersalie is 48 years old and married with four children.  

She is in the agricultural business and fattens pigs in the Philippines. Mersalie requested a 15,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been in the pig fattening business for two years now and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Mersalie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad works hard to support her family. She has a live-in partner.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

Trinidad has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 58 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, soft drinks, beers, fabric conditioners, noodles, and detergent soap.

Virginia has been in this business for 12 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft drinks, beers, fabric conditioners, noodles, and detergent soap. 

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, soft drinks, beers, fabric conditioners, noodles, and detergent soap

loans.name: Rosa Mistica Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Rosa Mistica, es un grupo nuevo, está en el ciclo 1, tiene muchas expectativas de crecer y salir adelante por medio del trabajo en conjunto de cada una.
Una persona que se destaca por el entusiasmo es la Sra. Isabel, quien vende perfumes, colonias, y fragancias varias en forma ambulante, es una señora muy sacrificada, que piensa llegar lejos con su esfuerzo, es por eso que esta trabajando duro para ir mejorando poco a poco.
Pide este préstamo justamente con miras a poder crecer y mejorar, quiere comprar perfumes varios, para que de esa manera pueda ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida y las de u familia. Agradecen todas por esta oportunidad y prometen poder su mejor esfuerzo por crecer.
texts.en:
The community bank is called Rosa Mistica. It is a new group in the first cycle. They have a lot of expectations of growth and getting ahead through the work of each one of them. 

One person who is notable for her enthusiasm is Isabel, who sells perfumes, colognes, and fragrances from door-to-door. She is a hard working woman who thinks she will make it a long way with effort. For this, she is working hard to improve little-by-little. She asks for this loan looking to grow and improve. She wants to buy various perfumes since this is the manner that will let her improve her quality-of-life and that of he family.

All are thankful for this opportunity and promise to put forth their best effort in order to grow.

loans.use: to buy various perfumes for sale.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

She requested a 13,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional materials like fabric, needles, and threads for her business.

Clarita has been in this business for 43 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Clarita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like fabric, needles, and threads for her business

loans.name: Antonio Maria

texts.es:
Para información de los prestamistas en la ciudad de Medellín hay mucha inclusión social, uno de los beneficios que dieron a la comunidad fue unas escaleras eléctricas que conectan dos barrios, y en este sector Antonio tiene su tienda y siempre se preocupa por mejorar pues sabe que viene visitantes y pasan muchas personas por el sector acudiendo a su tienda para comprar algún víveres para su hogar, en el afán de mejorar y seguir siempre ofreciendo un servicio óptimo a sus clientes quiere solicitar un crédito el cual invertirá en insumos de la canasta familiar. 
Su sueño es poder comprar el lugar donde tiene ubicado su tienda y seguir viendo la transformación del sector que una vez fue reconocido por su violencia y ver como sus hijos se crían en una zona renovada y con aspiraciones de progreso.
texts.en: In the city of Medellín, there is a lot of social inclusion. One of the projects was electric stairs that connect two neighborhoods. In this area, Antonio has his store. He always worries about improving it knowing that visitors come and many people pass through this area going to his store to buy groceries for their homes. In the hope of improving and continuing to offer optimal service to his clients, he is applying for a loan which he will invest in basic groceries. His dreams are to be able to buy the place where his store is located, continue seeing the transformation of the area that was once known for its violence, and to see how his children grow in the revamped area with hope of progress.

loans.use: to stock basic goods in order to have the supplies to cover his clients' needs and always leave them satisfied.

loans.name: Almera

texts.en:
Almera is 41 years old and married with seven children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

Almera has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell charcoal for four years, and also earns an income from farming rice.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Araceli

texts.en:
Araceli is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a seaweed cultured business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy plastic container, seaweeds, and rope for the business for her seaweed cultured business.

Araceli has been in this business for five years. She earns more income from fishing.

Araceli has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy plastic container, seaweeds, and rope for the business

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 43 years old and married with six children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Elisa has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years, and also earns an income from fishing.

Elisa aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling fruits in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 17,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional fruits to sell for her business.

Lydia has been in this business for 12 years. She earns more income from buying and selling charcoal.

Lydia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fruits to sell

loans.name: Daniela

texts.es:
La Sra. Daniela tiene un salón de masajes terapéuticos, es una muy buena profesional, que está esforzándose por poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida, a través de su esfuerzo y trabajo.
Daniela poco a poco fue abriéndose camino, ya que sabe que la única forma para poder salir adelante es por medio de su trabajo. El préstamo lo pide para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos de fisioterapia, como ser cremas, y demás.
texts.en:
Daniela has a therapeutic massage salon. She is a very good businesswoman, who is striving to improve her quality of life through her work and effort.

Little by little, Daniela has made a path for herself, since she knows that the only way to move forward is by working. She is requesting a loan to buy products for physiotherapy such as creams and other things.

loans.use: to buy therapeutic massage supplies such as creams and other things.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Elizabeth works hard to support her family. She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. 

Elizabeth is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice to sell. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Emelyn works hard to support her family. She has a seaweed culturing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from fishing.

Emelyn is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to  buy additional materials for her seaweed culturing business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her seaweed culturing business

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Judith works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from vegetable farming.  Judith is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell  for her business. 

Judith has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a seaweed culturing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years. Hilda earns more income from fish drying and fishing.

She is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional seaweed, rope, plastic bags, etc., for her seaweed culturing business. Hilda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional seaweed, rope, plastic bags, etc., for her business

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 54 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase stock to sell, such as canned goods, eggs, milk, and coffee.

Imelda has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 6 years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal.

Imelda aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase stock to sell, such as canned goods, eggs, milk, and coffee

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 49 years old and married, with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell, like coffee, water, spices, and canned goods.

Jocelyn has borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from buying and selling dry goods.

Jocelyn hopes to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell, like coffee, water, spices, and canned goods

loans.name: Lila

texts.en:
Lila is 34 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Lila has borrowed and paid back 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the business buying and selling charcoal for three years and also earns an income from food vending.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Marilyn works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell of rice grains business in the Philippines and earns additional income from farming rice.  Marilyn is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell. 

Marilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Liezel works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from direct selling. Liezel is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to  buy madditional fish nets and other fishing materials for her fishing business.

Liezel has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish nets and other fishing materials

loans.name: Roxan

texts.en:
Roxan is 28 years old and married with two children who are in school, She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc., to sell.

Roxan has been in this business for three years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc., to sell

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
As the married parent of five children, Norma works hard to support her family.

She has a business making dried fish in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Norma is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fish to make dried fish for her business making dried fish.

Norma has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Victor Hugo

texts.es: Victor tiene 24 años de edad, se alejo de sus padres por que le ofrecieron  un trabajo en un lugar lejano y por este motivo vive solo,  Victor  se crio en el campo y por este motivo se dedica a la agricultura desde que era niño, también es empleado en el molino que es donde hacen harina, Victor va a invertir el crédito en la compra de semilla, preparación del terreno y mano de obra para sembrar papas a medias con el dueño del terreno, les deseos de Victor son sembrar en mayor cantidad, superarse y mejorar sus calidad de vida.
texts.en: Victor is 24 years old. He moved away from his parents because they offered him a job in a faraway place. That's why he lives alone. Victor grew up in the countryside and for this reason has been involved in agriculture since he was a child. He is also an employee in a mill where they make flour. Victor will invest the loan in the purchase of seed, preparation of the land and labor to plant potatoes, splitting the work with the owner of the land. Victor hopes to plant in greater numbers, better himself, and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: buy seed

loans.name: Rebelyn

texts.en:
Rebelyn is 31 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc., to sell.

Rebelyn has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from rice farming.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc., to sell

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 32 years old and married with four children, three of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell of charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

Mary Ann has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell of charcoal business for three years and earns additional income from farming rice.

Mary Ann aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Mila Luna

texts.en:
Mila Luna works hard to support her family. Mila Luna is married and has a bakery business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy flour, baking powder and other baking ingredients.

Mila Luna has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Mila Luna would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy flour, baking powder and other baking ingredients

loans.name: Nelsa

texts.en:
Nelsa is 39 years old and married with five children, four of whom are in school, Nelsa works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Nelsa has been in this business for three years.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Nimfa works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle tramsport business in the Philippines and earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal.  Nimfa is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle. 

Nimfa has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts to maintain her motorcycle

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 44 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

Jocelyn has been farming rice  for 10 years and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Leonesa

texts.en:
Leonesa  works hard to support her family.  She  is married and has a lumberyard business in the Philippines. Leonesa  has been in this business for three years now.

She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more lumber to sell.  Leonesa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more lumber to sell

loans.name: Kenjamo

texts.ru:
Кенчамо 42 года. Она проживает в районе Кумсангир с мужем и детьми. Ее муж работает на центральном парке, а старшая дочь предоставляет услуги швеи. Сама Кенчамо работает в детском развлекательном комплексе "Лимпопо" в течение 5 лет. Целью ее запрашиваемого кредита является ремонт дома. Она начала ремонт, но из-за нехватки финансов не может завершить его. На сумму кредита она купит недостающие строительно-отделочные материалы. Кенчамо нуждается в этом кредите.
В будущем она планирует начать собственный бизнес и открыть маленькое кафе на центральном парке.
texts.en: Kenjamo is 42 and lives in the Qumsangir region with her husband and children. Her husband works in the central park and her oldest daughter works as a seamstress. Kenjamo has been working in Limpopo, a children's entertainment complex, for five years. The goal of this loan is to renovate her home. She started the renovations, but due to a lack of funds was unable to complete them. With the loan amount she will buy the remaining construction and finishing materials she needs. Kenjamo needs this loan. In the future she plans to start her own business and open a small cafe in the central park.

loans.use: to renovate her home and improve her living conditions

loans.name: Mauricio De La Milagrosa

texts.es:
Mauricio un hombre de 59 años de edad que encontró en interactuar una salida al desempleo y es que gracias a las capacitaciones que recibió par amontar empresa y no solo eso sino que también aprendió a realizar las comidas y ahora tiene otra perspectiva de la vida. 
Con la ayuda de un crédito que se encuentra solicitando podrá comenzar con su plan para captar la atenciones de los clientes y generar recursos para velar por el bienestar económico de su esposa y uno de sus 3 hijos que solo tiene 14 años de edad los otros dos ya son mayores de edad.
El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de insumos al por mayor, argumentando que podrá tener mayor utilidad en sus ventas y poder seguir siempre progresando y demostrar que siempre hay oportunidades para trabajar y superarse como persona.
texts.en:
In Interactuar, Mauricio, age 59, found a way out of unemployment.  This is thanks to the training he received to set up a business.  It was not only this.  He also learned to make food, and he now has another perspective on life.

With the help of the loan that he is requesting, he will be able to start with his plan to get the customers’ attention.  He will generate resources to watch out for the financial well-being of his wife and one of his three children, who is only 14 years old.  The other two children are now adults.

He will use the loan to buy supplies wholesale. He contends that he will be able to have greater profits from his sales.  He will be able to always make progress and show that there are always opportunities to work and improve as a person.

loans.use: to buy supplies like meat, bread, cheese, napkins, and plastic cutlery wholesale.

loans.name: Mujeres De Tujukua Group

texts.es:
19 son las mujeres que integran este grupo, cada una tiene su propia actividad, pero se ayudan las unas a las otras para poder ir mejorando las condiciones de vida de sus familias. Son jefas de familia que quieren ir mejorando y progresando cada día mas.
La Sra. Elva es integrantes de este grupo, es una artesana muy habil, se dedica a la confeccion de tejidos en ñanduti, que es un tejido típico de Paraguay, y por medio de ese bello oficio tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de hilos varios y agujas para poder confeccionar el tejido que después vende.
texts.en:
This group is comprised of 19 women.  Each one has their own business activity, but they help each other in order to be able to improve their families’ living conditions.  They are the heads of their families, and they want to improve and progress more each day.

Elva is a member of the group.  She is a very skillful artisan.  She makes 'ñanduti' embroidered lace, a typical Paraguayan textile.  It is through this beautiful craft that she is able to help her family.

She is requesting this loan to be able to buy various threads and needles to be able to make the lace that she later sells.

loans.use: to buy various threads and needles.

loans.name: Nurali

texts.ru:
Нурали малый предприниматель из района Фархор. Ему 45 лет, он отец четверых детей. Жена домохозяйка, дети занимаются учебой и в их семье зарабатывает только Нурали. 
Нурали в задней части своего дома имеет автомойку, которым управляет уже 5 лет. В его автомойке работают трое рабочих, которым он платит заработную плату. За день в его автомойке в среднем моют 28 автомашин. Нурали целеустремленный человек, он хочет расширить свой бизнес. Для этой цели он нуждается в кредите в размере 5000 долларов США. На эту сумму он собирается приобрести высококачественные пароочистители и пылесос марки Karcher в свою автомойку для чистки автомобилей. Благодаря этим современным моющим оборудованиям, его рабочие будут обслуживать клиентов быстрее и качественнее, и это принесет еще больший успех его бизнесу. Поэтому Нурали очень надеется на вашу финансовую поддержку для развития своего малого бизнеса.
texts.en:
Nurali is a small business owner from the Farkhor region of Tajikistan.  He is 45, and the father of four children.  His wife tends to their home, and his children are all in school.  As such, Nurali is the only breadwinner in the family.  He operates a car wash out of his backyard, and has done so for the past 5 years.  He has three people working under him, and together, they wash an average of 28 cars a day.

Nurali is driven to succeed, and wants to expand his business accordingly.  He is seeking a loan of $5000 USD to buy high-quality steam and vacuum cleaners made by Karcher for his car wash.  Having modern, state-of-the-art cleaning equipment will allow his workers to provide faster and better service, and make his business more successful in turn.  Nurali is counting on your financial support to help his business grow.

loans.use: buy Karcher-brand steam and vacuum cleaners for his car wash.

loans.name: Teresa Andrea

texts.es: Andrea es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos de 4 y 5  años, cuenta Andrea que ella de niña vivía en un lugar muy alejado de la ciudad y que para estudiar la secundaria tuvo que irse a vivir con una tía que vivía algo más cerca  a la ciudad y desde ahí si podía transportarse a estudiar, y cuando saco su bachillerato  se quedo viviendo con su tía, en la actualidad Andrea se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, tiene    unas chanchas paridoras  para comercializar los chanchos pequeñitos, Andrea  necesita el crédito para comprar una chancha grande para seguir con esta  actividad que  le permite obtener  los recursos necesarios para darles lo más indispensable a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Andrea is a single mother with two children, ages four and five. Andrea tells us that when she was a girl, she lived in a location very far from the city and to study in secondary school, she had to go and live with an aunt who resided somewhat closer to the city. From there, she could be transported to school. Then, when Andrea received her diploma, she decided to continue living with her aunt. 

At present, Andrea is dedicated to raising small livestock. She raises pigs who give birth to piglets that she can sell.

Andrea needs this loan to purchase a large pig to continue with this activity, which will allow her to obtain the necessary resources to offer the most basic necessities to her children.

loans.use: buy a large pig to produce little ones to sell.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 33 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the store for two years and also earns an income from culturing seaweed. 

Ruth has requested a loan of 9,500 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to purchase more stock of household goods, like canned goods, to sell. She has borrowed and paid two previous loans from NWTF. 

She aspires to saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of household goods, like canned goods, to sell.

loans.name: Izabel

texts.en:
Izabel, a business woman, lives in Suai. She has a clothing shop. She also has animals in her place, like cows, pigs and chickens.

She started her clothing business in 2009 with her own working capital of $250. She earns a good income from selling clothes. Her place of business is in the center of the market, so many people come to buy her merchandise.

Izabel is applying for a loan of $1,100 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She is taking this loan because she wants to buy more clothes to sell, including children's clothes, underwear, socks, belts, trousers, shorts and shirts. 

With this loan from Tuba Rai Metin, she hopes she can improve her management and open a big store in the future.

loans.use: To buy children's clothes, underwear, socks, belts, trousers, shorts, shirts and other things to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 50 years old, married and has three children, one of whom is currently studying.

To supplement her spouse's income, Josephine operates a store selling grocery items to the people in their village. Josephine wants to increase her sales so she is asking for additional capital of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, biscuits, soft drinks and sugar to sell. With the help of this loan, she will gain good profits to be used for her child’s education and for the future expenses of her family.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, biscuits, soft drinks and sugar to sell

loans.name: Debra

texts.en:
Debra is a married woman with two children, one of whom is currently in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Debra is 31 years old.

Debra has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Debra has been in this business for 2 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Las Pozas 4 Group

texts.es:
Rony es agricultor del Departamento de Ahuachapan,tiene 33 años de edad y con el dos amigos agricultores forman el grupo solidario llamado Las pozas cuatro, cultivan maiz ,maicillo y frijol.
El grupo familiar de Rony esta formado por su esposa y dos hijos entre las edades de 10 y 15 años.Rony desarrollo sus estudios hasta quinto grado de primaria; debido a la pobreza en la que vivian sus padres, no pudo seguir en la escuela.
Rony tiene 20 años de experiencia en la agricultura, su principal rubro es el cultivo de granos basicos tales como maiz, maicillo, frijol.
Rony necesita el credito para cubrir los costos de los insumos necesarios para la siembra de frijol y maicillo,dicho cultivo le permitira seguir dandole el sustento diario a su grupo familiar.uno de los sueños de Rony es que sus hijos mejoren su calidad de vida a travez de una buena preparacion academica y asi que no tengan que pasar por las dificultades economicas que el de pequeño le toco vivir.
texts.en:
Rony is a farmer in the Department of Ahuachapan. He is 33 years old. He and two friends make up the credit group Las Pozas 4. They grow corn, sorghum, and beans.

Rony’s family is composed of his wife and two children between the ages of 10 and 15. Rony attended school until fifth grade; due to the poverty in which his parents lived, he could not stay in school.

Rony has 20 years of farming experience. His specialty is growing basic grains, such as corn, sorghum, and beans.

Rony needs the loan to cover the cost of the supplies necessary to plant beans and sorghum; the crops will allow him to continue to feed his family each day. One of Rony’s dreams is that his children improve their quality of life through a good education, so that they do not have the same economic difficulties that Rony has experienced since he was young.

loans.use: to buy agriculture supplies

loans.name: Duger

texts.en:
Mrs. Duger, 58 years old, lives with her sister in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

Duger has been selling jewelry to local people since 2006. Her children got married and now live on their own. 

Last year Duger lost her elder son to disease. Her husband passed away when their children were very young. For years, Duger has worked in the field of jewelry in order to support her children. 

Using her previous loan, Duger increased the variety of her goods and attracted customers to her business. Now she is requesting a loan of 3,500,000 MNT to buy jewelry in bulk from Korea in order to diversify her goods and increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy jewelry in bulk in order to increase her profits

loans.name: Unurbayar

texts.en:
Mr. Unurbayar, 30 years old, lives alone in his old house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

Unurbayar has been working as the manager at a private firm since 2011. Five years ago, he came to Ulaanbaatar from the countryside in the hopes of a better future. Over the years, Unurbayar advanced to the top position in his firm from starting out as a basic employee. 

Unurbayar's father is visiting him this winter. So, he is requesting a loan of 2,700,000 MNT to insulate his house using fiberglass and foam and to install vacuum-insulated windows in order to welcome his father into a comfortable and warm place.

loans.use: to insulate his house using fiberglass and foam in preparation for his father's visit

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 50 years old and widowed. She was gifted with five children and they live happily in a rural community. They plant and harvest fruits, vegetables and root crops to generate income. She aims to expand her vegetable plantation and increase her production, but she has limited capital. 

For this reason, Corazon would like to access additional capital of PHP 5,000 to buy certified seeds, fertilizers and insecticides for her vegetable production. Through hard work and strong determination, she believes that she will be able to increase her production and income.

loans.use: to buy certified seeds, fertilizers and insecticides for her vegetable production

loans.name: Mery Cris

texts.en:
Mery Cris is 24 years old and married with two children. Mery Cris works very hard to provide for them.

Mery Cris runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. Mery Cris has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, snack foods and other items. 

In the future, Mery Cris would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Criste

texts.en:
Criste is 35 years old and has three children.  She is married and has three children who are in school.

Criste is in the agricultural business and farms vegetables in the Philippines. Criste requested a 7000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Criste has been farming vegetables for nine years.

In the future, Criste would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Natalia

texts.en: A loan of $800 has been offered to Natalia to improve her business. She has a kiosk in her house. She is taking a loan from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants used to buy additional supplies to keep in her kiosk, such as sugar, coffee, salt, aqua, eggs, candies, biscuits, milk and other things to sell. She has been involved in business activities since 2007 when she started with her own working capital of $200. She hopes to open a bigger store in the future, to manage her business well and to increase her income in the future.

loans.use: To buy sugar, coffee, salt, aqua, eggs, candies, biscuits, milk and other things to sell.

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en:
Abdallah is a 29-year-old married man from Khanyounis. He lives with his wife and three kids - one son and two daughters. He works as an employee in the public sector where he earns a low income. This income barely covers all the family needs. Abdallah would like to improve the family income by beginning work as a rickshaw driver.

Abdallah took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new rickshaw to start working on it. By taking this loan, Abdallah will be able to improve his income and buy all the needed stuff for his family. 

Abdallah appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en: Marcela is 41 years old and has five children. They live in a rural community planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables to sell. Due to the hardship of living, she aims to plant more vegetables, fruits and root crops to sell and make more income. Because she has inadequate capital, she would like to access financial assistance from Kiva lenders amounting to 5,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and herbicides to sustain her crop production. Being a patient and hard-working mother, she believes that she will increase her production and income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides to sustain her crop production.

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en: Marietta is 64 years old and a widow with seven children. Marietta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 20,000 PHP  loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. Marietta has borrowed and repaid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has run the general store for 34 years and also earns an income from food vending. Marietta aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Bebe

texts.en: Bebe is 45 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them. Bebe runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like cereals, canned goods, detergent soap, shampoo, soft drinks and other groceries to sell. She has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items. Bebe would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like cereals, canned goods, detergent soap, shampoo, soft drinks and other groceries to sell

loans.name: Santina

texts.en: Santina is requesting a loan of $1,500 from Tuba Rai Metin to add to her working capital to buy additional supplies to keep in her store, including candles, books, biscuits, aqua, sauce, soy sauce, sugar, salt, cooking oil, milk, perfume, coffee, soft drinks and other things to sell. She is married with one child. She has been doing business since 2008 with her own working capital of $500. Her place of business is in the center of the market, so many people come to it. She is taking a loan from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to open a big store in the future.
