loans.use: To buy candles, books, biscuits, aqua, sauce, soy sauce, sugar, salt, cooking oil, milk, perfume, coffee, soft drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Xayal

texts.en:
Xayal is 28 years old, married, and a father of two kids. The source of the family’s income is gardening. He has been working in this field for five years and has good experience. His monthly income is 200 AZN.

Xayal raises seasonal vegetables such as cucumbers, pumpkins, onions, greens, tomatoes and potatoes, and then sells them at a local bazaar. But he has a problem with water because every time he needs to get water from a neighbor. For this reason he is asking for a loan of 1,000 AZN so that he can obtain a water pump to irrigate and expand his crops.

He is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their support, he will be able to buy a water pump.

loans.use: to buy a water pump.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing a larger amount of clothes.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a responsible mother who supported her husband in gaining income. She is 48 years old and blessed with eight children. 

Due to the hardship of living, Anita and her husband help each other in planting and harvesting vegetables and root crops for sale. They want to expand their vegetable plantation but they have limited capital. For this reason, she would like to get a loan of 5,000.00 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy fertilizers and herbicides needed to sustain their crops. Having this financial assistance, they believe that they will be able to expand their plantation and increase their production.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides needed to sustain her crops.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en: Arlyn is married with two children. She has been helping her husband working on their own farm to earn a living. For over nine years, the farm has been doing well and she had repaid successfully her previous loan used for farming. Though earning well from her farm, she still needs financial assistance to improve it because her income was used for their daily needs and school expenses. Recently, she took a new loan from GDMPC to buy fertilizer and organic pesticides. She wants to improve their farm in order to earn more income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and organic pesticides.

loans.name: Luiza

texts.en:
Luiza is a 31-year-old hardworking woman from the village of Doesi, in Kaspi district. She lives with her husband, who works in emergency services and has a fixed salary. At a young age, Luiza was unable to get a high education and that's one of the reasons why she couldn't find a stable job. 

To get her own income and somehow increase her family's living conditions, Luiza decided to open general store in her yard. She requested a loan from local financial institutions. The Start Up program created by Kiva and Credo enabled Luiza to get a loan of 3,000 USD and start a trading business.  She will build a store in her yard and purchase stock of merchandise such as groceries and household goods.  

Luiza thinks that the business will be profitable, as it is in a great location and the only business of this kind in the area. After the general store is opened, the family will have more income which will enable them to cover everyday costs as well as expand the business in the future. With the support of the Start Up program, Luiza will get an opportunity to be involved in her own business and tackle the financial difficulties.

loans.use: to build general store in her yard and generate her own income.

loans.name: Waridi Group

texts.en:
Amina, who is in her mid 30s, is single with two children - twins who are still small. She has been a food vendor for five years now. She works from 5am to midnight daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Amina's eighth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her food stock. She used to sell up to 12 noon but now she has a good level of stock, so she can sell more food to more customers. She has repaid all her loans successfully. She is really happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva lenders for their support. She used the profit to take care of her kids (as a single parent); she bought a TV set, a deck, a sofa set, a radio and connected her TV decoder. She also covered household expenses. She will use this loan to buy food cooking ingredients to meet her customers' demands. She dreams of sending her children to good schools.

Amina will share this loan with her loan group, Waridi, which consist of seven members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for cooking food.

loans.name: Simba Group

texts.en:
Simba is a group of four women entrepreneurs who joined together and approached Tujijenge Tanzania, Kiva's partner, to look for business support. Mwajuma is in her mid twenties, not married and has one kid who is in school. She has been supporting her family by running a food selling business commonly known as Mamalishe. She has been in this business since 2013.  By working from 8am to 4pm each working day, she is able to make a good monthly profit.

Mwajuma is requesting for her first credit to be apportioned among Simba's four group members. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. 

She will invest her portion of loan to buy Mamalishe cooking items including rice, sugar, liters of cooking oil, sacks of charcoal, meat and other vegetables. In the coming years, she would like to be a successful mother who owns her own house and can provide better schooling to her child.

loans.use: to buy cooking items including rice, sugar, liters of cooking oil, sacks of charcoal, meat and other vegetables.

loans.name: Al Wafaa 1 Group

texts.en:
Soumal is the featured borrower for Al Wafaa 1 group. She got together with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Soumal is a 41-year-old married mother of two children who opened a supermarket 3 years ago to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family. Today, with the acquired loan, Soumal wants to expand her business through increasing her business merchandise. She will offer special products for encouraging prices, in addition to special autumn and winter requested items.

With respect to the other group members, Andrina is a 19-year-old single lady who works as a tutor at her house and wants to pay the fees of her university, while Hiba is a 22-year-old single woman who works as beauty products saleswoman and wants to increase her merchandise with new released items.

Soumal is the lady at the right, Andrina is the lady at the left, and Hiba is the lady standing in the middle.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise to offer special products for encouraging prices.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 56 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Merlinda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Merlinda has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future Merlinda would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Sumber Tanjung Group

texts.en:
Sumber Tanjung group are very grateful that they passed through the loan period with success. While raising their pigs, no problems found. The pigs grew big and healthy. They could be sold at a satisfactory price. Sumber Tanjung members intend to continue borrowing through MUK because, in addition to providing loans, MUK also provides training and consulting veterinarians for free.

Ni Ketut managed to sell the piglets for a satisfactory price and her fish selling business also gives her income. She earns 150.000 IDR profit per piglet. The advantage is that she could save to expand the business. She hopes that MUK will always accompany the group until all members can be independent.

To continue the effort and increase the number of pigs, the Sumber Tanjung group went to the next loan, for the same amount as the previous loan. These loans were used to purchase piglets, especially a superior species. Pig breeding businesses can help increase their family incomes because of easy maintenance and can be used as additional work. Two of the members couldn't attend the meeting because they had a religious ceremony at the temple. 

Ni Ketut used her loan to purchase superior piglets, and also as capital for her fish selling business.

The Sumber Tanjung group hopes this effort will be more advanced so they could save money and send their children to high levels of education.

loans.use: to purchase superior piglets, and also as capital for her fish selling business

loans.name: Halva

texts.en:
Halva is a 52-year-old married woman from a village near Bethlehem City. She is a mother of two young sons. Halva has her own business which is a workshop for painting on glass. She is very talented and well known in her area.

Halva took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy raw materials for her artistic workshop like paints and glass. By taking this loan, Halva will be able to increase her productivity and also her income.
 
Halva appears in the photo in her workshop

loans.use: to buy raw materials like paints and glass for her artistic workshop.

loans.name: Barham

texts.en:
Barham is a 26-year-old married man from Khan Younis. He lives with his wife and three kids: one son and two daughters. He works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs. Barham would like to improve the family's income by start working using a rickshaw. 

Barham took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new rickshaw to start working with it. By taking this loan, Barham will be able to improve his income and by all the needed stuff for his family. Barham appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw to start working with it.

loans.name: Ziwatuwe Group

texts.en:
Ziwatuwe is a group of ten women who have entrepreneurial spirits, and together they approached Kiva's partner Tujijenge Tanzania to find loan support. Fatuma is one of the group members and she is in her early twenties, not married, and she has one child who is in kindergarten. 

She has been supporting her family by running a food selling business common known as Mamalishe. She has been in this business since 2012.  By working from 6am to 8pm each working day, she is able to realize a good monthly profit. Fatuma is requesting for her first credit to be apportioned among the ten members of Ziwatuwe group. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. She will invest her portion of the loan to replenish her store with rice, beans, sugar, and cooking oil for her business. In the coming years, she would like to manage a hotel.

loans.use: to replenish her store with rice, beans, sugar, and cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Florepis

texts.en:
Florepis is a married woman from Leyte, Philippines. She has been engaged in a hog raising business for more than 15 years now. This is the source of her income.

Florepis is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and animal feed. With this, she will be able to raise healthy pigs which she can sell to the market after a few months. In the future, Florepis hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en:
Emerita is driven by passion in selling. At the age of 40 and married, she runs a store that primarily supports their family. Everyday, she never gets tired of tending her store. 

Emerita is a full fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She religiously paid her obligations without records of default. Now, she borrowed another loan to pay for inventories of  sugar, milk, oil, and noodles to sell. Having enough inventories would mean income opportunities. 

In the future, she dreams of sustaining her store to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for inventories of  sugar, milk, oil, and noodles to sell.

loans.name: Jhon Alexander

texts.es:
Jhon un joven de 23 años lleno de ganas de progresar, trabaja como vendedor de mercancía y aprendió gracias a su anterior jefe quien le dio la oportunidad de trabajar le enseño el oficio y lo motivo para ser independiente. 
Ya como independiente tiene mayores responsabilidades pero hay algo que lo motivo su familia su madre, quien le proporciona fuerza y siempre le aconseja sonreír por esa mujer Jhon trabaja incansablemente para ayudar a s madre quien durante su vida lo alimento, le brindo estudio y buenos valores. 
Quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de mercancía en ropa de hombre y dama como jeans, camisas, camisetas, blusas buscando ofrecerlas a todo lugar que pueda llegar. 
Su sueño es posicionarse en el sector, ayudar con los gastos familiares y seguir creciendo como independiente.
texts.en:
Jhon, a young man 23 years old who is eager to make progress, works selling merchandise.  He learned to do this thanks to his previous boss who gave him the chancce to work, taught him the requirements of the job,  and motivated him to become independent.

Now running his own business he has more responsibilities but this is something his family has given him motivation to do. His mother enourages him and always counsels him to smile.  John works tirelessly to help his mother who has fed him, offered him an education and good values in life.

Jhon wants to ask for a loan to buy merchandise to sell: men's and women's clothing such as jeans, shirts, t-shirts, and blouses, seeking to offer them for sale at every place he can.  His dream is to position himself in this business in his neighborhood, help with the household costs and continue growing independently.

loans.use: to buy clothing for men and women, such as jeans, shirts, t- shirts,  and blouses as merchandise to sell

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
Florentina is 48 years old and married with eight children two of whom in school.  She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc., to sell.

Florentina has been in this business for one year. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc., to sell

loans.name: Radwan

texts.en:
Radwan is a 32-year-old married father of two children, a Palestinian refugee who lives and works in a Palestinian refugee camp.
Due to the low social and financial situations of the refugees in Lebanon especially those who live in camps, and their limited work access, Radwan decided four years ago to work in transportation business, through transporting employees by his car to increase his income and thus cover the needs and expenses of his family.
He used to work in orange planting business, but he prefers to run his own business, although his current business is limited inside the camp.
Radwan is now acquiring a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to make necessary maintenance to his car which is the only source of income for his family, as he hopes to improve his business and provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to make necessary maintenance to his car which is the only source of income for his family

loans.name: Terry

texts.en:
Terry is 39 years old and married with three children.  With three children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc., to sell .

Terry has been in this business for three years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc., to sell

loans.name: Charlene

texts.en:
Charlene works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for one year now.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Charlene would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in the market

loans.name: Emy

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Emy works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Emy is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Emy has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: San Jose De Yunguyo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SAN JOSE DE YUNGUYO” iniciará el vigésimo octavo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Jimena es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: artesana en abarcas, venta de ropa, artesana en tejido, venta de zapatos, venta de corte y mantas, carpintería, tienda de barrio.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Jimena es integrante, ella indica que hace cuatro años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de invitación de una cuñada que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de elaboración de abarcas; da a conocer que este negocio lo conocía anteriormente, ya que su esposo trabajaba en este negocio ante de que se casen, posteriormente ella aprendió el oficio y decide ampliar el negocio familiar.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de llantas usadas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de las ferias de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece la institución y el compartimiento con sus compañeras.
texts.en:
The group B.C. "SAN JOSE DE YUNGUYO" begins the twenty-eighth cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Pan American Center Group.  The group consists of eight members and is headed by a board where Mrs. Jimena is the President. The members of the community association are involved in a variety of businesses including: artisan sandals, selling clothing, fabric crafts, selling shoes, selling fabrics and blankets, carpentry, and a neighborhood store.

The loan requested benefits micro-entrepreneurs where Mrs. Jimena is integral.  She says that she has been a member for four years of Pro Woman.  She joined because of the invitation from a sister-in-law who is a customer of the group.  Today she has a business making sandals. This is a business in which she has experience because her husband worked in this business before they got married.  Subsequently, she learned the craft and decided to expand the family business.
 
The loan will bring more capital (buying used tires wholesale) to acquire wholesale at markets in the City of El Alto and then to sell in her retail space. This work allows her to generate income to support her family, as she is married and has three children.

When you ask what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says she likes the training offered by the institution and sharing with colleagues.

loans.use: to purchase used tires wholesale.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 40 years old, married and had four children. Two are studying in college. Her spouse is a government employee, while she manages a retail store. They both engaged in a business to gain income for the family’s expenses. 

Rosemarie wanted to buy more grocery items to sell, but had insufficient capital; that is why she is now asking for a loan of 7,000 Philippines pesos to buy sardines, biscuits, eggs, sugar and soft drinks to sell. Someday, with good profits, she will continue improving her sales and profits as well.

loans.use: to buy sardines, biscuits, eggs, sugar and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: San Francisco Group

texts.es:
El comité está conformado por 18 mujeres inspiradas por un progreso digno y mejoramiento de la calidad de vida de cada una de ellas y de sus familias. Están consciente que para el logro del éxito total se debe al esfuerzo y trabajos constantes enfrentando la rutina del día a día.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Sonia, ella demuestra siempre una actitud positiva dedicándose a su labor de todos los días en la elaboración de frazadas, hamacas esta mejorando su nivel de ingresos por medio de ese trabajo.
Solicita de este préstamo para la compra hilos, tejedores y bastidores para poder seguir con la elaboración de las hamacas y frazadas, para poder seguir con su trabajo y venta como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The committee is comprised of 18 inspirational women who work for decent progress and improving the quality of life of each of them and their families. They are aware that achieving overall success is due to the constant effort and work facing the daily routine.

One of the members is Sonia.  She always demonstrates a positive attitude and is dedicated to their work every day to make blankets and  hammocks.  Thus she is improving their income through this work.

They are asking for this loan to buy yarn, looms and racks to continue with the development of hammocks and blankets.  In this manner, they can continue their work and selling.

loans.use: to buy yarn, looms and racks.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en: Michelle is a fish vendor and a responsible mother who lives at Piat with her spouse and young child. She is now 34 years old. In her stall, Michelle sells fish and gains just enough income to revolve in her business. Michelle had the determination to improve her business, so she needs additional capital of 7,000 Philippines pesos. She will buy different fish (milk fish and mud fish) to sell. Someday, she hopes to keep increasing her merchandise so she can save funds for the family’s future expenses.

loans.use: to buy different fish (milk fish and mud fish) to sell

loans.name: Emelinda

texts.en:
Emelinda lives at Piat with her spouse and young child. She is a retail store owner, while her spouse is a tricyle driver. Emelinda revolves her income in her retail store and for the family’s daily consumption of meals. 

To improve her business, she needs additional capital of 7,000 Philippines pesos to buy assorted groceries (canned goods, sugar, noodles, soap, and soft drinks) to sell. With a good flow of income, she will attain income stability someday.

loans.use: to buy assorted groceries (canned goods, sugar, noodles, soap, and soft drinks) to sell

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a cultured seaweed business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 16,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase additional seaweed, rope, etc., for her cultured seaweed business.

Rosemarie has been in this business for 10 years. Rosemarie earns additional income from fishing.

Rosemarie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional seaweed, rope, etc.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a cultured seaweed business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy more seaweed to be cultured for her business.

Ruth has been in this business for four years. Ruth earns additional income from fishing.

Ruth has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy more seaweed to be cultured

loans.name: Irma

texts.en: Irma is a 48-year-old married woman with a grown-up child. She is a vegetable vendor and a retail store owner. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to invest in her business. She will buy more vegetables, sardines, eggs, biscuits and soft drinks to sell. This will help increase her merchandise and gain good profits as well.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables, sardines, eggs, biscuits and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe BENKADI 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 44 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à GUELEKORO, un des villages de la commune de SAN cercle de SAN  de la  4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur 5ème prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : le riz avec FATOUMATA, femme assise au milieu  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir : 2 hectares. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à SAN, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 32 000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group “BENKADI 1” are married women, who average 44 years of age and six children each, all living in traditional families in GUELEKORO, a village in Commune de SAN, Cercle de SAN (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their fifth loan with the institution. The past loans were indeed paid back. 

The crop grown is rice, as is the case with FATOUMATA (the woman sitting in the middle in the photo). With her loan, she intends to purchase farm inputs, seeds, and tools and to pay for plowing to maintain:  2 hectares. 

After harvest, the produce is sold to men and women customers in the village and in SAN. She plans on making an average profit of 32,000 francs CFA per planting enabling her to pay back her loan and also to help out her husband in covering day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, farm inputs, tools, and seeds

loans.name: Benkadi 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe BENKADI 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à GUELEKORO, un des villages de la commune de SAN cercle de SAN  de la  4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage.

La spéculation cultivée est : le riz avec FATOUMATA, 1ère femme assise de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir : 1 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à SAN, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 29 000FCFA en fin de campagne.

The past loans were indeed paid back. 

The crop grown is rice, as is the case with FATOUMATA (the woman sitting first from the left in the photo). With her loan, she intends to purchase farm inputs, seeds, and tools and to pay for plowing to maintain:  1 hectare. 

After harvest, the produce is sold to men and women customers in the village and in SAN. She plans on making an average profit of 29,000 francs CFA at the end of the planting season. This profit will enable her to pay back her loan and also to help out her husband in covering day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, farm inputs, tools, and seeds

loans.name: Benkadi 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe BENKADI 4 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans, 2 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à GUELEKORO, un des villages de la commune de SAN cercle de SAN  de la  4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur 5ème prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : le riz et l’arachide avec BAH, 2ème femme debout de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir : 2 hectares. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à SAN, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 32 000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

The ten members of the group “BENKADI 4” are married women, who average 30 years of age and two children each, all living in traditional families in GUELEKORO, a village in Commune de SAN, Cercle de SAN (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their fifth loan with the institution. The past loans were indeed paid back. 

The crops grown are rice and peanuts, as is the case with BAH (the woman sitting second from the left in the photo). With her loan, she intends to purchase farm inputs, seeds, and tools and to pay for plowing to maintain:  2 hectares. 

After harvest, the produce is sold to men and women customers in the village and in SAN. She plans on making an average profit of 32,000 francs CFA at the end of the planting season. This profit will enable her to pay back her loan and also to help out her husband in covering day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, farm inputs, tools, and seeds

loans.name: Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe BENKADI 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à GUELEKORO, un des villages de la commune de SAN cercle de SAN  de la  4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur 5ème prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : le riz avec MASSITA, 1ère femme assise de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.

Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their fifth loan with the institution. The past loans were indeed paid back. 

The crop grown is rice, as is the case with MASSITA (the woman sitting first from the left in the photo). With her loan, she intends to purchase farm inputs, seeds, and tools and to pay for plowing to maintain:  1 hectare. 

After harvest, the produce is sold to men and women customers in the village and in SAN. She plans on making an average profit of 28,000 francs CFA at the end of the planting season. This profit will enable her to pay back her loan and also to help out her husband in covering day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, farm inputs, tools, and seeds

loans.name: Fatou's Group

texts.fr:
Créé le 17 Juillet 2006, ce banc villageois vient d’entamer son seizième cycle dans le programme malgré les difficultés dans l’écoulement de leurs marchandises vu l’enclavement de la zone. Les femmes maîtrisent les caractéristiques du crédit et de l’épargne de CAURIE-MF. Elles vivent toutes dans le même village et il existe une bonne entente au sein du groupe. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Fatou (assise à droite et en médaillon vers le bas toujours à droite) est la représente du groupe. Elle est âgée de 52 ans, est mariée et mère de 05 enfants dont 02 filles. Son activité consiste à l’achat, auprès des grossistes en commune de denrées alimentaires (oignons, bouillons culinaires, sucre,  thé vert et du poisson fumé,..)  et la revente au détail dans son village. 

Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter un  sac de sucre, des sacs d’oignon, un panier de poisson fumé, du thé vert et divers bouillons culinaires destinés à la revente au détail.

Les bénéfices lui serviront d’aider son mari dans la gestion quotidienne de la famille et la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
Created on July 17, 2006, this ’banc villageois’ has just started its 16th cycle in the program despite the difficulties in selling their merchandise, since the area is isolated. The women are mastering aspects of borrowing and saving at CAURIE-MF. They all live in the same village, and the group has good internal relations. Their main work involves small-scale commerce. 

Ms. Fatou (sitting at the right and appearing in the cameo near the bottom right in the photo) is the group’s representative. She is 52 years old and a married mother of five children, of whom two are girls. Her business involves buying from wholesalers grocery items (onions, bouillon cubes, sugar, green tea, smoked fish, …) and reselling the goods retail in her village. 

With this loan, she intends to purchase a bag of sugar, sacks of onions, a basket of smoked fish, some green tea, and various bouillon cubes for sale at the retail level. The profits will be used to help out her husband in managing the family day to day and in covering the children’s schooling costs.

loans.use: to purchase a bag of sugar at 22,000 francs CFA, 2 bags of onions at 8,500 francs, a basket of smoked fish at 9,000 francs, some green tea, and various bouillon cubes at 10,000 francs

loans.name: Flor De Maria Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE MARÍA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Angélica es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de empanadas, salón de peluquería, venta de jugos de quinua, venta de frutas, librería, venta de lubricantes.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Angélica es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicia por decisión propia al contar con un pequeño capital y la habilidad de la cocina decide emprender su negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de verduras por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de las ferias de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene tres hijos.  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en: The "Flor de María" group is starting its first loan cycle with Kiva partner Pro Mujer out of its Panamerican headquarters. The group consists of eight members and has a board of directors in which Angélica is the treasurer. The members have various kinds of businesses, such as selling food, selling empanadas, running a beauty salon, selling juices, selling fruits, running a bookstore, and selling motor oils. The loan will help these small businesses make headway, including Angélica's. She says this is her first time working with Pro Mujer, and she joined on the invitation of a friend who already was a member. Currently, Angélica has a business selling food. She decided to start this business on her own with a little capital and her cooking skills. She plans to use the loan to purchase vegetables from wholesale vendors at the city markets in El Alto and later sell the goods at her food stand. This work allows her to generate income to support her family, since she lives with her partner and has three children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Angélica said the health programs the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale vegetables.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
La socia Graciela pertenece al banco comunal VALLECITO, la socia tiene 38 años de edad tiene 03 hijos y es conviviente,la socia se dedica al negocio de libreria,la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a su negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones personales, la socia vende lapiceros, cuadernos entre otros, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca  adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de cuadernos, papeles entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Graciela is a member of the "Vallecito" communal bank. She is 38 years old and has a partner and three children. Graciela has had a stationary shop for some time now and she finds the work satisfying. She sells pens, notebooks and other items. This work allows her to help her family to get ahead. 

Graciela is applying for this loan in order to buy notebooks, paper and more.

Graciela is grateful for this loan and promises to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, paper and more.

loans.name: El Amanecer Group

texts.es:
El grupo  se llama El Amanecer, son  de la ciudad de San Ignacio, ellas son unidas y solidarias entre ellas, trabajan juntas en actividades,  se sienten  muy contentas por formar parte del programa de comités, que les será de mucha ayuda.
La Sra. Eva es una de las personas que integra este grupo, ella se destaca por el trabajo, esfuerzo y dedicación que está poniendo en poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia, ella quiere dar a sus seres queridos todo lo que no pudo tener. Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de hilos, telas, gomas y demás, ya que ella se dedica a la costura y quiere poder seguir con su trabajo y cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
This is the "El Amanecer" group from the city of San Ignacio. The (all women) members are close and care for each other. They work together and are very happy to make up this loan group, which will be of great help to them.

Eva is one member of the group. She is hard-working, dedicated and puts in a lot of effort into improving her and her family's living conditions. Eva wants to give her loved ones the things that she could not have. Eva is applying for this loan in order to buy threads, materials, glue and more as she is a dressmaker and wants to continue with her work and satisfy her customers' needs.

loans.use: to buy threads, materials, glue and more.

loans.name: Galia

texts.es:
Galia es una joven mujer de 19 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos y su negocio es la producción de queso artesanal.
Ella es emprendedora, decidida, constante, responsable y trabajadora. Su labor la realiza en la comunidad ‘Antapata’ que se encuentra ubicado a orillas del lago Titicaca, su clima es frío y los rayos solares bastante fuertes.
Galia es de tez morena, cabello negro largo trenzado, su vestir es típico (manta, pollera y sombrero), su lengua materna es el aymara que utiliza en su hábitat, para el comercio en la ciudad utiliza el español. Su trabajo es la producción de queso artesanal, hace dos años ella trabajaba como empleada y gracias a sus deseos de superación y con ayuda de sus padres realizó la compra de dos vacas lecheras con las cuales inicio su negocio. Sus inicios fueron un poco difíciles, debido a la falta de experiencia, luego logró mejorar el proceso de producción y ahora se encuentra produciendo un queso de buena calidad. Ella vive con sus padres quienes le colaboran en el trabajo y el cuidado de los animales, ella desea aumentar su producción quesera, realizando la compra de una vaca lechera para incrementar la leche y generar mejores ingresos económicos.
Es por esos motivos que Galia solicita un préstamo para la compra de ganado lechero y con los beneficios ayudar a sus padres.
texts.en:
Galia is a young woman of 19 years old. She is single and has no children. She has a business producing artisan cheese.

Galia is enterprising, resolute, persevering, responsible and hard-working. She works in the Antapata community on the banks of Lake Titicaca. Here the climate is cold but the sun is strong.

Galia is dark-skinned, has long, plaited black hair, and wears clothes typical to the region (a blanket, skirt and hat). Her native language is Aymara, which she uses at home. For business in the city, however, Galia speaks Spanish. Galia works producing artisan cheese. Two years ago she was working for another business but, with a desire to do better in life, and with the help of her parents, she managed to buy two dairy cows with which to start her business. In the beginning, work was difficult as Galia did not have much experience. She went on, though, to improve the production process and now makes cheese of excellent quality. Galia lives with her parents who help her with her work and looking after the animals. Galia wants to increase cheese production; she wants to purchase another dairy cow in order to increase milk production and her income.

To do this, Galia is applying for a loan in order to buy dairy cattle and to use her profits to help her parents.

loans.use: to buy dairy cattle and use her profits to help her parents.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
La socia Vilma pertenece al banco comunal VALLECITO, la socia continua con negocio de compra y venta de artesanía, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, la socia, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de chompas entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Vilma belongs to the "Vallecito" communal bank and continues to work at her business buying and selling artisan products. Vilma has had the business for quite some time, and she is satisfied with it both financially and personally. Vilma wants to continue working in order to keep on supporting her family.

Vilma has applied for this loan in order to buy sweatshirts and other items.

Vilma is grateful for this loan and promises to make the repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy sweatshirts and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more used furniture for his store to resell

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
La socia Ruth pertenece al banco comunal VALLECITO, la socia continua con su negocio de venta de artesanía y elaboración de chompas, la socia  lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de chompas entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Ruth belongs to the “Vallecito” communal bank. She continues with her business of selling handicrafts and making sweaters. She has had this business for a while and it gives her both economic and personal satisfaction. She wishes to be able to continue working so that she can continue supporting her family.

She is requesting the loan in order to buy sweaters and other things.

She feels grateful for the loan granted to her and is committed to making her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy sweaters and other things

loans.name: Las Productivas De Pomamaya Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS PRODUCTIVAS DE POMAMAYA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora María es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: producción de leche y venta de comida.
 
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora María es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de producción de leche; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace tres años por el incentivo de su madre, quien trabaja con el mismo productos.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra vaca y forraje) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de su comunidad y posteriormente lo criará en su domicilio. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece la institución
texts.en:
The community association "LAS PRODUCTIVAS DE POMAMAYA" will begin it's first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Central Focus of Copacabana. It is made up of eight members and is headed by a board of directors where María is the president. The businesses that the members of the community association are in are varied. Among them are milk production and food sales.

The loan that they take out will benefit small microenterprises where María is a member. She said that the first time that she joined Pro Mujer, she joined by invitation of a promoter of the institution that came to visit her in her home. Today she has a milk production business. She came to know this business and learned it 3 years ago by incentive from her mother, who works with the same products.

The loan that she will take out now is to increase capital (purchase of a cow and feed) that she will acquire from the wholesale vendors of her community and later raise in her home. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family, as she is single and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy a cow and fodder.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
Mujer emprendedora de 45 años de edad residente en Suchitepéquez, casada con un hijo de 11 años que se dedica a estudiar en la escuela de la comunidad donde viven cursando cuarto primaria,  ella tiene que realizar un esfuerzo enorme para poder mantener a su familia y ver la forma de cómo mejorar el sistema económica de su familia.

El actividad que realiza Dominga es la venta de ropa típica ya que para ella es una fuente importante de ingreso para su familia, para poder mejorar las condiciones de vida que actualmente viven  en su comunidad, ella realiza una segunda actividad que es la venta de incienso, siempre tratando la forma de cómo tener un ingreso económico extra para poder darle a su hijo el estudio que se merece y que algún día llega a ser un profesional en la vida.

El uso respectivo que Dominga le dará al préstamo que ella está realizando es para la compra de más ropa típica para luego venderlas en su comunidad y vecinos para tener un mejor ingreso económico  para ella y su familia.

Una de sus metas futuras es la compra de un local en su comunidad para que ella pueda realizar la venta de su mercadería y ver crecer a su hijo en la escuela y llegar a ser un profesional en la vida y que tenga una condición de vida adecuada.
texts.en:
Dominga, 45, is an entrepreneur living in Suchitepéquez.  She is married and has an 11-year-old son who attends the community school and is in fourth grade.  She makes a huge effort to support her family and find ways to improve the family economy.

Dominga sells traditional clothing as it is an important source of income for the family in order to improve their current living conditions in the community.  She also sells incense to earn extra income to give her son the education he deserves so that he can become a professional in the future.

The loan will be used by Dominga to buy more traditional clothing to be sold in her community to neighbors so she can improve the family's income.

One of her future goals is to buy a shop in her community where she can sell her merchandise.  She also wants to see her son become a professional so he can have a good life.

loans.use: To buy traditional clothing to sell.

loans.name: Xenia Roxana

texts.es:
La socia Xenia Roxana  pertenece al banco comunal VALLECITO, la socia tiene 23 años de edad y tiene 01 hijo, la socia se dedica a la compra y venta de frutas y verduras, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio, la socia vende zanahorias, plátanos entre otros  a todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería como plátanos, zanahorias entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Xenia Roxana is a member of the communal bank VALLECITO.  She is 23 years old and has a son.  She buys and sells vegetables and fruit and has been in business for some time.  She sells carrots and plantains as well as other goods to the customers who order from her.  

Xenia Roxana wants to continue her work so she can support her family.  The loan she is requesting is to buy goods such as plantain, carrots, etc.  She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy goods such as plantains, carrots, etc.

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en:
Abdallah is a 28-year-old married man from Deir el Balah, and is a father of two sons and one daughter. He is an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. After work he goes to sell simple electrical goods at a stall, which helps him to increase the family's income and improve their living conditions.

Abdallah took a loan from FATEN which will help him to buy more electrical goods to re-sell at his stall. By taking this loan, Abdallah will be able to increase his sales and also his income.
 
Abdallah appears in the photo while he was working.

loans.use: to buy more electrical goods to re-sell at his stall.

loans.name: José Dilfido

texts.es:
José de 57 años de edad, se dedica a la agricultura.  Él creció con sus padres quienes le enseñaron esta actividad, su familia esta con formada  por su esposa quien le apoya con los oficios domésticos, ya que sus hijos tienen su hogar aparte.

José se levanta a las 5:30 a.m. para ir a trabajar durante la mañana en la parcela que alquila y durante el resto del día trabaja en otras parcelas o cuidando sus animales.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar dos vacas que le generaran una buena producción de leche, que le ayudara al incremento de sus ingresos para el sustento de su familia 

José planea en un futuro  con ayuda de otro crédito incursionar en la siembra de tomate y chile con el involucramiento de su esposa, podrá obtener un mejor ingreso para su sustento.
texts.en:
José, 57, is a farmer and learned about the activity from his parents.  His family consists of his wife, who takes care of the housework since his children live independently.

José gets up at 5:30 a.m. to go to work on the land he leases.  He works the rest of the day and cares for his livestock.

The loan he is requesting through CREDICAMPO is to buy two dairy cows for milk production so that he can increase the family income.

In the future and with the help of another loan, José plans to plant tomatos and chili peppers with the help of his wife in order to increase their income.

loans.use: To buy two dairy cows to produce milk.

loans.name: Villa Quiquijana Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VILLA QUIQUIJANA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Quiquijana perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis.
La socia es la Sra. Felipa ella es soltera y tiene 63 años y tiene 7 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de restaurant, la socia prepara diferentes platos como pollo con papas, sopas y saltados de carnes, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 10 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como pollo, carne y verduras.
Este préstamo es parte de una de las líneas de crédito de la Asociación Arariwa su nombre es Credi Yapa, esta línea de crédito es otorgado a los prestatarios con buen historial crediticio, siendo este un grupo que cumple dichas características.
 
La persona que sale con la cara tapada no pertenece al banco comunal Villa Quiquijana. 

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de venta de granos, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant. 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank  “VILLA QUIQUIJANA”. This bank is located in the district of Quiquijana of the province Quispicanchis.

The member is Felipa. She is single and is 63 years old and has 7 children. The member works in her restaurant business. She prepares different dishes like chicken with potatoes, soups, and sauteed meat. The member works from 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM. The member already has 10 years in this business and it is going well. Her dream is to grow the restaurant business. The member requests the loanto purchase products to cook such as chicken, beef and vegetables.

This loan is part of a line of credit from the Arariwa Association called Credi Yapa. This line of credit is granted to borrowers with a good credit history, this being a group that complies with all said characteristics.

The person whose face is not shown does not belong to the Villa Quiquijana communal bank.

The other members are in the following businesses: animal sales, grain sales, grocery stores, and restaurants. The member is grateful to those that are part of her dream through these means, and she promises to comply with the payments within the established period.

loans.use: to buy products to cook like chicken, beef, and vegetables.

loans.name: Jonas

texts.en:
Jonas is a 34-year-old married mother of two young children from Leyte, in the Philippines. 

Jonas is engaged in the sale of pre-paid phone and data cards. She also has a small sari-sari (variety store) business selling various goods and items to the people in her area. Jonas is asking for a loan to buy more pre-paid cards, and additional stock for her store, such as canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap, toiletries and gasoline.
 
Jonas believes that through this loan, she will be able to stock more pre-paid cards as well as improve her stock in her store. She dreams of improving their way of living in the future.

loans.use: to buy more pre-paid phone and data cards, and additional stock for her store.

loans.name: Minda

texts.en:
Minda is 56 years old, married and had seven children. Her youngest child is still studying while the rest are already married. Her spouse is a farmer gaining income during the harvest season twice a year.

Minda gets sustenance for the family through her income from the retail store. She is now asking for additional capital of PHP 7,000 to buy groceries such as sugar, coffee and sardines to sell. In the future, if she will get continuous profits, she will achieve economic stability.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as sugar, coffee and sardines to sell.

loans.name: Ni Ketut

texts.en:
Ni Ketut has a business as a clothes seller. She sell many kinds of clothes from baby clothes to adult clothes, and has been in this business for almost five years. Her business is located in a market in the city of Denpasar – Bali. She lives with her husband and one elementary-aged child. Her husband works in business that rents diving equipment in the tourist area at Nusa Dua – Bali.

Ni Ketut needs a loan to increase her business. She will use her loan to purchase various kinds of clothes and shoes. She knows about MUK from her neighbour who already joined MUK’s program. She expects to increase the number of customers that she has. With more stock to sell, Ni Ketut hopes for a better life, more income, and to repay the loan on time, and she hopes she can make her dream come true to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: to purchase various kinds of clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en:
Jihad is a 20-year-old single Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp.

Most Palestinians have limited work access in Lebanon. Five years ago, Jihad started working in a scrap business which he learned from his father, in order to cover his living needs and expenses. Jihad is well known in his region as a hard worker and an ambitious man. 

Today Jihad is acquiring a YOUTH Loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to start his own business, a coffee shop. He hopes to increase his income and improve his social and financial living conditions.

loans.use: to start his own coffee shop.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia is 23 years old and lives in Choma with her sister. She runs her own Zoona mobile money transfer business, and has been in the business for  four years. Leticia loves her business because it has been able to help her pay part of her school fees and make sure she has all school requirements.

She is requesting a Kiva loan to purchase a Zoona branded booth which will help Leticia save on rentals.

This is Leticia’s first Kiva loan. She is grateful for this opportunity and explains that this loan will help her grow her business as she will not have to spend too much on rental costs. She thanks the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a Zoona branded trading booth which she will use to serve her customers.

loans.name: Delisa

texts.en:
Delisa is 30 years old and is married with three children. She is a hard-working entrepreneur who has opearated her Zoona mobile money transfer business since 2012. She lives in Lusaka, Zambia.

Currently, Delisa employs six people to work in her six Zoona mobile money transfer locations. She hopes to employ more people in the future as her business grows. Delisa takes pride in her Zoona business and strives to create an atmosphere that is welcoming to her customers and keeps them coming back. She enjoys the opportunities that comes with being responsible for the success of her business. With Zoona’s platform, Delisa says her business has the competitive advantage of being cheaper, faster and easier to use compared to other businesses offering the same services.

This is Delisa’s fourth loan from Kiva. She got her first loan in June 2013, which she used to purchase a trading booth from where she serves her customers in Mtendere. She has fully repaid the loan. Delisa accessed her second and third loans in November and July 2014. These loans were used to grow her mobile money business by increasing her working capital that she needed to serve her customer base. This helped Delisa to expand her business and open more outlets. Today, Delisa runs six outlets, thanks to Kiva.

Delisa is requesting a Kiva loan to purchase another trading booth so she can open her seventh outlet. She is hopeful that as her business expands, it will enable her to finish her education, as she plans on going back to school.

loans.use: to purchase a trading booth so that she can open her seventh outlet.

loans.name: María Margarita

texts.es:
María de 43 años de edad, es una persona que estudio hasta noveno grado y está acompañada, su compañero de vida se dedica a la agricultura oficio que aprendió de sus padres.

María se levanta junto a su esposo a las 5:00 a.m  para realizar sus actividades diarias que se centran en la agricultura y el cuido del ganado.

María se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura en las parcelas que alquila, oficio que realiza durante la mañana junto a su  esposo e hijos. En el transcurso de la tarde se dedican a ordeñar las vacas y elaborar queso para venderlos entre sus vecinos y alrededores de su residencia.

El préstamo que esta solicitando es para comprar la semilla, abono, pesticidas, etc. Que necesita para sembrar y llegar a obtener una buena cosecha. 

María planea que con los ingresos que obtiene de la venta de queso  y  de la siembra, y con ayuda de sus hijos y su esposo  podrá construir una vivienda digna.
texts.en:
María is 43 years old. She studied until the 9th grade and is in a common-law marriage. Her life partner is in agriculture for a living, which he learned from his parents.

María works together with her spouse starting at 5:00 AM to do the daily activities that are centered around agriculture and caring for the livestock.

María works in agriculture for a living on the plot that she rents, the work she does in the morning together with her husband and her children. During the afternoon she milks the cows and makes cheese to sell to the neighbors and those near her residence.

The loan she is requesting is to buy seed, fertilizer, pesticide etc. that she needs to plant and have a good harvest.

With the income that she receives from the sale of the cheese and the harvest María plans to, with the help of her children and husband, be able to build decent housing.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizer, pesticide, etc. that she needs to plant and have a good harvest.

loans.name: Zaur

texts.en:
Zaur is a 36-year-old married father of one child. He works every day and earns money to cover family’s demands. He has been working on a water project for ten years and has good experience in this area. His monthly income is 150 AZN.

Zaur knows everything about water channels. He knows how to prepare projects for different regions, how to build them and how to keep them in control. Additionally, he takes part in the building of such channels. The team is now building a new irrigation canal for all of the neighboring regions in order to improve living conditions and fruit, vegetable and crops productivity.

He has applied for a loan of 1,200 AZN in order to buy new quality tools for his job and coveralls for his team. This will increase the quality of his team’s work and income.

loans.use: to buy new quality tools for his job and coveralls for his team.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 24-year-old single man from a village near Ramallah city. He lives with his family in a very humble house. Mohammad is an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. He is also a university student where he studies law. He would like to finish his studies and find a better job in the future.

Mohammad took a Murabaha loan from FATEN which will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to do his homework and reports easily.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Ida Ruth

texts.es:
La socia Ida Ruth se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de ropa, la socia vende pantalones, blusas y polos, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un bazar. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar zapatos, polos, chompas, polos y blusas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member Ida Ruth is still in the clothing business for a living. The member sells pants, blouses and polos. The member already has many years in this business and it is going well. Her dream is to have a bazaar. The member is requesting a loan to buy shoes, polos, sweaters and blouses.

The member is happy for the loan and promises to comply with the payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy shoes, polos, sweaters and blouses.

loans.name: Shelly

texts.en:
Shelly is now 32 years old. She continues to run her growing Zoona mobile money transfer business. She would like to thank her lenders for the two previous loans she was given. The loans helped her increase her working capital and purchase a small laptop. This enabled her to serve more customers and earn more profits. Shelly has successfully repaid her first loan and continues to make good repayments on her second loan.

She has been saving most of her profits in order to open two more shops: one in Lusaka’s Kangwa compound and another in Katimamulilo. Shelly is requesting a third Kiva loan, so that she can increase the money she uses to serve her customers at her newly opened Kangwa compound outlet. Shelly says that in the business of mobile money transfers, money is always moving and as such the more customers you have, the more money you need to satisfy them. 

Shelly's new shop sees a lot of customers coming and going. This has the potential to give Shelly a lot of customers, but unfortunately she does not have a big enough working capital float to satisfy them all. With her Kiva loan she hopes to never have to turn away a customer. 

Shelly lives in Lusaka with her mother and four siblings. The profits from her business help her to pay for her sister’s school fees and take care of her family.

loans.use: to increase her working capital so that she can serve more customers at her new shop.

loans.name: Amjad

texts.en:
Amjad is a 20-year-old single man from Khanyounis. He lives with his family in a very humble house. Amjad works in a bakery very long hours so he can provide a good income for his family. He is also a university student where he studies accounting. He would like to finish his studies and find a better job in the future.

Amjad took a Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Amjad will be able to do his homework and reports easily.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Magdalina

texts.en:
Magdalina is a 55-year-old married mother of four children from Leyte in the Philippines. She is a farmer and grows ginger and rice, and is also engaged in a pig raising business. Magdalina has been in the farming business for more than 20 years now.

She is requesting a loan to buy additional piglets and animal feed, and fertilizer for the farm. Through this, she will be able to grow healthy pigs as well as improve her harvest from her farm. In the future, Magdalina hopes of making her business a success. She also wants to save money for school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and animal feed, and fertilizer for the farm.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 27 years old and married. She was gifted with one child and they live happily in a rural community. Being a responsible house wife, she runs a small retail store within their community to help her husband in generating income. 

She wants to improve her business and make it profitable but she has inadequate capital. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000.00 to buy more stock of canned goods, snack foods, beverages, seasonings, laundry soap, candies and soft drinks to re-sell. She hopes that with her loan she will be able to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of canned goods, snack foods, beverages, seasonings, laundry soaps, candies and soft drinks to re-sell.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is 32 years old and a mother of two. She helps her husband in generating income by managing a small retail store. She aims to make her business more viable and profitable in order to earn a higher income and sustain the necessities of her family. 

She wants to acquire more stock of grocery items to resell but she has limited capital. For this reason, she would like to access an additional capital of PHP 7,000.00 to buy more stock of laundry soap, beverages, seasonings, canned goods, noodles, rice, dried fish, eggs and soft drinks to re-sell. Through this loan, she believes that she will be able to make her business grow.

loans.use: to buy more stock of laundry soaps, beverages, seasonings, canned goods, noodles, rice, dried fish, eggs and soft drinks to re-sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a quality dairy cow.

loans.name: Elizah

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Elizah, an ever-smiling young farmer from Kapsowar County in Kenya who has defied the common thinking of most Kenyans about agriculture - that it’s only meant for the older generation. Elizah has been doing mixed farming for the past five years and through those years she has gathered so much experience with the techniques of farming. Through the income from farming she has been able to take care of her family and also provide the basic needs for her children. 

Elizah is a very enterprising woman, and although she never got formal employment, she has always worked hard on her farm and she has always assured her family of a decent meal. The Kapsowar area has favorable conditions for horticulture farming, and that is why she is seeking a loan to start horticulture farming. Because of good roads, a good climate, and a good transportation network, she is sure that she will reap maximum profits and be able to increase her business. Being a woman and accessing funds in Africa is very challenging, but Elizah feels relieved knowing there are institutions such as Kiva that help enterprising women like her. Eliza is much disciplined with finances and she plans that through the accumulated profits she will be able to improve her living conditions and also secure the future of her children.

loans.use: to start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Hermila

texts.en:
Hermila is 58 years old and lives with her husband and two children. She is very responsible with her household obligations and has always been known to provide the best for her family. She is a farmer and plants corn and beans.

Hermila wants to increase sales. Consequently, she has requested a loan that will enable her to purchase seeds, compost and fertilizer, among other items, so that she can continue to put bread on the table in her home.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, compost and fertilizer.

loans.name: Nunu

texts.en:
Nunu is a 33-year-old married woman from Rustavi city. Her husband is temporarily unemployed, and the only breadwinner is Nunu. She sells perfumes, which she purchases at wholesale prices and sells in her community at increased prices. However, the income is really insignificant to cover even basic needs, and they live in poverty.

Nunu has requested a loan so that she can expand her trading into other areas. All of the financial institutions rejected her loan requests because of her unstable financial conditions. After several unsuccessful attempts, Nunu applied for a loan with MFO Credo. Her request was approved in the framework of a start up program, which is joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, permitting the poor people to start or re-start businesses. 

She will have a hired food stall at the local market and will sell various kind of food products. The new activity will help her to get a more stable source of income and somehow make financial stability for her family. Nunu will be grateful for the help and will highly appreciate your kindness.

loans.use: to expand her trading into other areas and increase her income.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Lucia, tiene 46 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos, vive con su hijos en un sector de Cofradía, del Municipio de San Pedro Sula. Hace dos años inicio su propio negocio de pulpería para vender productos de la canasta básica como ser carne de pollo, carne de cerdo, res, granos básicos, azúcar, sal, café, refrescos, papel higiénico, jabón, manteca y churros. Ha solicitado otro préstamo a la institución por un monto de 10,000 lempiras el que invertirá en la compra de productos como azúcar, arroz, frijoles, café, sal, manteca, huevos, carnes y refrescos para aumentar el inventario y ofrecer más productos a sus clientes. Su plan es construir un mejor local solo para el negocio.
texts.en:
Lucia is a 46 year old single mother of two children. She lives with her children in the sector of Cofradia in the city of San Pedro Sula.

Two years ago, she started her own grocery business to sell basic food products, such as chicken, pork, beef, basic grains, sugar, salt, coffee, soda, women's hygienic products, soap, butter, and churros.

She is asking for another loan in the amount of 10,000 lempiras, which she will use to invest in the purchase of products such as sugar, rice, beans, coffee, salt, butter, eggs, beef, and soda in order to grow her inventory and offer more products to her customers. Her plan is to build a better location for her business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, beans, coffee, salt, butter, eggs, meat, and soda to sell at her business

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario de 57 años de edad, padre de 10 hijos de los cuales cinco viven con él y cinco ya tienen sus propias familias, en su casa viven sus hijos y además dos nietos y su esposa por quienes trabaja fuertemente cada día.  Mario no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, su padre era alcohólico y él tenia que trabajar para apoyar a su madre para dar el sostenimiento a sus hermanos. Sus hijos que están con él estudian en la escuela del municipio.

Mario trabaja desde los diez años de edad de jornalero, ayudante de albañil y trabajo por mucho tiempo lavando buses, cuando se caso a los 18 años emprendió a trabajar en las artesanías, hace petates, yaguales de tule, y también vende chatarras, plástico y  mecate. Expresa que fue su madre quien le enseño que había que luchar y no tener miedo a vender chatarras y plásticos que recoge por las calles de la comunidad.

Sale a vender tres días a la semana, viaja hasta la capital del país a vender sus productos y los días que hace las artesanías con el apoyo de sus hijos y de su esposa, también hace el cultivo de maíz y de frijoles para tener el sustento diario y básico en la alimentación de su familia.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar tule, el cual la va ha buscar a los municipios aledaños pues es muy escaso y el resto lo necesita para la compra de abono.

 Mario planea ir mejorando su vivienda, ya que manifiesta que su padre vendió todo el terreno que en ese momento tenían y tuvieron que andar alquilando por mucho tiempo, gracias a los ahorros ha logrado comprar un terreno y construir su vivienda la cual quiere mejorar el techo, y además quiere seguir ayudando a sus hijos a estudiar para que sean unos profesionales en el futuro.
texts.en:
Mario is 47 years old and is the father of 10 children, 5 of whom live with him, along with his wife and two grandchildren. His other 5 children now have their own families. He works hard every day to support his family. Mario never had the opportunity to study: his father was an alcoholic and Mario had to work in order to support his mother and his siblings. The children who live with Mario now are all studying at the local school. 

Mario has worked since the age of 10 as a day labourer, a bricklayer's assistant and he also worked, for a long time, washing buses. When he got married at the age of 18, he learned how to make artisanal crafts, sleeping mats, and padded tule reed rings. He also sells scrap metal, plastic and rope. He says that it was his mother who taught him the importance of fighting to get ahead and not to be afraid of selling the scrap metal and plastic which he collects from the streets in his community.   

Mario travels to the capital city three days a week in order to sell his products. When he is not travelling, he makes the crafts and products, with the help of his children and his wife, and he also grows maize and beans so that his family has their daily staple food.  

The loan, which Mario is asking for from CREDICAMPO, is to buy tule reeds, which he needs to go and find in neighbouring municipalities as they are very scarce, and to buy fertiliser. 

In the future, Mario plans to improve his home. He says that his father sold all the land that had belonged to the family and so they had to rent for a long time. Thanks to Mario's savings, however, he managed to buy some land and build a house, and he now plans to improve the roof. He also wants to continue helping his children to study so that one day they will be professionals.

loans.use: to buy tule reeds, which he needs to go and find in neighbouring municipalities as they are very scarce, and to buy fertiliser.

loans.name: Sonia Marlene

texts.es: Sonia de 32 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos de 12 y 4 años de edad. Ella es una mujer reconocida por su fuerza de voluntad ya que se empeña cada día por sacar adelante a sus hijos apoyada por su esposo y su pequeño negocio de venta de artículos de belleza por catalogo, la cual realiza de forma ambulante en los cantones cercanos. Sonia cuenta con un servicio sanitario abonero en su vivienda, pero ella desea construir un servicio sanitario lavable, para lo que deberá construir una fosa,  por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, hierro y ladrillo para construir una fosa séptica en su vivienda.
texts.en: Sonia is 32 years old. She lives in her own home with her husband and two children, aged 12 and 4. She is a woman who is known for her strength of will because she works hard every day to get her children ahead, helped by her husband and her small business selling beauty items by catalog. She does this as a street vendor in the nearby cantons. Sonia has a composting toilet in her home, but she wants to build a bathroom with plumbing. To do that she has to build a septic tank and she is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, gravel, iron and bricks to build the septic tank for her home.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, iron and bricks to build a septic tank for her home.

loans.name: Rosas De Juan Pablo Group

texts.es:
Elizabeth es una mujer de 44 años de edad, casada, madre de dos niños de 8 y 5 años y una hija de 21 años de edad, su negocio es la venta y comercio de calzados.
