Ella es emprendedora, luchadora, constante, paciente, buena madre, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona 16 de julio, un sitio caracterizado por el comercio en todas las áreas.
Ella es de tez morena, estatura mediana, cabello negro largo, su lengua natal es el aymara y lo utiliza con la gente mayor, para el comercio mayormente habla español. Sus necesidades de superación la han llevado a formar una banca de personas con necesidades parecidas para solicitar un préstamo y poder cumplir sus metas (sentada al medio de las dos mujeres jóvenes, chompa gris con botones grandes). Su trabajo es la venta de calzados desde hace 25 años, trabaja sola porque puede pagar los gastos escolares de sus hijos menores y ayudar a su hija mayor con los gastos de educación superior. Su comercio lo realiza de forma ambulante, en las ferias de su ciudad y ciudades vecinas; cada día se encarga de transportar cajas y sacos llenas de zapatos a diferentes puntos de venta, trabajando toda la jornada del día para regresar a su hogar por la noche. Ella sueña tener un puesto fijo de venta para ya no tener que transportar su mercadería.
Es por esos motivos que Elizabeth solicita un préstamo para la compra de zapatos por mayor y con los beneficios pagar los estudios de sus tres hijos.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 44 year old woman. She is married and the mother of two children, aged 8 and 5, and a 21 year old daughter. Her business is selling shoes. She is enterprising, a fighter, steady, patient, a good mother, responsible and hardworking. She does her business in the 16 de Julio area, a place characterized by all types of commerce. 

She has dark skin, medium height, and long black hair. Her native language is Aymara and she uses it with elderly people. For business, she mostly speaks Spanish. Her need to get ahead has led her to start a bank for people with similar needs to ask for a loan and be able to meet her goals. She is seated between the two young women, wearing a grey sweater with big buttons. Her job has been selling shoes for 25 years. She works alone because she can pay for her younger children's school expenses and help her oldest daughter with her college expenses. She does her selling as a street vendor in the markets of her city and in neighboring cities. Every day she transports boxes and bags full of shoes to her different points of sale, working the whole day long to return home at night. Her dream is to have a permanent sales spot so that she doesn't have to transport her merchandise anymore. 

For these reasons, Elizabeth is asking for a loan to buy shoes wholesale. With the profits, she will pay for her three children's education.

loans.use: to buy shoes wholesale ad with the profits  pay for her three children's education.

loans.name: Elber Andres

texts.es:
Elber es un transportador de personas en el municipio de Dabeiba una localidad donde es muy común el transporte en moto ya que los caminos son complicados y es más barato. 
Elber es una persona muy responsable y preocupada por sus clientes por eso cree que es tiempo de una reposición de moto pues es primero el bienestar de sus pasajeros. 
Quiere solicitar un préstamo para reponer su moto lo cual es muy importante para seguir trabajando y es su única fuente de ingreso y lo más importante seguir velando por el bienestar de sus clientes que ha fidelizado durante el tiempo ofreciendo un servicio oportuno y seguro.
Con la ayuda de este crédito podrá seguir trabajando ya que en el momento para sus servicios pues considera que su moto en cualquier momento puede fallar.
texts.en:
Elber transports people in the city of Dabeiba, where it is very common to have transportation in motorcycle, because the roads are complicated and it is cheaper.  
 
Elber is a very responsible person and he worries about his customers. That is why he thinks it is time to repair his motorcycle because it is important for his passengers' well being. 
 
He wants to ask for a loan to repair his motorcycle, which is very important to keep working. It is his only source of income and the most important thing is to keep ensuring his customers' well being. He has gained their loyalty during the time he has been offering his timely and safe service. With the help of this loan he can continue working because now he thinks that at any moment, his motorcycle could break down.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle, which is vital to ensure his passengers' well being.

loans.name: Natia

texts.en:
Natia, who is a 26-year-old young woman, lives in Kaspi district. She has a husband who works in the ministry and has a fixed salary. Natia is employed in a private confectionery. She is a cashier and generates 90 GEL monthly.

To increase her productivity and generate more salary, Natia plans to open her own confectionery and lead the business herself. She has really good experience in this kind of activity and will do her best for success. Natia's credit request was approved within the start-up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo that gives a chance for people to start their own businesses. So, Natia plans to purchase all the needed ovens and merchandise and start serving clients. She will also get private orders and will always have fresh and tasty baked products.
 
The loan will be a great help for this motivated woman and her family, as she will be able to increase her income significantly and improve the living conditions of her family. Natia awaits your support.

loans.use: To open her own confectionery and increase productivity

loans.name: Simfroso

texts.en:
Simfroso is 39 years old and very responsible with his household obligations. He currently lives with his wife and two children. He is a farmer who plants corn and beans.

Simfroso wants to increase sales. Consequently, he has requested a loan that will enable him to pay for land preparation and labor. He deeply wishes to continuously support his family.

loans.use: To pay for land preparation and labor.

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Estela works hard to support her family.

She has a farming of vegetables business in the Philippines and earns additional income from making nipa roofs.  Estela is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies for her farming vegetables business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Estela has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seed, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
María es una señora de 40 años, vive con sus 4 hijos, está separada de su ex conviviente, ya que a veces creemos estar junto a la persona indicada pero la convivencia mutua nos muestra aquellos detalles que pasan desapercibidos a primera vista, comenta María; actualmente María vive con sus hijos, en la cooperativa Ucom 1, perteneciente a la ciudad de Santo Domingo, dirección en la que tiene ubicado su negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de comida rápida como: Papas fritas con pollo, salchi papas, hamburguesas, hot dogs, entre otros,  además con el fin de obtener otro ingreso tiene un departamento que lo arrienda, a una familia que lleva un par de años viviendo allí.
María ha ganado fama en el sector en el que radica gracias a que los productos que ofrece son de gran calidad y deliciosos esto la han llevado a progresar; hoy en día ella busca acceder a un crédito para adecuar su negocio y acude a nosotros buscando el apoyo que ofrece la Fundación; comenta María, logrando su objetivo ella está muy agradecida con nosotros y con proyecto Kiva quienes están haciendo que sus objetivos de superación personal y laboral se cumplan.
texts.en:
María is a 40 year old woman. She is separated from her ex, because sometimes we think we are with the right person, but living together shows us the details that go unnoticed at first sight, María says. Right now, María lives with her children in the Ucom 1 cooperative in the city of Santo Domingo. That is where she has her business. She sells fast food, such as chicken with french fries, salchipapas, hamburgers, hot dogs, and more. Also, in order to have another source of income, she has an apartment that she rents out. For a couple of years, a family has been living there.   

María has become known in her area where she lives thanks to the products she offers. They are of great quality and delicious. This has made her progress. Today she is seeking to access a loan to equip her business. She has come to us seeking the support offered by the Foundation. María, says that by achieving her goal, she is very grateful to us and the Kiva project for making her personal and work goals be met.

loans.use: to equip her business.

loans.name: Segundo Jesus

texts.es:
Segundo Jesús tiene 40 años de edad, es conviviente, vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos, en casa propia, en una comunidad pequeña en la zona rural de Cayaltí y goza con buenas referencias personales y laborales de parte de sus vecinos. Su comunidad se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio; y está ubcia en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Segundo Jesús se dedica a la actividad de crianza y venta de cerdos, desde hace más de 7 años de antigüedad en el negocio, el mismo que está ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Segundo Jesús solicita préstamo para la compra de cerdos y alimento de engorde para los mismos. De esta manera hacer crecer su negocio, obtener más ingresos, mejorando sus ganancias y de esta forma poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Segundo Jesús is 40 years old. He lives with his wife and three children in a house of their own located in a small village, in the rural area surrounding Cayaltí. The Cayaltí district is in the Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru. Locals work in agriculture and commerce. Segundo Jesús has good work and personal references.

Segundo Jesús has been working raising and selling pigs in his backyard for more than seven years. He is requesting a loan to buy pigs and feed for them. In this way, he will expand his business and his income will increase, so he will be able to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed for them.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.es:
Rogelio de 45 años de edad, se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería. Él creció con sus padres quienes le enseñaron esta actividad.

Rogelio se levanta a las 4:00 a.m. junto a su esposa para ir a trabajar durante la mañana en la parcela que alquila y durante el resto del día cuida sus animales y su esposa se dedica a vender la leche  en los alrededores de su vivienda.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar una novilla que necesita para en un futuro producir más leche y así poder empezar a elaborar lácteos como queso, crema ya que la leche no es suficiente para hacerlos y al lograrlo podrá incrementar sus ingresos para el sustento de su familia.

Rogelio planea en un futuro incursionar en sembrar cacao y con ayuda de otro crédito espera lograrlo con el involucramiento de su esposa podrá obtener un mejor ingreso para su sustento.
texts.en:
Rogelio is 45 years old. He works in farming and ranching. He grew up with his parents, who taught him this activity.

Rogelio gets up at 4:00 a.m. with his wife to go to work in the morning at the land parcel he rents. For the rest of the day, he cares for his animals and his wife works selling the milk in the areas near their home.  

The loan he is asking CREDICAMPO for is to buy a heifer he needs so that in the future it can produce more milk and he can begin to make dairy products such as cheese and cream. There isn't enough milk right now to make those things and this way he can increase his income to support his family. 

In the future, Rogelio plans to get into growing cacao and with the help of the other loan, he hopes that with his wife's involvement he can get better income to support the home.

loans.use: to buy a heifer so in the future it will produce more milk villa and he can start making dairy products such as cheese and cream.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a hardworking mother. At the age of 49, she runs a small sari-sari store in Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur. 

Jocelyn wants to increase sales. Consequently, she has requested a loan that will enable her to restock the store with basic commodities, among other items, so that she can continue to put bread on their table.

loans.use: to restock store with basic commodities.

loans.name: Cheptoo

texts.en:
Hello world, meet Cheptoo. She is a brilliant Kalenjin smallholder farmer from Kabuswo location in North Rift, Kenya. She has been blessed to have a husband and two lovely children. 

For five years, she has been keeping cows and selling milk at the local market to make a decent living for her family. She also keeps poultry, but milk has been her primary income source. 

Cheptoo is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. This move sets out to commercialize poultry farming. The broods of hens she will acquire with the loan investment will lay more eggs that will be sold to hotels, restaurants and public institutions. 

With your loan, Cheptoo is assured to make more income since the demand for and the price of chicken products is always on the rise. The money she makes from this investment will help her to pay for the high family-related expenses that take up most of her income.

When Cheptoo was asked how the loan would impact her family, she replied, “It will bring food security and school fees.”

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas is 46 years old, married and has four children. Two are already finished with school, while the rest are still studying. 

She is managing a store for income while her spouse works at a local government unit. They worked hard in order to improve their income. 

Felicitas needs additional capital to buy more merchandise to sell in her store. So she is now asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, noodles, sugar, coffee and soft drinks to sell. In the future, Felicitas wants to keep increasing her income for the education of her children. 

Felicitas will be happy and proud to see all her children become professionals someday.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, sugar, coffee and softdrinks to sell.

loans.name: Serpil

texts.en:
Serpil is married and the mother of two children. She began her career 24 years ago as a hairdresser’s trainee. She advanced to become a qualified hairdresser, certified hairdressing instructor and finally a master hairdresser. 

After this long period of training, Serpil opened her own salon. She began with a small shop. In time, her customers increased and she opened a larger salon. Now she runs her own salon and trains new hairdressers. 

With the loan from Maya, Serpil will buy hair dye wholesale so the price will be lower and she can earn more profits. She has a hardworking and determined character, and her biggest dream is to open a bigger salon and pass her skills and training on to more young people.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Serpil Hanım evli ve iki çocuk annesi. İş hayatına 24 yıl önce kuaförde çıraklık yaparak başlamış. Daha sonra kalfalık,ustalık ve usta öğretici olarak kendini geliştirmiş.  Serpil Hanım uzun süren bu eğitimlerden sonra kendi kuaför dükkanını açmış.  Önce çok küçük bir dükkanla işe başlamış.  Zaman içinde müşteri sayısı artınca daha büyük bir dükkan açmış. Şu an Serpil hanım hem kendi dükkanını işletiyor hem de bu dükkanda usta öğreticilik yaparak kendi gibi kuaförler yetiştiriyor. Serpil hanım Maya dan aldığı kredi ile toptan saç boyası alıyor. Böylece bu boyaları daha ucuza alarak karını artırıyor. Çalışkan ve azimli bir yapıya sahip olan serpil hanımın en büyük hayali daha büyük bir dükkan açmak ve daha çok genci iş ve meslek sahibi yapmak.

loans.use: to buy hair dye.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is a 46-year-old married woman and a mother of a 5-year-old child from Leyte, Philippines. 

She is engaged in hog-raising and poultry businesses. These are the sources of her income.

Fe is asking for a loan to buy more piglets and chicks to raise. With this she will be able to improve her hog-raising and poultry businesses and make them more profitable. Fe also wants to save money for the school expenses of her child.

loans.use: to buy more piglets and chicks to raise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase new furniture designs and with the profits, pay her three children's expenses.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is driven by a passion for selling. At the age of 48, a married woman in Culo, Molave, she runs a store that primarily supports their family. 

She never gets tired tending her store and at the same time she buys and sells palay (unhusked rice). Fe is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She religiously repaid her obligations without records of default. 

Now she has borrowed another loan to buy inventories of sugar, milk, oil, and noodles to sell and pay for bags of palay. Having enough inventories would mean income opportunities. In the future, she dreams of sustaining her store to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy for inventories of sugar, milk, oil, and noodles to sell and pay for bags of palay.

loans.name: Jaenal

texts.en:
Meet Jaenal. Jaenal is single and he lives with his three family members in North Bogor, a suburban area that is located about two hours’ drive from Jakarta, the capital city. 

To support his family's living, Jaenal runs a console game-rental business. Jaenal was introduced to Ruma by one of his friends and he quickly became interested and joined Ruma about a month ago. He is excited about his new business, which is selling mobile phone airtime to his community. He also believes that using technology will make his business easier to run. 

As the business runs, he hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva to provide mobile services for his community on the weekends. In the photo, Jaenal is in his rental station, with his customers as seen at the background. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide mobile services in his community on weekends.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina, her husband, and their only child live together in West Bandung, a regency area located in West Java province. 

She contributes to support her family's living by managing a small shop that sells mobile phone SIM cards, phone accessories, and mobile phone airtime credits. She joined Ruma about a month ago because she wanted to increase her family’s income. She also wants to expand her network, learn to use technology, and learn how to run her small stall more effectively. 

She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits. As the business runs, she hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva in order to provide mobile services for her community on the weekends. Lina thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide mobile services for her community on the weekends.

loans.name: Esau Elli

texts.es:
Esau es un joven emprendedor de 20 años de edad, soltera y trabaja como albañil en su ciudad natal, Lima. Tiene un muy buen desempeño en su trabajo gracias a todo el esfuerzo que le pone a su labor y a que siempre trabaja con honestidad y mucha responsabilidad. Su familia es el principal motor de su vida, por ellos lucha día a día para poder sacarlos adelante.
Esau quiere obtener unos ingresos adicionales ofreciendo servicios de transporte, es por ello que utilizará el crédito para poder reparar y hacer el mantenimiento de una moto que tiene, él está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva por su generosidad, quiere que ellos sepan que con los ingresos adicionales que pueda obtener estará mejorando la calidad de vida de su familia. Más adelante Esau quiere empezar a construir una casa para comodidad de sus padres.
texts.en:
Esau is an enterprising young man, 20 years old and single, who works in masonry in his hometown of Lima.  He has a good level of skill in his work, thanks to all of the effort that he puts into his work and that he always works with honesty and a lot of responsibility.  His family is the driving force in his life, for them he fights day by day to be able to get them ahead. 

Esau wants to get some additional income, offering transportation services. For this reason, he will use the loan to be able to repair and do maintenance on a motorcycle that he has. He is very grateful to the Kiva lenders for their generosity. He wants them to know that with the additional income that he will be able to get, he will be improving his family's quality of life. In the future, Esau wants to begin to build a house for his parents' comfort.

loans.use: to repair and maintain the motorcycle taxi that he has.

loans.name: Mohammad Saeful

texts.en:
Meet Saeful. Saeful is married and he lives with his wife and their only child in North Bogor, a suburban area that is located about two hours’ drive from Jakarta, the capital city. 

Saeful runs a depot for gallon drinking water refills. He also sells mobile phone airtime to his customers.
 
Saeful was introduced to Ruma by one of his friends and he quickly became interested and joined Ruma about a month ago. He is excited about his new business, which is selling mobile phone airtime to his community. He also believes that using technology will make his business easier to run. 

As the business runs, he hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva to provide mobile services for his community on the weekends. In the photo, Saeful is standing in his small depot. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide mobile services in his community on weekends.

loans.name: Eter

texts.en:
Eter is 59 years old. She is married and lives with her husband in Lanchkhuti district. Her husband is a distributor and gets a monthly income. 

Eter has a newly opened market market and needs stock to full the market. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of $600 for purchasing stock. Eter will offer a wide assortments of products to her clients and she will increase the turnover. This will increase her income and with increased income, she will expand her market in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of home products for her newly opened market.

loans.name: María Antonia

texts.es:
María de 51 años de edad, es una persona que no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar en su tiempo de juventud, debido a que su familia se creció es la primera de 12 hermanos y tuvo que trabajar para los demás. Hoy en día está acompañada su esposo se dedica a la agricultura,  de sus hijos ninguno va a la escuela todos se dedican a trabajar en la tierra y otros al comercio en el mercado de su municipio.

María tiene 20 años de ser comerciante de verduras y frutas, la necesidad de llevar el sustento a sus hijos la convirtió en comerciante y hoy en día lo hace porque ya le gusto y conoce el negocio, el mercado le queda de distancia de su casa a unas ocho cuadras; por lo que se levanta muy temprano a las 4 de la mañana y trabaja hasta el mediodía, luego se traslada a la casa a seguir los oficios del hogar. 

El préstamo que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar verduras, porque en este momento solo está vendiendo frutas  y necesita aprovechar el tiempo teniendo más venta y ganar unos centavos más 
  
El sueño de María es que en el futuro,  tener un negocio fuerte donde puedan trabajar todos sus hijos y hacer una empresa familiar; pero sabe que solamente con créditos lo puede lograr así como a logrado comprar 7,000 metros cuadrados de terreno en cinco años a puro negocio hoy tiene donde cultivar.
texts.en:
María, 51, is a person who didn't have the opportunity to go to school in her youth, due to the growth of her family. She is the first of 12 siblings, and had to work for the others. She is now partnered and her partner works in agriculture. Of her children, none go to school and all work the land and some in businesses in the municipal market.

Maria has been a vegetable and fruit seller for 20 years. The need to bring sustenance to her children made her into a business woman and these days she does it because she likes it and she knows the business. The market is about eight blocks from her house, so she gets up very early at 4:00 in the morning and works until noon, later she goes to the house to continue with the household tasks. 

The loan that she is requesting from CREDICAMPO is to purchase vegetables because currently she is only selling fruits and needs to make the most of the season having more sales and earning a bit more money.

María's dream is that in the future she will have a strong business where all her children can work and make a family business, but she knows that only with loans she will be able to achieve it, like she has managed to purchase 7,000 square meters of land in five years through the strength of her business and today she has a place to cultivate.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables because currently she is only selling fruits and she needs to make the most of the season having more to sell and earning a bit more money.

loans.name: Jesus Del Socorro

texts.es: Jesus de 41 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus 2 hijos de 17 y 12 años de edad. Ella es una mujer que gracias a su tenacidad ha logrado dar el apoyo a su hijo en el negocio de la pesca en lancha la cual realizan desde hace mucho tiempo por lo que el producto que recogen ya es esperado por los comerciantes del muelle y los alrededores de la playa. Jesus desea seguir mejorando su negocio por lo que solicitado un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: plomo, corcho, redes, etc.
texts.en: Jesus, 41 years old, lives in her own house with her life partner and their 2 children ages 17 and 12.  She is a woman who, thanks to her tenacity, has managed to support her son in the boat fishing business that they have undertaken for a long time, so that the products they harvest are expected by the businesspeople on the wharf and near the beach. Jesus wants to continue improving her business for which she asks for a loan from FUSAI to invest in lead weights, cork, nets, etc.

loans.use: to invest in lead weights, cork, nets, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve his business to meet the hygiene and waste regulations, to purchase concentrated pig feed, since his his pigs are in the fattening stage.

loans.name: Rosa Elizabeth

texts.es:
Rosa, tiene 21 años no tiene hijos viven con su familia en el sector de Natabuela perteneciente a Atuntaqui zona de producción de artesanías elaboración y confección de ropas, donde la mayoría de turistas viene a visitar por las artesanías que ofrece en esta ciudad.
Tiene un local de comida rápida desde hace 2 años atrás ofrece almuerzos, alas asadas de tarde porque en la zona hay pequeñas empresas de confecciones y los empleados vienen al local a almorzar y de tarde ofrece alas asadas a los estudiantes que están en la nocturna, la actividad aprendió de la familia porque también tienen locales de comida y es así que tiene experiencia en esta actividad.
La inversión del crédito lo va realizar en la compra de una refrigeradora para el local con eso mantener fresco los productos que necesita para la elaboración de la comida y una parte para pintar el local y sea más presentable para la atención de los clientes, agradece a fundación alternativa por el apoyo que le están dando con el crédito.
texts.en:
Rosa, 21, has no children.  She lives with her family in the Natabuela area of Atuntaqui.  The area produces crafts and clothing, and the majority of tourists visit for the crafts that are sold in the city.

She has had a fast food stall for two years.  She sells lunch and grilled wings in the afternoon.  There are small clothing businesses in the area and the employees eat lunch at her place.  In the afternoon she sells grilled wings to the students who take night classes.  She learned the work from her family because they also have food establishments and that's how she gained experience.

She's going to invest the loan in buying a refrigerator for her place so the products she needs to make her dishes will stay fresh.  She's going to use part of the loan to paint, so the space will be more presentable for her customers.

She's grateful to Fundación Alternativa for the support they're giving her with the loan.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es: Nicolás de 57 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus 2 hijos de 16 y 9 años de edad. Él es un hombre trabajador que se esfuerza por llevar el sustento a su familia apoyado en su venta de mariscos como: camarón, conchas, langostas y pescado, la cual realiza desde hace 9 años por lo que ya cuenta con una buena cantidad de clientes que cada día lo prefieren mas por sus precios accesibles y su amabilidad. Nicolás desea ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes pero no cuenta con los recursos económicos necesarios por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: camarón, langosta, pulpo, conchas, pescado, etc.
texts.en:
Nicolás, 57, lives in his own home with his life partner and his two children, ages 16 and 9.

He's a hardworking man who makes an effort to support his family selling shellfish such as shrimp, conch, lobster, and fish.  He has done this work for nine years, so he already has a good number of customers who prefer him more every day because of his affordable prices and friendliness.

Nicolás wants to offer his customers a wider variety of products.  He doesn't have the financial resources he needs, however, so he's asking FUSAI for a loan to invest in shrimp, lobster, octopus, conch, fish, and so on.

loans.use: to buy shrimp, lobster, octopus, conch, fish, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fresh, hard, and soft cheeses, cremes, cottage cheese, and sausages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cheese, cream, curd cheese, soft cheese, and beauty products

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
Meet Abdul. Abdul is married and he lives with his wife and their two children. They live in Sukabumi, a city surrounded by the regency of the same name in the southern foothills of Mount Gede, in West Java, Indonesia. Abdul runs a small stall that sells mobile phones, mobile phone SIM cards, phone accessories, mobile phone airtime, and serves bill payment for his customers.

Abdul was introduced to Ruma by one of his friends and he quickly became interested in joining Ruma about a month ago. 
He is excited about his new business as he can start recruiting more agents and expand his own network. He also believes that using technology will make his business easier to run. As the business runs, he hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva to provide bill payment and mobile services for his community on the weekends. In the photo, Abdul is in his small stall. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide bill payment and mobile services in his community

loans.name: Eustaquio

texts.es:
Eustaquio, estaba casado pero hace más de tres años se separó de su esposa , tiene dos hijos que ya son independientes, vive en casa propia ocupando solo una habitación con paredes de ladrillo y el piso de tierra, la casa esta ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz.
El estudió solo hasta la primaria pero pudo aprender el oficio de sastre  y actualmente percibe ingresos ya que se dedica  a la confección de chamarras, trabajando por más de diez horas al día para posteriormente venderlas de forma ambulante ya que no cuenta con un puesto fijo.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de mas cuero para hacer mayor cantidad de chamarras Eustaquio es la unica fuente de ingesos en su hogar pero goza de buena salud
texts.en:
Eustaquio was married but he separated from his wife over three years ago. He has two children who are by now independent. He lives in his own home occupying only one room made of brick walls and a dirt floor. The house is in the city of La Paz.

He studied only through elementary school, but he was able to learn the occupation of a tailor and currently he has an income from making jackets. He works for over ten hours a day to then sell them as ambulant vendor, since he does not have a fixed stand.

He needs the loan to buy more leather to make a greater quantity of jackets. Eustaquio's earnings are the only source of household income, but he is in good health.

loans.use: to buy more leather to make a greater quantity of jackets.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie has switched from selling snacks to selling "patatas/gallatas" (thin crisp biscuits). Her business is doing well since she doubled her time perfecting her own "patatas/gallatas" snack vending. With her husband's help, she has maximized her profits and keeps pursuing her goals for the good of her family. 

She is taking another loan from PMPC, to buy more kilos of "harina" (flour) for her snack vending business. Today, Rosemarie is able to help others in the retailing business with her "patatas/gallatas" and they aer also earning for their own families.

loans.use: to buy more kilos of "harina" for her snack vending business

loans.name: Eltrudes

texts.en: Elrudes landed at a right place for her needed capital when she joined PMPC. She knew this would be her chance to increase her capital with the help of the cooperative. PMPC came to Eltrudes as a rescue for lending her money when she needed it the most. Now, she obtained a loan for the next cropping season. She borrowed an amount for land and seedbed preparation.  Eltrudes perseveres and always believes to reach her goals to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparation.

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en: Marietta is 57 years old, married and has three grown-up children. She manages a store and sells grocery items and vegetables while her spouse is a farmer. Their income goes for family expenses for meals, bills at home and revolving capital in the business. Merlita hopes to increase her profits by selling additional grocery items so she is now asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy noodles, eggs, biscuits, and sardines to sell. She hopes to continue offering good products and services to all her customers.

loans.use: to buy noodles, eggs, biscuits, and sardines to sell.

loans.name: Myrla

texts.en:
Myrla lives at Solana with her family. She is 51 years old, married and has four children. All of them attend school. Myrla is involved in selling vegetables and frozen meat products to the people in her village. Her spouse is a construction worker. 

She gains minimal income and that is why she wants to sell more meat products. She has insufficient funds and  that is why she is asking for a loan of PHP 9,000 to buy cured pork, tocino (bacon) and hot dogs to sell. This will help increase her profits. 

She hopes to become successful in her small business and continue to give support to her children in school.

loans.use: to buy cured pork, tocino (bacon) and hot dogs to sell.

loans.name: Ma'mun

texts.en:
Meet Ma’mun. Ma’mun is married and he lives with his wife and their two children in Sukabumi, a city surrounded by the regency of the same name in the southern foothills of Mount Gede, in West Java, Indonesia. Ma’mun runs a small stall that sells snacks, drinks, and mobile phone airtime for his customers.

Ma’mun was introduced to Ruma by one of his friends and he quickly became interested and joined Ruma about a month ago. He is excited about his new business which is selling mobile phone airtime to his community. He also believes that using technology will make his business easier to run. As the business runs, he hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva to provide mobile services for his community on the weekends. In the photo, Ma’mun is standing in front of his family house. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide mobile services in his community.

loans.name: Rio

texts.en:
Meet Rio. Rio is married and he lives with his wife and their two children in Sukabumi, a city surrounded by the regency of the same name in the southern foothills of Mount Gede, in West Java, Indonesia. Rio runs a small stall that sells mobile phone SIM cards, phone accessories, mobile phone airtime, and provides bill payment for his customers.

Rio was introduced to Ruma by one of his friends and he quickly became interested and joined Ruma about a month ago.
 
He is excited about his new business as he can start recruiting more agents below him and expand his own network. He also believes that using technology will make his business easier to run. As the business runs, he hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva to provide bill payment and mobile services for his community on the weekends. In the photo, Rio is in his small stall. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide bill payment and mobile services in his community.

loans.name: Somsuen Group

texts.en:
Khan's village takes water from wells and from the local streams. Some people in the village are able to buy bottles of water. The water in this area is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment. The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water.    

Khan is excited that he and his neighbors were able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; this is because the filter removes bacteria and other waterborne diseases. The water filter also increases disposable income and available working days due to the decreased cost of purchasing charcoal or foraging for wood and/or purchasing bottled water. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years, though most find the filter works for 3-5 years.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters to have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Siti

texts.en: Siti, her husband, and their two children live together in Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. She contributes to support her family income by managing a small shop that sells snacks, drinks, and mobile phone airtime credits. She joined Ruma about two years ago because she wanted to increase her family’s income. She also wants to expand her network, learn using technology, and learn how to run her small stall more effectively. She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits. As the business runs, she hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva in order to provide mobile services for her community on the weekends. Siti thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide mobile services in her community.

loans.name: Adi

texts.en:
Meet Adi. Adi is married and he lives with his wife and their two children in Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Adi runs a small stall which sells mobile phone sim cards, phone accessories, and mobile phone airtime for his customers. 

Adi was introduced to Ruma by one of his friends and he quickly became interested and joined Ruma about a month ago. He is excited about his new business which is selling mobile phone airtime to his community. He also believes that using technology will make his business easier to run. As the business runs, he hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva to provide mobile services for his community on the weekends. In the photo, Adi is sitting in his small stall. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide mobile services in his community.

loans.name: Wuri

texts.en: Wuri, her husband, and their four children live together in North Bogor, a suburban area located about two hours drive from Jakarta, the capital city. She contributes to support her family's living by managing a small shop that sells mobile phone SIM cards, phone accessories, and mobile phone airtime credits. She joined Ruma about a month ago because she wanted to increase her family’s income. She also wants to expand her network, learn using technology, and learn how to run her small stall more effectively. She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits. As the business runs, she hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva in order to to provide mobile services for her community on the weekends. Wuri thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide mobile services in her community.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 30 years old and a single parent of one child. She owns and manages a small retail store within the local community to generate income. She has been in this business for almost six years. She aims to improve her store and generate sufficient income to sustain their needs and save for the future of her child. She wants to increase her product offerings but she has insufficient capital. For this reason, she would like to obtain additional capital of PHP 20,000 to buy more stocks of soft drinks, mineral waters, liquefied petroleum gas and other grocery items to resell. She believes that this financial assistance will enable her to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of soft drinks, mineral waters, liquefied petroleum gas and other grocery items to resell.

location.town: Brgy. Bintawan Norte, Villaverde, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es: Virginia esta casada, tiene 4 hijos y vive en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que es de su propiedad  Virginia percibe ingresos por que tiene un vehiculo que le sirve para el negocio de transporte, ella tambien es comerciante Su marido la ayuda pero no es suficiente, ademas Virginia tiene muchos gastos con tantos hijos asi que solicita su ayuda Virginia y su familia gozan de buena salud  y su evaluacion de credito es buena Virginia quiere un prestamo para pagar el mantenimiento de su vehiculo
texts.en:
Virginia is married and has four children.  She lives in La Paz in a brick and cement house that she owns.

Virginia earns an income because she has a vehicle she uses for a transportation business.  She's also a merchant.  Her husband helps her but it's not enough. She also has a lot of expenses with so many children, so she's asking for help.  Virginia and her family enjoy good health and she has a good credit rating.

Virginia wants a loan to pay for maintenance on her vehicle.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance on her equipment

loans.name: Jenilyn

texts.en:
Jenilyn is a married woman and a mother of three young children from Leyte, Philippines. Jenilyn is engaged in a hog-raising business. She is also into a farming venture with her husband. Jenilyn has been in the business for more than 10 years now. This is the source of her income.

Jenilyn is asking for a loan to buy animal feed and fertilizer for the farm. Through this, she will be able to improve her hog-raising business as well as the harvest from her farm. Jenilyn wants to save money, as well, for the education expenses of her children.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and fertilizer for the farm

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is engaged in a retailing business. She deals in Vita Plus and health supplement products. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day. 

For her to continue her business, she availed herself of a loan of 15,000 PHP to pay for motor spare parts and repair; she will use the motor to continue selling her products in neighboring towns. The income from her retailing business shall be how she will pay off the loan she requested from PMPC. She dreams to own a space to display her products and be able to provide for the family.

loans.use: to pay for motor spare parts and repairs to continue selling her products to neighboring towns

location.town: SINDANGAN - LAGAG, SINDANGAN, ZAMBOANGA DEL NORTE

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice, 41, is a mother of 3 who lives in an upland village called Kobuswo which is swallowed by the Kapsowar jungle. The only activity to speak of for Kobuswo constituents is livestock farming. Eunice keeps cattle and poultry on her farm. Her primary income sources are milk and eggs.

Eunice’s agribusiness has been profitable for 5 years. She is very contented with farming not only as an economic activity but also as a lifestyle. Today she is seeking a loan to purchase poultry in order to expand her business.
 
With your loan, Eunice will make enough income from the loan investment to repay the loan and better her living. The brood of hens she plans to acquire will produce more eggs for her to sell. They will also help aerate soil and break vegetation in her farm as they scratch the earth trying to find bugs. 

The additional income will come in timely as her children’s education expenses keep increasing. The loan will also help her family to enjoy food security.

loans.use: to pay for poultry.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is 55 years old from Mahayag. She is a farmer who grows palay and beans. 

Mercidita wants to increase sales. Consequently, she has requested a loan that will enable her to purchase seeds, compost and fertilizer. She wishes to live comfortably with her children and for them to earn their diploma someday.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, compost and fertilizer.

loans.name: Conavi Group

texts.es:
Conavi es un grupo nuevo, que se formó con mucho sacrificio y esmero para poder ayudar a sus familias por medio del esfuerzo en conjunto.
Liz integra este grupo, es una persona muy buena en lo que hace, es luchadora y emprendedora, vio una gran esperanza y es por ello que se unió al programa de comités, ya que a través de el podrá ayudar a sus seres queridos. Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas e hilos, que le ayudará en la confección que hace, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo cumpliendo con el pedido de sus clientes.
Todas están más que contentas, ya que saben que por medio de las capacitaciones y la ayuda de la fundación paraguaya podrán mejorar sus calidades de vida.
texts.en:
Conavi is a new group that has been painstakingly formed in order to help their families by collectively supporting one another. 

Liz is a  member of this group and she is very good at what she does. She is hard working and an entrepreneur and she saw a great opportunity by joining with this group and, through her membership, she believes she will be able to help her family. 

She is asking for this loan so she can invest in purchasing more fabric and threads, which will help her in her business and help her be able to fulfill customer requests. 

All of the women are happy because they know that through the training and the financial help of this organization, they will be able to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: purchase fabric and thread.

loans.name: Pedro Pablo

texts.es:
Pedro Pablo tiene 59 años de edad, es conviviente. Tiene 01 hijo dependiente, vive con su hijo y su conyugue en el distrito de Pomahuaca, el cual es un distrito mediano con aspiraciones a superarse, en donde sus actividades principales son la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, y está ubciado en la provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

Pedro Pablo se dedica al comercio cuenta con una bodega ubicada en su mismo domicilio, cuenta con más de 08 años de experiencia en el negocio, cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales, por su buen servicio y experiencia cuenta con bastante clientela de la zona y de los alrededores; el destino del crédito es para invertir en el negocio compra de mercadería, invirtiendo en su negocio y poder adquirir una utilidad aceptable para que mejore su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Pedro Pablo is 59 years old and married. He lives with his wife and his son, who still depends on him, in the Pomahuaca district. This is a small but ambitious district, where locals work in agriculture and commerce. It is located in the Jaén province, Cajamarca region, northern mountains of Peru.

Pedro Pablo is a businessman. He runs a grocery store at home and has more than eight years of experience. He has very good personal references. He has many customers that live nearby or in the surroundings, thanks to his good service.

Pedro Pablo will use this loan to buy supplies. By investing in his business, his profits and his living conditions will improve.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his grocery store.

loans.name: Jimna

texts.en:
Hardworking mother best describes Jimna, a 38-year-old who is residing in the municipality of Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. Jimna has three children and is married to a carpenter.  The wage that her husband gets isn’t enough to sustain their daily needs in their family. So, Jimna started a business, a food stand or “carenderia.” She has been in the business for more than three years now and sufficiently provides for the family. 

Jimna was able to send her son to college, and he graduated with a bachelor's degree. To fulfill her dreams for his son, she requested financial assistance from PMPC to pay for her son's seafarer apprenticeship. The income from her business shall be used to pay off the loan she requested from the Co-op. She dreams of nothing more than to see her children finish their studies and be successful in their chosen field, which is the main priority of her hardship.

loans.use: to pay for her son's seafarer apprenticeship

location.town: SINDANGAN - LAGAG, SINDANGAN, ZAMBOANGA DEL NORTE

loans.name: Celerina

texts.en:
Celerina, 53 years old, is from Lagag, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. She is married and has 4 children.  

Celerina joined PMPC and she appreciates the programs and services of the Co-op. The Co-op provided the capital to start her snack vending business.  She has been able to help the family survive and provide delicious food snacks. 

Celerina wants to expand her resources and purchase a motorcycle  to  sell her snacks in nearby areas. She will  used the loan to buy bananas for her snack vending business and pay her motorcycle loan. She is thankful to Paglaum MPC for financing her capital needs. 

In addition, she wants her business to be well known and to provide good services  for her loyal customers.  She wishes to live a happy and comfortable  life.

loans.use: to buy  bananas.

location.town: SINDANGAN - LAGAG, SINDANGAN, ZAMBONGA DEL NORTE

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Kiva lenders! Meet Christine, one of the most hardworking women on earth. She is 42 years of age, very hardworking and a go-getter. She is a proud mother of four lovely children. She hails from Koplolo, a remote village in the Kapsowar area of Kenya. This area has harsh weather conditions and to survive, you must have tough skin, but Christine has defied all the odds and has been engaged in farming for the past five years. 

Her primary sources of income are crops and animal farming. Christine passionately loves farming and has even nicknamed one of her cows “Tuyai” (this is from a person’s name), and whenever she is milking her cow, she feels proud. She is contented with the farming way of life. 

Her biggest challenge in farming is irrigating her farm. She is requesting a loan to buy a generator that she will use in pumping water from the river to her farm. Irrigation is used to assist in the growing of agricultural crops, maintenance of landscapes, and re-vegetation of disturbed soils in dry areas and during periods of inadequate rainfall. Through this loan, she will be able to double her crop production, and this will translate to more income. Through the extra income from farming, she will be able to support her family and keep up with her rising family expenses. Christine patiently waits for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a generator to be used in irrigation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase clothing, lotion, shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement to renovate  his house to be more comfortable and suitable for living.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is a 54-year-old member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative from Danao, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has 7 children. She  has a fishing business.   

She personally takes charge of their business, and her children work for her. The business is doing well.  Esterlita has taught her children how to enjoy business and earn a living. The ups and downs of the business is a normal situation for her. Sometimes they have losses and  sometimes, there  are good returns. She is a savvy business woman. 

Esterlita sees a good opportunity to expand the business. She requests 20,000 PHP from Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative to buy additional nets and fishing accessories. 

She wants to provide a good education for her children and so they can have their own businesses.

loans.use: to buy additional nets and fishing accessories.

loans.name: Phonyearyai Group

texts.en: Ken's village takes water from wells and from the local streams.  Some people in the village are able to buy bottled water.  The water in this area is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment.  The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water.    Ken is excited that he and his neighbors were able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; this is because the filter removes bacteria and other water borne diseases. The water filter also increases disposable income and available working days due to the decreased cost of purchasing charcoal or foraging for wood and/or purchasing bottled water. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years, though most find the filter works from 3-5 years.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Napotha Group

The filter is guaranteed for 2 years, though most find the filter works from 3-5 years.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina was born in the late 1960s. She is married and is blessed with one son who is in school. Amina has been a businesswoman managing a variety of projects in assistance with her husband. She has a grocery selling beers, water, juices and spirits, a chips-selling business with meats fried in small pieces known as Mishkaki. Amina also runs a shop selling clothes, a business she has been in for 10 years now. Working from 6am to 9pm daily, she is able to make a very good monthly profit. 

For the sake of improving her businesses, Amina approached Tujijenge Tanzania to request her first credit support. Her desire is to grow her business and family life. She will invest her credit to buy stocks of drinks and Irish potatoes for her business. She will be accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy stocks of drinks and Irish potatoes for her business.

loans.name: Kibondeni Group

texts.en:
Idrisa  is a single man in his early 30s with a son and a daughter who attend school.  He has sold chips, fruit, and vegetables for one year.  He works from 8am to mid-night daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Idrisa's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He will use this loan to  buy Irish potatoes, cooking oil, fruit, and vegetables.  He dreams of seeing his business grow.

Idrisa will share this loan with his loan group "KIBONDENI" which has five members who will hold each other accountable for re-paying the loan.

loans.use: to buy Irish potatoes, cooking oil, fruit and vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Margilyn

texts.en:
Margilyn is an industrious and responsible wife and mother to three children.  She has operated her vulcanizing and welding shop for more than 20 years.  She also grows rice.

She has worked hard to get ahead in life and earn a greater income. To make this goal possible, Margilyn requests 5,000 PHP  to buy paint, a welding rod, and iron for her vulcanizing and welding business.  She looks forward to continually  developing her  shop. She could meet the daily needs and save for emergencies.

loans.use: to buy paint, a welding rod, and iron for her vulcanizing and welding business

loans.name: Fely

texts.en: Fely sought help from Paglaum MPC for her capital needs. She availed a loan for the next crop season. She will use her loan amount for land and seedbed preparation which she hopes will increase her sales and inventory. Fely perseveres and always believes she will reach her goal to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparation

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es:
Edwin tiene 22 años de edad, es soltero, vive en casa de sus padres, su vivienda cuenta con servicios básicos, a pesar de vivir en una zona rural MALACASI, cuya comunidad se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de ganado menor(pollos, patos, conejos, entre otros). Dicha comunidad está ubicada en el distrito de Salitral, provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad que desarrolla Edwin es el aquiler de su mototaxi, además se dedica brindar el servicio como ayudante de albañilería, el viaja a distintos lugares de la región, el destino del crédito es para comprar el motor de su mototaxi y mantenimiento total de la misma y la diferencia es para mejoras de su casa(casa de sus padres). La mototaxi la da alquilar a un familiar en la zona. El objetivo del crédito es buscar un nuevo ingreso al cliente ya qu habilitará su herramienta de trabajo.
texts.en:
Edwin, age 22, is single.  He lives in his parents’ house.  The house does have basic services in spite of being in the rural area of Malacasi.  His community devotes itself to agriculture and raising small animals (chickens, ducks, and rabbits, among others).  The community is located in the Salitral district, Morropón province, Piura region, on the northern coast of Peru.

Edwin’s business activity is renting his ‘mototaxi’ [three wheeled motorized vehicle].  He also provides services as an assistant bricklayer.  He travels to different places in the region.

The loan is to buy a motor for his mototaxi and to provide the mototaxi with complete maintenance.  He will use the rest of the loan to make improvements to his house (his parents’ house).  He rents the mototaxi to a relative in the area.  The objective of the loan is for him to look for a new income because he will fixing up his work tool.

loans.use: to buy a motor for his mototaxi and to provide the mototaxi with complete maintenance.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es:
Wilfredo es un padre de familia amoroso, siempre luchando para sacarlos adelante, trabaja como empleado en una empresa de su ciudad natal, Lima.
Cada mañana Wilfredo despierta con el pensamiento que cada día será mejor que el anterior por eso se esfuerza mucho y trabaja durante todo el día porque ama a su familia y quiere lo mejor para ellos.
Debido al alto deseo que tiene de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia él utilizará el crédito para comprar una lavadora. Está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva por su generosidad, quiere que ellos sepan que con esto su familia evitará resfriados, ya que por temporada de invierno es un poco difícil lavar la ropa a mano debido al frío. Más adelante Wilfredo quiere empezar a construir su casa de material noble.
texts.en:
Wilfredo is a loving father who has always worked hard to help his children to get ahead. He works for a local company in Lima, where he was born. Every morning, he wakes up thinking that that day will be better than the previous one, so he works hard because he loves his family and wants the best for them.

He really wants to improve his family’s living conditions, so he will use this loan to buy a washing machine. He is grateful to Kiva lenders for their generosity and wants them to know that thanks to this loan, his family will be healthy and its members will not catch a cold during the winter season; it is difficult to hand-wash the clothes when it is cold outside. In the future, Wilfredo would like to build his house with solid materials.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine.

loans.name: Dongmarkbra Group

texts.en: Vienma's village takes water from wells and from the local streams. Some people in the village are able to buy bottled water. The water in this area is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment. The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water. Vienma is excited that he and his neighbors were able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; this is because the filter removes bacteria and other waterborne diseases. The water filter also increases disposable income and available working days due to the decreased cost of purchasing charcoal or foraging for wood and/or purchasing bottled water. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years, though most find the filter works from 3-5 years.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Nao Group

texts.en: Vongon's village takes water from wells and from the local streams.  Some people in the village are able to buy bottled water.  The water in this area is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment.  The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water.    Vongon is excited that he and his neighbors were able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; this is because the filter removes bacteria and other water borne diseases. The water filter also increases disposable income and available working days due to the decreased cost of purchasing charcoal or foraging for wood and/or purchasing bottled water. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years, though most find the filter works from 3-5 years.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Crescencia

texts.es:
La Sra. Crescencia tiene 42 años y tiene 2 hijos adolescentes, tiene una Peluquería en su casa, comenta que desde los 14 años ya trabajo en una peluquería, y a los 18 años ya tenía su propio negocio.
Uno de sus sueños es que sus hijos terminen una carrera universitaria ya que ella no tuvo esa oportunidad, y que no pase por ningún tipo de necesidades.
Pide este préstamo para la colocación de rejas en su casa, ya que así podrá asegurar su local, donde tiene los instrumentos que usa para su trabajo del día a día. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe y que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en: Crescencia is 42 years old and has two children. She has a hairdressing shop in her house. She comments that she has worked in hair salons since she was 14 and at 18 had her own business. One of her dream is for her children to complete a university degree as she never had this possibility and she doesn't want them to go without. She is requesting this loan to put up security grills on her house so she can secure her shop where she has the instruments she uses for her work day to day. She is grateful for the opportunity that she is receiving as it will be of much help.

loans.use: to put up security grills.

loans.name: Facunda

texts.es:
Facunda es una mujer de 54 años de edad, casada, madre de dos hijos de 24 y 20 años, su negocio es la venta de ropa usada.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, luchadora, buena madre, solidaria, responsable y trabajadora, su negocio lo realiza en la zona de villa Fátima, un sitio caracterizado por las paradas de buses que se dirigen a pueblos del norte de la ciudad.
Facunda es de tez morena, cabello negro largo, estatura mediana, su lengua materna es el aymara la cual ya casi no utiliza, y habla español debido al comercio que realiza. Su trabajo es la venta de ropa de segunda mano, ella cuenta con dos tiendas dedicadas al mismo comercio, una es administrada por su esposo y la otra la administra ella. Comparte su vida con su dos hijos quienes estudian en la escuela secundaria y ya están por terminar. Ella sueña tener más tiendas dedicadas al misma actividad, su deseo es la compra de ropa de segunda mano en un lote de ocasión para mejorar su ingresos económicos y ayudar a pagar los gastos universitarios de sus dos hijos.
Es por esos motivos que Facunda solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa de segunda mano y con los beneficios pagar los gastos escolares de sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
Facunda is a 54 year old woman, married, and the mother of two children who are 24 and 20 years old. Her business is selling used clothes.  

She is entrepreneurial, independent, tenacious, a good mother, solidary, responsible, and hard working. Her business operates in the Fátima zone, a place characterised by the bus stops that go to villages north of the city.

Facunda is dark-skinned, with long dark hair, of medium height, and her mother tongue is Aymara which she almost doesn't use anymore, using Spanish due to the trade she engages in. Her work is selling second hand clothes, and has two stores dedicated to the same items. One is run by her husband, and she runs the other. 

She shares her life with her two children who are studying in secondary school and already are about to finish. She dreams of having more stores to sell used clothes, and she hopes to buy second hand clothes wholesale to improve her earnings and to help pay University fees for her children. 

It is for these reasons that Facunda is asking for a loan in order to buy second hand clothes and with her earnings pay for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothing, and with her earnings pay the schooling costs of her two children.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a 44-year-old married woman with two children. Her family lives  peacefully in Piat. 

She sells groceries and her spouse drives a tricycle and farms. Her family’s income is used to purchase  daily meals, pay electric bills and education fees, and re-invest  in her business. 

She earns minimal income but manages to provide for the needs of her family. She joined ASKI and requests 10, 000 PHP to buy  noodles, biscuits, canned goods, and coffee to sell. This will help her to increase sales and earn profits for education purposes and to expand her business someday.

loans.use: to buy noodles, biscuits, canned goods, and coffee to sell.

loans.name: Rosa Esmeralda

texts.es:
Rosa de 23 años de edad, es una persona que estudio hasta noveno grado y es madre soltera de un hijo de un año de edad, su esposo la abandono.

Rosa se levanta a las 6:00 a.m. para realizar  las actividades comerciales (tienda) y prepararse para ir a la parcela donde cultiva.

Rosa se dedica a trabajar por las mañanas en la agricultura  oficio que le he enseño su esposo, la tienda la maneja su madre mientras ella siembra y  en el transcurso de la tarde ella se encarga de la tienda.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar semilla, abono, pesticidas, pago de rastreo de la tierra, etc. que espera con ello obtener una buena producción para el sustento de su familia.

Rosa planea que con los ingresos que obtiene  de la siembra, podrá  en un futuro un trabajar sin deudas.
texts.en:
Rosa, 23, studied up to the ninth grade. Her husband abandoned her, so she is a single mother. Her son is one year old. Rosa wakes up at 06:00 am to open the store she has and get ready to go to the piece of land where she grows vegetables. She works in agriculture in the morning, something her husband taught her. Her mother takes care of the store while she is away, and she takes over in the afternoon.

She is requesting a loan at CREDICAMPO to buy seeds, compost and pesticides, and to pay someone to plow the land. She hopes that this will result in a good harvest so that she can sustain her family. Rosa believes that with the profits she will make, she will be able to work without borrowing money.

loans.use: to buy seeds, compost and pesticides, and to pay someone to plow the land.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de libreria ,la socia vende cuadernos,lapiceros y lapices,la socia ya tiene varios años en este ngeocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de libreria.La socia solicita el credito para comprar cuadernos,libros y lapiceros. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member is still selling office supplies. She sells notebooks, pens and pencils. She has been doing this for some years now and is doing very well. Her dream is to expand her business.

She is requesting a loan to buy notebooks, pens and pencils to sell.

She feels very happy with this loan and promises to pay the installments on time.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, pens and pencils to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bags for her business as a saleswoman.

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.es:
Evangelina de 26 años de edad que tiene una grande aspiración de poder superarse en la vida, ella toma todos los obstáculos de la viva como un reta para poder llegar al éxito, ella tiene dos hijos los cueles se han convertido el motivo de poder superarse y buscar  la forma de cómo tener un ingreso económico. Los hijos de ella son excelentes estudiantes de la escuela que les queda cerca de su comunidad. 
	
La actividad que ella realiza es la compra y venta de regalos,  ella lleva realizando dicha actividad durante dos años, ella se decidió a realizar dicha actividad porque por su comunidad no hay personas que realizan la venta de regalo y a ella le genera muy buena ganancia y ingresos económicos par el sostenimiento de su familia y en mejor las condiciones de vida de su familia, la segunda actividad que ella realiza es la compra y venta de ropa típica.

El uso respectivo que ella dará al crédito es para la compra de materia prima para poder realizar la venta de regalos para surtir sus mercaderías para así poner a disposición de las personas que requieren de estos productos. Uno de las aspiraciones de Evangelina es ver que sus hijos se conviertan en profesionales y construir casas para sus hijos para que ellos tengan la condición de vida adecuada.
texts.en:
Evangelina is 26 years old and aspires to be able to get ahead in life. She takes all of life's obstacles as a challenge to be able to reach success. She has two children, who have become her motive to get ahead and to look for a way of having an income. Her two children are excellent students in the school near their community.  

Evangelina works buying and selling gifts. She has been working in this area for two years, and decided to pursue this line of work because in her community, no one else worked selling gifts. For her, this generates good earnings in order to sustain her family, and has improved her family's living conditions. She also works buying and selling typical clothing. 

She will use the loan to buy raw materials in order to sell gifts by stocking her merchandise, to have more products available to her customers who require them. One of Evangelina's aspirations is to see her children become professionals, and to build houses for her sons so that they might have adequate living conditions.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her sale of gifts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bags of cement.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase many vehicles spare parts to resell, so as to earn more.

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es:
Geneoveva tiene 19 años de edad, es conviviente, con un hijo a su cargo, vive en casa familiar, en una zona rural del distrito Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Geneoveva se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral, hace 7 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, ella solicita préstamo para capital de trabajo; pues desea invertir en la compra de pavos, gallinas, cerdos, cuyes, para incrementar y diversificar su stock de animales; por lo que el préstamo le ayudará para tener una mayor diversidad de animales esto can la finalidad de incrementar su productividad de los mismos y satisfacer los diferentes gustos de todos sus clientes. Lo que le generará en un corto plazo una mejora en sus ingresos, en sus ganancias y por ende en su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Geneoveva is 19 years old. She is in a common law relationship and has a child. She lives in the family home in a rural area in Oyotún district, part of Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Perú.

Geneoveva has been raising and selling barnyard animals for 7 years. Her business is located at her house. She is requesting a loan for working capital because she wants to purchase turkeys, chickens, pigs and guinea pigs in order to expand and diversify her stock of animals.

The loan will enable her to have a greater variety of animals with the goal of increasing productivity and meeting the demands of all of her customers.  Within a short period, this will generate an improvement  in her earnings, profits and therefore her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase turkeys, chickens, pigs and guinea pigs in order to expand and diversify her stock of animals.

loans.name: Umedjon

texts.ru: Умедчон студент первого курса Таджикского Государственного Университета Коммерции. Он учится в факультете Таможенное дело. Умедчон учится успешно и получает хорошие оценки. В короткий срок он уже показал себя в университете как порядочного и стремительного молодого человека. Умедчон после окончания университета хочет работать в государственном учреждении и служить во блага государства и своего народа. Он обратился за займом для того чтобы оплатить за учебный договор. Умедчон запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Umedjon is a first-year student of the Tajikistan State Commerce University. He is studying customs operations. Umedjon studies successfully and earns good grades. In a short period of time, he has already shown himself at the university as a decent and driven young person. Umedjon wants to work at a government institution after graduation from the university and serve his country and his people. Umedjon is requesting this loan to pay for his university tuition. He awaits your kindness and hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for his university tuition

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
La socia Carmen Rosa  se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de comida, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, la socia hace paltos como pollo al horno, sopas entre otros, el sueño de la socia es ampliar su negocio de venta de comida. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar verduras, pollo y carne.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Member Carmen Rosa continues with her food selling business. She is relying on this business to get ahead. She makes items such as roast chicken and soups, among other dishes.

This member’s dream is to expand her food selling business. She is requesting the loan to purchase vegetables, chicken and beef.

Carmen Rosa is happy with the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, chicken and beef.

loans.name: Valijon

texts.ru: Валичон добрый молодой человек. Ему 20 лет. Он чистосердечный и стремительный человек. Валичон студент 3 курса Государственного Университета Кургантюбе. Он учится в факультете История и права. Валичон после окончания университета хочет работать в средней школе учителем истории и права и учить маленьких детей историю. Он не женат и живет с родителями. Валичон запрашивает займ на сумму 800 долларов США для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Valijon is a kind young person. He is 20 years old. He is a sincere and driven person. Valijon is a third-year student of the Kurgantyube State University. He is majoring in History and Law. After graduating from the university, Valijon wants to work as a history and law teacher at a secondary school and teach young children history. He is not married and lives with his parents. Valijon is requesting a loan in the amount of 800 US dollars to pay for his university tuition. He awaits your kindness and hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for his university tuition

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.ru: Благодаря поддержке своим родителям Насиба поступила в Государственный Университет города Кургантюбе. Она поступила в факультет экономики в очное отделение. Насиба является одной из успешных студентов. Она учить экономические предметы с особым усердием, так как она хочет стать высококвалифицированным специалистом. Насиба очень трудолюбивая девушка и всегда помогает своим однокурсникам готовить домашнюю работу. Она не замужем и живет с родителями. Насиба запрашивает займ на сумму 900 долларов США для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Thanks to her parents' support, Nasiba was accepted to the Kurgantyube State University. She was accepted to the Economics department to study full-time. Nasiba is one of the most successful students. She learns economics-related subject with a particular diligence because she wants to become a highly qualified specialist. Nasiba is a very hardworking young woman and always helps her classmates prepare homework. She is not married and lives with her parents. Nasiba is requesting a loan in the amount of 900 US dollars to pay for her tuition. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for her university tuition

loans.name: Ponemoung Group

texts.en:
La's village takes water from wells and from the local streams.  Some people in the village are able to buy bottled water.  The water in this area is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment.  The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water.  

La is excited that she and her neighbors were able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; this is because the filter removes bacteria and other water borne diseases. The water filter also increases disposable income and available working days due to the decreased cost of purchasing charcoal or foraging for wood and/or purchasing bottled water. 

The filter is guaranteed for 2 years, though most find the filter works from 3-5 years.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Ahliddin

texts.ru: Ахлиддин родился в 1996 году в Таджикистане. Он вырос в семье рабочего и с детства в школе учился успешно. Ахлиддин в этом году окончил среднюю школу и поступил в университет. Ахлиддин теперь является студентом первого курса. Он не женат и живет с родителями. Ахлиддин обратился за займом, чтобы оплатить за учебный договор. Его родители не в состоянии оплатить за его учебный договор. Он надеется только на вас и ваше милосердие. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Ahliddin was born in 1996 in Tajikistan. He grew up in a working class family and has been a successful student since childhood.
