Ahliddin graduated from a secondary school this year and was accepted to a university. Ahliddin is now a first-year student. He is not married and lives with his parents. Ahliddin requested this loan to pay for his tuition. His parents are unable to pay for it. He relies only on you and your mercy. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for his university tuition

loans.name: Rosa Erminia

texts.es:
De 26 años de edad casada originaria del departamento de Suchitepéquez tiene dos hijos el primero tiene cinco años y estudia en la comunidad donde viven, el segundo tiene 2 años y aun no estudia, ella realiza un impresionante esfuerzo a pesar de su edad ella es una mujer emprendedora y que dice que nunca es demasiado tarde para empezar a desarrollar y tener una visión en el futuro.

La actividad que ella dignamente a desempeñado durante 2 años es la compraventa de abarrotería en la comunidad ya que es por medio de ella puede obtener un ingreso económico para su familia y una ganancia para mejora su condición de vida, la segunda actividad que ella realiza es la venta de zapatos.

El uso respectivo que Rosa le dará al préstamo que ella solicita es para compra de mercadería de abarrotería ya que para ella es de mucha importancia tener surtida su tienda para no perder los clientes con que ella cuanta porque por medio de ello ella puede tener un ingreso económico para el sostenimiento de su familia.

Los sueños de ella es que las condiciones de su familia sean las adecuadas para un futuro y es por eso que quiere compra dos molinos de nixtamal instalarlas en su comunidad y brindar estudio a sus hijos para que sean profesionales en la vida.
texts.en:
Rosa is 26 years old, married, and a native of the Suchitepéquez department, She has two children: the oldest is five and goes to school in the community, and the youngest is 2, and doesn't go to school yet. Rosa makes impressive efforts to succeed; despite her age, she is an entrepreneurial woman, and says it's never too late to begin developing and working on a vision for the future.

For the past 2 years, she has diligently worked selling groceries in the community. Through this work, she obtains an income for her family and works to improve their living conditions. She also supplements her income by selling shoes.

Rosa is requesting a loan to purchase merchandise for her grocery store, as it is very important to have her shop well stocked, to retain her customers. This is vital, as her family’s income depends on their purchases. 

Her dream is to provide an adequate quality of life for her family in the future. This is why she wants to buy two corn mills to install in her community. She also wants to provide her children with an education, so that they can become professionals.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her grocery shop.

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en: Virgilia makes a living through her retail business. At the age of 67, she sells all her stock and earns a promising income to support her own and her grandchildren's needs. She uses PMPC and Kiva to gain access to needed capital. Now, she has taken a loan  of 6,000 PHP to restock inventory to sell and to allow her to increase her inventory. In the near future, she hopes to sustain her business and dreams of owning a concrete house for her family.

loans.use: to restock more bananas to sell

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru: Гулмире 38 лет, замужем, мать 5 несовершеннолетних детей. У Гулмиры среднее образование, на протяжении 18 лет занимается полеводством и животноводством. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Гулмиры есть 3 коровы, 1 теленок и 10 овец, также у нее есть 2,15 ГА поливной земли, на которой она выращивает фасоль, перец и клевер. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулмира обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 110,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 бычков для откорма и перепродажи. Доходы Гулмира планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота, а в будущем планирует купить бытовую технику для дома.
texts.en: Gulmira is 38 years old, married and raising 5 underage children. Gulmira has a secondary education, and has been involved in farming and animal husbandry for 18 years. Today Gulmira's business consists of 3 cows, 1 calf and 10 sheep, and also 2.15 hectares of irrigated land, where she grows beans, peppers and clover. In order to further develop her business, Gulmira requested a loan in the amount of 110,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy 2 bulls for fattening up and resale. Gulmira plans to invest the earnings from the loan into a continuing to increase her livestock headcount and plans to buy household appliances for her house in the future.

loans.use: to buy 2 bulls for fattening up and resale

loans.name: Nisida Ruth

texts.es:
La socia Nisida Ruth se dedica al negocio de crianza de pollos, la socia los pollos los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en las diferentes mercados, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los pollos. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar pollos y alimentos para los pollos.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Member Nisida Ruth has a business raising chickens. She fattens them and then sells them at different markets. She has had this business for several years and it has been doing very well. Her  dream is to have a premises where she can sell her chickens.

She is requesting a loan to purchase chickens and poultry feed. She is happy with the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and poultry feed.

loans.name: Gulshoda

texts.ru: Гулшода родилась в 1969 году. Она замужем и имеет одного ребенка. Гулшода занимается собственным бизнесом уже более 20 лет. Она продает продукты питания, а в основном овощи. Ее лавка находится возле ее дома. Многими ее покупателями являются ее соседи. Гулшода постепенно с годами развевала свой бизнес. Она хочет данное время увеличить оборотный капитал и развевать бизнес. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки овощей, чтобы увеличить оборотный капитал. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Gulshoda was born in 1969. She is married and has one child. Gulshoda has been involved in her own business for over 20 years. She sells food products, primarily vegetables. Her retail space is located near her house. Many of her customers are her neighbors. Gulshoda has gradually developed her business over the years. She currently wants to increase her working capital and grow her business. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 3000 somoni to buy vegetables in order to increase her working capital. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: to buy vegetables in order to increase her working capital

loans.name: Rosa Poty Group

texts.es:
El grupo lleva por nombre Rosa Poty está en su ciclo 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, son también parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, 
17 son las mujeres que integran este grupo, mujeres muy luchadoras y emprendedoras, Liz es una de las integrantes de este grupo, ella vende perfumes de todo tipo, y de esa forma ayuda a su familia para poder tener un mejor estilo de vida, es una mujer muy sacrificada y luchadora, que está luchando por mejorar.
Liz pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de perfumes variados, ya que de esa forma podrá seguir con sus ventas, luchando por mejorar sus ingresos y condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The group Rosa Poty is in its first lending cycle. Its members are all women and they are also part of a program to eliminate poverty. There are 17 members, all of whom are hard working and enterprising women. Liz is one of the members of this group and she sells perfumes. Her sales help her family have a better lifestyle. She is a self-sacrificing and hard working woman and is fighting to make things better. 

Liz is asking for a loan in order to invest in the purchase of various perfumes so she can continue selling merchandise and fighting to earn more money and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: purchase perfumes.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
La socia Maria Elena se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de ceviche,la socia por medio de este negocio la socia quiere salir adelante,el sueño de la socia es tener un restuarant.La socia solicita el credito para comprar limon,pescado y camote.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Maria Elena continues to work at her business of selling ceviche (marinated raw fish). She wants to get ahead through her business. Her dream is to own a restaurant. She is requesting the loan to buy lemon, fish and sweet potato. She is happy with the loan and promises to comply with the payments of the loan.

loans.use: to buy lemon, fish and sweet potato.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Due to the hardships of living, Catherine has been engaged in selling Avon products and grocery items. She is 23 years old and blessed with one child. She wants to make her business profitable in order to help her husband in meeting the needs of their family. Having inadequate capital, she would like to take a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy more Avon products and grocery items to resell. She believes that this loan will be a great help for her in improving the business.

loans.use: to buy more Avon products and grocery items to resell

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 40 years old and has six children. She personally sells the catch from her fishing boat in nearby municipalities. She has been a member in good standing of PMPC for almost three years. 

Elsa wants to obtain financial assistance to purchase new fish nets and floaters.  As much as possible, she has to have all the needed fishing accessories to minimize the chances of a low or zero catch. She already has floaters to help guard her fish cages. She also wants to buy the fish catch of her neighbors so she can sell more fish to the nearby fish market, where it will fetch higher prices. 

In the future, Elsa dreams of purchasing a new fishing boat by setting aside some savings from her daily sales. She wishes to see her children have stable jobs as well.

loans.use: to purchase new fish nets and floaters

loans.name: José Carlos

texts.es:
José de 52 años de edad,  es una persona casada, ha procreado 4 hijos y convive junto a su esposa, estudio hasta sexto grado.
José se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. Junto a su esposa que le apoya en las actividades agrícolas y en el ordeño de las vacas.

José se dedica  a la agricultura oficio que aprendió de sus padres, trabaja durante la mañana y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a cuidar las vacas que poseen y en la tarde se dedica a vigilar una finca donde obtiene un ingreso adicional para el sustento de su familia.

El préstamo que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar una vaca que necesita para incrementar la producción de leche para elaborar cuajada, crema, requesón que vende  su esposa en los alrededores de su casa.

José planea que con los ingresos que obtiene de la venta de lácteos, de la siembra y del préstamo para la compra de la vaca  podrá arreglar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en:
José, 52, is a married man.  He has four children and lives with his wife.  He has a sixth-grade education.  José gets up at 5 a.m. with his wife, who helps him in the farming tasks and milking the cows.

José earns a living in agriculture, work he learned from his parents.  In the morning, he works and his wife takes care of the household chores and their cows.  In the afternoon, he works looking after a farm, where he earns an additional income to support his family.

He's asking CrediCampo for a loan to buy a cow he needs to increase milk production for making curd, cream, and cottage cheese, which his wife sells in the area around their house.

José plans to fix the roof of his house with his income from selling the dairy products, from the farm, and from the loan for the cow.

loans.use: to buy a cow to increase milk production for making cheese

loans.name: Laurence

texts.en: Laurence is 24 years old; she has been selling clothes for five years. With the loan, she would like to buy more clothes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Aigul

texts.ru: Айгул 51 год, замужем, есть сын - студент. Образование у Айгул - среднее, на протяжении 22 лет занимается сельским хозяйством- животноводством и полеводством. Супруг Айгул и ее сын помогают по хозяйству. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Айгул есть 1 дойная корова и 1 лошадь. Также на участке мерою 1,45 ГА собственной  земли Айгул выращивает картофель, пшеницу и ячмень. Айгул обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков. Доходы от кредита Айгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота, а также в будущем купить квартиру для сына.
texts.en: Aigul is 51 years old, married and has one son, who is a student. Aigul has a secondary education and has been involved in agriculture - farming and animal husbandry for 22 years. Aigul's husband and son help her with the business. Today Aigul's business consists of 1 dairy cow and 1 horse. Aigul also grows potatoes, wheat and barley on her own land of 1.45 hectares. Aigul requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy bulls. Aigul plans to invest the earnings from the loan into continuing to increase her livestock headcount and buying an apartment for her son in the future.

loans.use: to buy bulls in order to develop her business

loans.name: Lorites

texts.en: Lorites is 37 years old and lives in Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has two school-age children. Lorites and her husband operate a jeepney transportation business. She has requested a loan to purchase jeepney spare parts for maintenance. Lorites has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Lorites hopes to expand her jeepney operation services.

loans.use: To purchase jeepney spareparts for maintenance

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Guapa está en su ciclo número 1° Del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 12 integrantes se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Gloria, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel dos, ella a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio de la venta de prendas de todo tipo que hace, se gana la vida de una manera digna y honrada.
La Sra. Solicita de este préstamo para la compra de prendas varias para vender, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The "Kuña Guapa" communal bank is in their first cycle of the Woman's Committee Program where all the members work and help each other to get ahead. They are participating in the Poverty Stoplight survey where all 12 members are below the poverty line.

One of the members is Gloria who in her last survey showed a poverty level two. Through her continual work and effort, by way of selling clothing of all types, she is making her living in a dignified and honorable manner. Gloria is requesting this loan to buy a variety of clothing to resell. This will help her solidify her business plan which will help her to increase her revenues.

loans.use: to buy various clothing for resale.

loans.name: Mukaram

texts.ru: Мукарам добродушная женщина. Ей 51 года. Она замужем. Ее муж пенсионер. Мукарам всегда трудится упорно, чтобы зарабатывать на жизнь. Она более чем 10 лет занимается изготовлением и продажей самбуса. Она печет самбуса в национальной печке танур. Она имеет большого опыта в данной сфере и завоевала своих покупателей. Она продает каждый день самбуса на местном рынке. Мукарам от полученного дохода обеспечивает свою семью продуктами питания. Пенсия мужа очень маленькая и не хватает для проживания. Она планирует пополнить оборотный капитал и поэтому она запрашивает займ на сумму 800 сомони для покупки лук, масло, муку, и т.п. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Mukaram is a kind-hearted woman. She is 51 years old. She is married. Her husband is retired. Mukaram has always worked hard to make a living. For over 10 years she has been making “sambusa” [traditional filled pastries] for sale. She bakes her sambusa in a traditional “tanoor” clay oven. She has plenty of experience and a loyal customer following. She sells sambusa at the local market every day. Mukaram uses her revenue to provide food for her family. Her husband’s pension is very small and insufficient for their living expenses. Mukaram plans to replenish her working capital, which is why she is requesting a loan in the amount of 800 TJS to buy onions, butter, flower etc. She is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy onions, butter, flour. etc. for making ‘sambusa’ pastries.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia tiene 40 años de edad, es conviviente, con un hijo a su cargo, vive en casa familiar, domiciliado en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Alicia se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral, hace 7 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio, ella solicita préstamo para capital de trabajo; compra de cuyes, patos, cerdos, el préstamo le ayudará a incrementar y diversificar su negocio de animales, ya que podrá atender todos los gustos de sus clientes asi como toda la demanda que estos tienen y de esta forma tendrá mayores ingresos, mejores ganancias y por ende ua mejora en su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Alicia is 40 years old, is in a relationship and has one dependent child. She lives in the family house located in a rural part of the district of Oyotún, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region on the North Coast of Peru.

Alicia has been raising and selling farm animals for 7 years. Her business is located at her house. She is requesting a loan to have working capital. She will buy guinea pigs, ducks and pigs. The loan will help her increase and diversify her business raising animals as she can take care of all the tastes of her clients and meet the demand she has. By doing this she will have more revenue, higher profits and in the end an improvement in her quality of living.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, ducks and pigs.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a cosmetic shop business, selling products to local neighbours. She faces a major challenge of delayed payments. She dreams of expanding into a wholesale business. 

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase body lotions, glycerine, powders and shampoo for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase body lotions, glycerine, powders and shampoo for sale.

loans.name: Industrial 10 Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “INDUSTRIAL 10” iniciará el décimo séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lourdes es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: pensión familiar, venta de licores, venta de mantillas, tejido de ropa de bebe, venta de frituras, venta de busos, tienda de barrio, carnicería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lourdes es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de elaboración de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo conocía anteriormente, ya que es un negocio familiar, es por ello que al obtener un pequeño capital decide independizarse. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de arroz y papa por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de las ferias de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene tres hijos.  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece la institución y el compartimiento con sus compañeras.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Industrial 10” is starting its 17th loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana Community Center. This group consists of eight members and is led by a Board of Directors in which Sra. Lourdes is the president. The members of this Communal Bank engage in various businesses such as operating a family boarding house, selling liquor, selling shawls, knitting baby clothes, selling fried foods, selling sweatshirts, managing a neighborhood store, and operating a butcher shop.

This loan will benefit small entrepreneurs such as Sra. Lourdes. She says that she joined Pro Mujer two years ago after receiving an invitation from a friend who is also a client of the organization. Lourdes currently has a business of preparing and selling food. She had previous knowledge about this type of business since she used to work at one that was owned by a relative. When she obtained a small amount of capital, she decided to become independent.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying rice and potatoes in bulk. She acquires her supplies from the wholesale vendors at the fairs in the city of El Alto and uses them to prepare the food that she sells from her vending space. Working in this manner enables her to generate income for supporting her family. Lourdes is in a common-law relationship and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Lourdes said that she enjoys the training seminars that are offered by the organization and being able to share with her fellow group members.

loans.use: to buy rice and potatoes in bulk.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
La socia Bertha se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de productos de belleza, la socia vende lápiz labiales, cremas y perfumes,por medio de este negocio la socia quiere salir adelante,  el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los productos de belleza. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cremas, lápiz labiales y perfumes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member Bertha still works selling beauty products. She sells lipsticks, creams and perfumes. Through this business, the member wants to be successful. Her dream is to have a store from which she can sell the beauty products. The member is requesting the loan to buy creams, lipsticks and perfumes.

She is happy about the loan and promises to make the repayments.

loans.use: to buy creams, lipsticks and perfumes.

loans.name: Melita

texts.en: Melita lives in Ozamiz City and supports her eight children by building houses from the ground up. She has successfully repaid her previous loan. She will use this loan to buy building materials and paint, and to pay her workers. She wants her children to get an education and escape the life of backbreaking work she has had to endure.

loans.use: to buy building materials and paint and to pay her workers

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is 27 years; she is married with one child, who does not yet go to school. She has been selling small items for three years. With the loan, she would like to buy more biscuits, chocolates and juice for sale. The profits from the business will be used to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: To buy more biscuits, chocolates and juice for sale.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is a hardworking 41-year-old farmer from Kobuso village in North Rift, Kenya. She a mother to two children, a girl and a boy. Annah has been doing mixed farming for five years, crops being her main source of income. 

Annah has always had a proclivity for livestock farming. She keeps a few sheep that provide her with home grown meat and wool. However, the sheep milk market is not open in Kenya. For this reason, Annah is seeking a loan to purchase a dairy cow and insure it. The cow will produce milk that will be used for consumption and sales. The money she makes from the milk sales will be used to repay the loan and pay for other personal uses. 

With your loan, Annah will realize a significant increase in milk production. The acquisition of the cow will boost the sales volume and profits alike. This whole investment will bring a sense of self-sufficiency and food security to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Santas

texts.en:
Santas is 53 years old, married and lives at Delusom, Mahayag ZDS Philippines. 

In order to earn a living she raises pigs with PMPC as her capital partner. She obtained the capital to purchase her original piglets & feed. Now, she is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy additional feed. 

She really hopes & prays that her business would grow and benefit her family, in addition to the income of her husband. 

Someday, she wants to build a concrete pig pen to easily maintain more sanitary conditions.

loans.use: to buy additional bags of feed.

loans.name: Torberita

texts.en:
Torberita is 30 years old, married, and a resident of Siayan, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. Her husband is a tricycle driver. They have 5 children, of which 2 are in school.  

Starting with 3,000 PHP as capital, she opened a sari-sari (general store) and was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum Cooperative. Aside from financial assistance, she was able to generate savings and enjoys the benefit given by the co-op. She became a member last April 2012 and has taken out three loans already without any record of default. 

Now she is applying for 5,000 PHP to buy additional stocks of canned goods, noodles, etc, for her sari-sari store.  In the future, Torberita wants to own a mini-mart someday, and she will be fully satisfied if she sees her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of canned goods, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Ginalyn

texts.en:
Ginalyn is 49 years old, and she is very responsible with her household obligations. She is a farmer who plants corn and beans in Mahayag.

Ginalyn wants to increase her sales. Consequently, she has requested a loan that will enable her to pay for land preparation and labor. She deeply wishes to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for land preparation and labor

loans.name: Nabusa

texts.en:
Nabusa is married. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She operates an open-air food business, selling in a shop to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  Her dream is to establish a wholesale business in the near future. 

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and rice for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and rice.

loans.name: Lida

texts.en:
Lida is a 51-year-old housekeeper who lives in the city of Tbilisi. She has a husband, daughter, son and father, who gets a pension from the local government. The only breadwinner in the family is Lida's husband. He works as a private artisan and generates approximately 500 to 600 GEL. However, this income is hardly enough for a family of five, and they require additional source for make financial stability. In spite of her high education, Lida can't find a stable job and has a great desire to start her own business.

Lida requested financial support to purchase a stock of products and to have money for working capital to open a general store. Lida has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan will greatly assist Lida, and she will be able to improve her economic situation and give her family a better style of life.

loans.use: To open a general store and earn her own income

loans.name: Maria Ponchita

texts.en:
Maria Ponchita is 52 years old. She is known in the Ozamiz area for her hog-raising business. She is actively participating in the various programs and services that the co-op offers. She hopes to live comfortably, with a decent house, for which reason she applied for a loan to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks. 

Maria Ponchita hopes to maintain her membership in good standing, with a good repayment record. It matters that she has been given priority, as a microfinance member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). This is what she is thankful for, when all the financing needs of her retailing business are supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks for her house.

loans.name: Loutfi

texts.en:
Loutfi is a 22-year-old single man, who decided two years ago to work as a DJ to help his father in covering their family’s increasing living needs and expenses.

Today, Loutfi is acquiring a YOUTH Loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to buy the latest sound and music equipment to provide his customers with better services, and develop his career in a well managed way.

Loutfi hopes to expand his work more in the upcoming future to improve his living conditions, and he wishes to be a well known DJ.

loans.use: to buy new the latest sound  and music equipment to provide his customers with better services.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en: Jonathan is 29 years old. He has been selling shop goods for 10 years. With the loan, he would like to buy more soap, salt and sugar for resale. The profits from the business will be used to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more soap, salt and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Kapsumai is a typical village in Kapsowar area of Kenya where around 100 families live, suffering from poverty and malnutrition. Most of the people make their livelihood by working as labourers in the agricultural fields belonging to farmers in neighboring and more distant villages. 

Benson a father of four who has been practicing farming on a small inherited piece of land for the past six years. To afford a decent and comfortable life for his children, he has been selling milk, eggs and varieties of food crops from his farmland. To make ends meet and make extra cash, he has been engaging in other small personal businesses. 

The Kapsowar area has high demand for poultry products. Like many farmers from his region, Benson finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and he stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” His biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand that is really high. He lacks funds to increase his poultry farming, so he is seeking a loan of 20,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry. Being from a marginalized community, he finds that accessing funds is very challenging. However, through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, he feels relieved knowing that his dream will be achieved, and he will be able to buy more poultry. With the loan, he will be able to provide more eggs and poultry products to his neighbors and to the local market. This will translate to increased profit margins and an improved income level. 

Being a visionary man, he intends to accumulate more profits and expand his poultry business to other markets. This will increase his income and improve his living conditions. The extra income he will get will be used in fully repaying back the loan, permanently changing his living conditions, and securing the future of his school-going children.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda is from  Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is  married and has 13 grandchildren. Luzminda had the idea of engaging in the pottery making business, since she has the necessary skills. She started the business with 2,000 PHP capital in 1993. It earns her an income that enables them to survive. 

In the year 2008, Luzminda became an active member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative. She has had several loans already without any record of default up to the present day. Recently, she requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to expand her inventory and to buy additional raw materials for the pottery. 

Luzminda wants to sell her stock, wholesale, in nearby municipalities. She deeply wishes to fulfil her dreams to support her family's needs, and her grandchildren as well, from her income

loans.use: to buy additional raw materials for her pottery making business.

location.town: Plaridel - Biasong, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es:
Juan José tiene 49 años de edad, es casado, sin hijos a su cargo, vive con su familia en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Juan José se dedica a la crianza de animales(patos, chivos, conejos, cuyes, pollos, entre otros), además de las labores agrícolas, con más de 10 años de experiencia en el negocio, el mismo que está ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio, él solicita préstamo para compra de un número mayor de animales (patos, chivos, conejos, cuyes, pollos, entre otros) y para realizar arreglos en su corral(lugar donde cría a sus animales), dicha inversión le servirá para tener mayor variedad y productividad en animales, con gran influencia en el negocio; él piensa incrementar su stock de animales para poder atender las diversas gustos y necesidades de los clientes de la zona.
texts.en:
Juan José is 49 years old, married and has no dependent children. He lives with his family in a rural part of the district of Oyotún, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the North Coast of Peru.

Juan José works raising animals (ducks, goats, rabbits, guinea pigs, chickens, etc.) besides his agricultural work. His business is located at the rear of his house and he has been in business for more than 10 years.

The loan he is requesting is to buy a greater number of animals (ducks, goats, rabbits, guinea pigs, chickens, etc.) and to make improvements on his corral (where he raises his animals). This investment will allow him to have greater variety and higher productivity with his animals which will make a big difference in his business. He wants to increase his stock of animals to be able to supply the diverse tastes and necessities of his clients in the area.

loans.use: to buy ducks, goats, rabbits, guinea pigs, chickens, etc and to make improvements to his corral.

loans.name: Shafii

texts.en:
Shafii is in his late 20s, married and has two daughters, one in school and the other still a baby. He runs three businesses. He manages his own garage where he repair motorbikes, sells spare parts for motorbikes, and owns a shop that sells cosmetics. Cosmetics was his first business and it succeeded with good management, providing funds to start his new business of selling spare parts. He really works hard and has been running these businesses for two years now. Working from 7:30 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. daily, Shafii is able to earn a good profit each month. He runs his businesses with assistance from his wife.

He has approached Tujijenge Tanzania, a Kiva partner, to request business loan support. He will invest his loan to replenish his spare parts business with more parts. Shafii desires to expand his shops and to be a successful father. He is so thankful to everyone who will support his business. Shafii will be accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to replenish his spare parts business with more parts.

loans.name: Rosegen

texts.en: Rosegen is 35 years old and has two children. She manages a piggery to make a living while her husband works abroad. For over two years, she has earned well from this business that absolutely meets her family's needs. She joined Gata Daku MPC to borrow funds to purchase feeding supplies. She is hoping that with this investment, she would receive more income to cover the expansion costs of her piggery.

loans.use: to purchase feeding supplies

loans.name: Mafinga Group

texts.en:
Edita is in her mid-40s, is married, and has three children who go to school. She has been running two businesses, selling cosmetics and clothes.  She has operated her businesses for three years now.  She works from 9 a.m. to 8 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Edita's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to increase her cosmetics stock and to buy clothes to resell. She dreams of making her business big.

Edita will share this loan with her loan group, Mafinga, which consists of three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase the cosmetics stock and to buy clothes to resell.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is married and a 38-year-old mother of two. She runs a snack vending business to make a living. For over fifteen years, she has been able to help add to her husband's income in order to meet their daily expenditures. She has saved a little portion of her revenue for the future education of her children. 

Jennifer joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) and borrowed a new loan to purchase additional raw ingredients to prepare snacks and iced candy for sale. In the future, she wants to build a little shop for her vending business.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw ingredients to prepare snacks and iced candy for sale

loans.name: Reginna

texts.en:
Reginna is a married woman who lives in her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food and water. 

For the past three years, she has operated an agricultural selling business, selling farm produce from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of disease outbreak leading to losses. She dreams of expanding her business to generate more income. 

With the 15,000 KES loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase more seedlings and pesticides for her farm. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more seedlings and pesticides for her farm.

loans.name: Myrian Marisol

texts.es:
Recinto San Juan de Puerto Quito un lugar de clima cálido húmedo su gente es amable y muy trabajadora, en este Recinto sus habitantes son muy unidos y todas las tardes organizan encuentros deportivos, para fortalecer sus lasos de amistad. 
En este recinto vive y tiene el negocio la señora Myrian una mujer luchadora de 43 años, mantiene una sólida relación de casada de la cual tiene 3 hijos el mayor tiene 22 años y el ultimo tiene 16, el esposo trabaja como chofer profesional.
Ella se dedica a la venta de productos por catálogo, aprendió de este negocio por iniciativa propia, al mismo le dedica un promedio de 6 horas por día, solicita el crédito para invertir en la vivienda en arreglar el techo y los interiores. 
Con esta nueva inversión mejorara la calidad de vida de su familia, la señora Myrian agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por en apoyo y las oportunidades brindadas.
texts.en:
Recinto San Juan de Puerto Quito is a warm and humid place with nice and hardworking people. The inhabitants of Recinto are united and every afternoon they organize sport events to strengthen their friendship bonds. 

Myriam lives and has her business in Recinto. She is a tenacious 43-year-old woman who maintains a solid marriage. She has three children -- the oldest is 22 years old and the youngest is 16. Her husband works as a professional driver. 

She works selling catalog products. She learned this occupation on her own initiative and works 6 hours per day on average. She is requesting the loan to fix the inside of her home and the roof.

Her quality of life will improve with this investment. Myriam thanks Fundacion Alternativa and Kiva for their support and the opportunities that they provided.

loans.use: to improve her home.

loans.name: Jubelyn

texts.en:
Jubelyn, 29 years old, is single and lives in Panalsalan, Plaridel, Philippines. In order to help her parents in raising their family, Jubelyn decided to stop her studies and engaged in a fish vending business to support the education of her siblings. The fish she buys are sold at the public market or to their neighbors. She has been in this business for many years already.  

Since she wants to be more productive, Jubelyn has now decided to expand her resources, purchasing fish in bulk for resale at the market. In May, 2013 Jubelyn joined Paglaum MPC to access financial assistance for her project. She has now applied for a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy more fish for resale. She is hoping that with Paglaum’s help, and with the moral support of her family, she can look forward to being a successful vendor someday and to owning a stall in the public market. And she will be very happy seeing her siblings finish their studies and have stable jobs in the future.

loans.use: To buy more fish for resale

loans.name: Mahina

texts.ru: Махина проживает в районе Гиссар вместе с бабушкой и женой брата. Ей 25 лет. Она замужем, однако сейчас ее муж находится в России на заработках. У них пока детей нету. Махина тоже работает и зарабатывает на жизнь. Уже два года как она занимается шитьем женских национальных платьев. Этой деятельности ее научила жена брата. Махина предоставляет свои услуги у себя дома. Она сейчас хочет расширить деятельность и на сумму кредита собирается купить компьютерную швейную машинку для того чтобы делать вышивки на платьях. Благодаря кредиту сфера ее услуг расширится и количество ее заказов тоже увеличится. Махина надеется на этот кредит.
texts.en: Mahina lives in the Gissar district with her grandmother and brother's wife. She is 25 years old. She is married, however, her husband is working in Russia. They do not yet have children. Mahina also works and earns a living. She has been involved in sewing women's national dresses for two years already. Her sister-in-law taught her this business. Mahina provides the services at her home. She currently wants to expand her business and is planning to purchase a computerized sewing machine in order to make embroideries on dresses. Thanks to the loan, the scope of her services will expand, and the number of her orders will increase as well. Mahina relies on this loan.

loans.use: to purchase a computerized sewing machine in order to make embroideries on dresses

loans.name: Richard Yonathan

texts.es:
Richard es un joven soltero de 29 años con muchos deseos de superación, trabaja en la Municipalidad de su ciudad natal, Sayan. Con mucho esfuerzo estudió la carrera de Derecho, más adelante quiere abrir su propio estudio de Abogados. Es una persona muy responsable, siempre actuando con ética y honestidad.
Richard quiere tener mayores oportunidades laborales, es por ello que va a utilizar el crédito para poder tramitar su Título Profesional. Está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva por su generosidad porque esto le ayudará a mejorar su calidad de vida y más adelante podrá cumplir sus objetivos trazados.
texts.en:
Richard is a young single man, 29 years old, with a strong desire to achieve. He works in the Municipality of his birth city, Sayan. He put in a lot of effort to study his degree in law, and in the future he wants to open his own law firm. He is a very responsible person, always behaving ethically and honestly.

Richard wants to have better professional opportunities, and this is why he is going to use the loan to pay for the processing of his degree. He is very grateful to the Kiva lenders for their generosity, because this will help him to improve his quality of life, and later, to be able to achieve the goals he has set.

loans.use: to pay processing costs for his degree

loans.name: Liliosa

texts.en: Liliosa is a widow with four adult children who settled down to earn a living and has been  running a buy-and-sell business in order to provide for  the needs of her four children. She sells grocery goods  in their village aside from her income through farming. To improve sales, she took a new loan to purchase more grocery goods to sell. In the future, Liliosa wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Falantia

texts.en:
Falantia is a 19-year-old lady and lives with her parents. She has been working in a big mall for one and a half years. Along with mother and sister, Falantia initiated a business producing cakes to sell in a kiosk and food stall near their residence.  Since she is working in the Mall, she can support the business with additional capital. 

Currently, she needs more cash to support the business, considering the ingredients' prices are getting higher. In addition, they want to sell a “Nasi Kuning” package (a package of yellow rice with some dishes as fried fermented soybeans, noodles, omelet and chili sauce) but she does not have enough money to do so. 

Therefore she has applied for an individual loan of IDR 3,000,000 from TLM. The loan will be spent on purchasing cakes and “Nasi Kuning” ingredients such as wheat flour, rice flour, green beans, corn, chocolate powder, etc. and cake boxes that will help them to carry the cakes to the food stall or kiosk.

loans.use: to purchase cakes and “Nasi Kuning” ingredients such as wheat flour, rice flour, green beans, corn, chocolate powder, etc and cakes containers

loans.name: Luka

texts.en:
The Kapsowar area of Kenya is a county of remote villages that have remained largely disconnected from the world. Luka, who has been practicing mixed farming for the past five years, has shown a lot of resilience.
Luka has been able to gather a lot of experience learning all the farming techniques. Luka, being a responsible man who cherishes his family, would want to see his family grow economically and to have an impact on society. He wants to increase his farming business and is seeking a loan of 26,875 KES. He will use the loan to buy a dairy cow, which would in turn, increase his milk production. The cow dung from the animal will be used as fertilizer for his small  garden, where he grows vegetables to sell and for home consumption. Luka is very comfortable with the repayment period and monthly installments, and his projections are that he will be able to repay the loan even before the due date. Through the loan, Luka would be able to sell milk to his neighbors and also to the nearby villages, generating much profit. This would result in better living conditions for his family. Lukas’ target and dream is to open a milk processing plant once he has accumulated more capital.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Logelin

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Logelin works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling dressed chicken and chorizo in the Philippines and earns additional income from selling vegetables. Logelin is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy more dressed chicken and chorizo to sell to her customers.

Logelin has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more dressed chicken and chorizo to sell to her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chairs and tables to outfit her small business to gradually turn it into a restaurant

loans.name: Patricia Cumanda

texts.es:
La señora Patricia una mujer luchadora de 33 años vive y tiene su negocio en un pequeño Recinto llamado San Bernabé el mismo que está ubicado al noroccidente de la Provincia de Pichincha en el Cantón San Miguel de los Bancos  este Recinto es muy visitado por turistas nacionales y extranjeros a disfrutar de sus maravillosas hosterías y sitios de descanso que pueden encontrar, el clima es cálido húmedo, tradicionalmente realizan fiestas en honor al patrono San Bernabé, mantiene una sólida relación en unión libre de la cual tienen 4 hijos el mayor tiene 13 años y el ultimo tiene 3 años, el esposo trabaja como administrador en una finca del sector. 
Se dedica a la venta de productos por revista como yambal, aprendió de esta actividad por iniciativa propia al mismo le dedica una 8 horas por día solo los fines de semana, porque de lunes a viernes ayuda a su esposo en los trabajos de la finca, ella viene de una familia de bajos recursos económicos y no pudo continuar con sus estudios, solicita este crédito para dar inicio a un nuevo negocio una granja de cerdos, con esta nueva inversión mejorar sus ingresos económicos y podrá ayudar a la preparación de sus hijos, la Señora Patricia  agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y las oportunidad brindada.
texts.en:
Patricia is a tenacious, 33 year-old woman who lives and has a business in a small rural settlement called "San Bernabe."  This area is located in the northwest part of Pichincha province, in the canton of San Miguel de los Bancos.  Many national and foreign tourists come to visit this area to enjoy the wonderful inns and restful places that they can find here, where the climate is hot and humid.  In this place, they celebrate traditional festivals in honor of the patron saint San Bernabe.  

Patricia is in a strong relationship, a common-law marriage, which has produced 4 children.  The oldest child is 13, and the youngest is 3.  Her husband works as a manager on a farm in the area.  Patricia has a business selling products through a catalog, such as Yanbal beauty products.  She learned this business on her own initiative, and she does this work on the weekends, working 8 hours per day.  During the week, she helps her husband with the farm work.  Patricia came from a low-income family and was not able to continue her education.  

Patricia is requesting a loan to start up a new pig farming business.  With this new investment, she will increase her income and will be able to help with the education of her children.  Patricia thanks the Fundacion Alternativa and Kiva for this support, and for the opportunity that they are provided her.

loans.use: to start up a pig farm

loans.name: Munyiva

texts.en:
Munyiva, aged 39 years, is married with four school-going children. They live at their own house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She has operated an agricultural produce selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of disease outbreak and pests affecting her crops.

With the loan she is requesting of Kes 20,000, Munyiva wants to purchase more seedlings and a water pump for water irrigation in her farm. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more seedlings and a water pump for irrigation in her farm.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
Manuela tiene 57 años de edad, ella es una mujer emprendedora y decidida para poder superar en la vida, ella no se deja vencer por los obstáculos que la vida le pone sino ella alcanza todo sus mentas y sueños, ella tiene un hijo de un año de edad y se ha convertido en el motivo para que Manuela se levante todos los días para trabajar y solo así tener un ingreso económico para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia. 	

Ella obtiene sus ingresos económicos por medio de la producción de maxan en la comunidad donde ella vive, sus padres le enseñaron dicha actividad desde hace 30 años, ella realiza la venta de su producto en el mercado y en los alrededores de su comunidad y así tener un ingreso económico para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.

El uso respectivo que ella dará al crédito es para la compra de terreno para poder cultivar mas maxan en su comunidad, ya que para ella es de mucha importancia que sus plantas de maxan produzcan hojas de primera calidad y así no perder a los clientes con que el cuenta.

Una de las grandes aspiraciones de ella es la siembra de más plantas de maxan y ver crecer a su hijo en el campo de la educación y convertirse en profesionales en la vida.
texts.en:
Manuela is 57 years old. She is an enterprising and determined woman who has been able to get ahead in life. Manuela has never allowed the obstacles in life to get in the way of accomplishing all of her goals and dreams. She has a one-year-old child who has become the drive that motivates her to wake up every day in order to work. This is the only way for her to have an income for improving her family’s living conditions.

Manuela earns her income by producing “maxan” (calathea) in the community where she lives. Her parents taught her this trade 30 years ago. Manuela sells her product at the market and in the surrounding neighborhoods of her community. With the income she earns, she is able to improve her family’s living conditions.

The loan she is receiving will be used to buy land so that she can cultivate more “maxan” plants in her community. For Manuela, this is very important since her “maxan” plants produce leaves that are of the highest quality. She does not want to lose any of her current customers.

Among her greatest aspirations are to plant more “maxan” and to see her son grow in his education so that he can become a professional in life.

loans.use: to buy more farm land.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina tiene 55 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 02 hijas una dependiente de ella y otra independiente económicamente, Marina vive en el distrito de Pucará, el cual es un distrito mediano con aspiraciones a superarse, en dicho distrito la población se dedica a la agricultura siendo el cultivo de arroz el de mayor producción, así como al comercio en general. Dicho distrito está ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

Marina se dedica al comercio cuenta con un puesto en el mercado de abastos de Pucará, en la cual se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad, cuenta con más de 03 años vendiendo en el mercado de abastos, por lo que cuenta con experiencia en el rubro, por su buen servicio y experiencia cuenta con bastante clientela, y tiene muy buenas referencias personales, solvencia moral y económica. El destino del crédito es para invirtirlo en su negocio, en la compra de una cantidad mayor de mercadería para ofrecer a sus clientes todos los productos que estos demanden según sus gustos y preferencias; y de esta forma poder adquirir una utilidad aceptable para que mejore su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Marina is a 55-year-old single mother. She has two daughters -- one depends on Marina and the other one is financially independent. Marina lives in the district of Pucara, which is a middle-class district where people have the desire to improve themselves. The population of this district works primarily on agriculture (especially rice harvesting) and on commerce. Pucara is located in the provice of Jaen, region of Cajamarca, northern highlands of Peru. 

Marina's occupation is commerce. She has a stand in Pucara's market, where she sells basic necessities. She has had her stand for more than three years, which is why she has experience in his field. Because of her good service and experience, she has a lot of customers and good personal references and financial solvency. The loan will be used to invest on her business, buying a larger quantity of merchandise to offer her clients all of the products that they demand depending on their tastes and preferences. This way, she will be able to improve her earnings and quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in her business, buying a larger quantity of merchandise.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.es:
El señor Gabriel, es de la ciudad de Santaní, está casado, es mecánico, tiene un taller que con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio montó, además vende repuestos  y lubricantes en general, gracias a su buen servicio y trabajo.
Es un señor muy trabajador, responsable y muy honesto, empezó a trabajar como ayudante en una gomería, después como chofer, su sueño era de trabajar en forma independiente y no depender de otra persona.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de repuestos varios para poder seguir con sus ventas, y atendiendo de la mejor manera a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mr. Gabriel is from the city of Santaní, he is married, and he works as a mechanic. He has a workshop where he works hard and sacrifices a lot. He also sells replacement parts and general lubricants. He provides good service and works hard. 

Gabriel is a hard worker, responsible and honest. He began working as an assistant at a tire factory, then he worked as a chauffeur, but his dream was to have his own business and not have to depend on someone else. 

He is asking for this loan so he can purchase more replacement parts so he can continue his sales and to be able to meet customer demand.

loans.use: purchase replacement parts.

loans.name: Saray Eugenio

texts.es:
Saray abre su negocio cada mañana solo con el deseo de cuantas personas llegan con el a pedirle que les trabaja sus vehículos  el tiene 39 años de edad tiene 3 hijos el primero es de 17 años de edad y es estudiante en la escuela de su comunidad y el segundo tiene 14 años de edad también estudiante y el ultimo que apenas tiene 4 años de edad que aun no estudia, sus hijos se ha convertido en un reto para el en poder sacarlos adelante dándoles las condiciones de vidas adecuadas y ver que se conviertan en profesionales.

La actividad que el desempeña es mecánico en su comunidad el realiza  la reparación de motores de motocicletas vehículos y más para las personas y también pone a la disposición del público la venta de todo tipo de motocicletas ya que uno de los sueños de Saray es la venta de motos pues ya es una realidad ya que ahora le genera muy buena ganancia para poder sustentar a su familia y apoyar a sus hijos para que ellos tengan el estudio que se merecen.

El motivo por el cual el realiza un préstamo es para la remodelación de vivienda ya que las condiciones en las que se encuentra su casa no son las adecuadas para tener una condición de vida adecuada.  Uno de las aspiraciones de Saray es  darles educación a sus hijos y que se conviertan en profesionales y prestar un buen servicio a las personas que lo requieren en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Saray opens his business every morning with the hope that many people will come to ask for his vehicle repair services. He is 39 years old and he has 3 children; the first is 17 and goes to school in the community, the second is 14 and also goes to school and the third is barely 4 years old and does not yet go to school. His children have turned into his reason for living and the reason he wants to be successful; so he can provide them with acceptable living conditions and to see them become professionals with a career. 

He primarily works repairing motorcycle motors for individuals. He also sells all manner of motorcycles to the general public. One of Saray's dreams is to be a full time salesman, and it seems to be a possibility for the future because it already brings in a lot of money for the family. The income he earns from sales helps him provide for his family and to pay for his children's education. 

The reason he wants to ask for a loan is because he needs to remodel his home because his current living conditions are not up to the standards he wishes for his children. One of his aspirations is to give an education to his children and to see them have a professional career one day. He also wants to provide a good service to his customers.

loans.use: home remodeling.

loans.name: Las Marias Group

texts.es:
17 mujeres integran este grupo, son todas vecinas y amigas de la ciudad de Lambaré, están poniendo su mejor empeño para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
Son mujeres muy luchadoras, que quieren capacitarse para ir creciendo no solo en lo económico, sino también como persona, una de ellas es Sonia, quien se dedica a la costura como medio de vida, por medio de este trabajo ayuda a su familia y a sus seres queridos para las necesidades del día a día.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas e hilos para que de esa forma pueda seguir con sus confecciones, cumpliendo con el pedido de sus clientes. Agradece por la ayuda que esta recibiendo que le será muy útil.
texts.en:
Seventeen women make up this group, they are all neighbors and friends in the city of Lambaré. They are putting their best food forward in order to improve their living conditions and those of their families.

They are hard working women and they want to enable themselves to grow not only economically, but also personally.

One of these women is named Sonia. She makes a living as a seamstress. She is able to help her family and her loves ones with their day to day needs. She is asking for a loan so she can invest in purchasing more fabric and thread so she can continue to sew and finish customer's jobs. She is thankful for the help that she is receiving because she thinks it will be very useful.

loans.use: purchase fabric and thread.

loans.name: Amigas Por Siempre De Villaandrani Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AMIGAS POR SIEMPRE DE VILLA ANDRANI” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Janneth es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de leche, venta de ensalada de frutas, costura de polleras, venta de queso, tejido de mantas.
 
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Janneth es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de mantas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace tres años por el incentivo de su madre y de su hermana, quienes trabajan con el mismo productos.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra lana por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en unión libre.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece la institución
texts.en:
The Community Group "Friends for Ever of Villa Andrani" will begin their first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Focal Center of Copacabana.  The group has eight members and is directed by a board, of which Janneth is the president.  The business the members are carrying out are varied.  Among the businesses are the sale of milk, fruit salad and cheese, sewing traditional skirts, and knitting shawls.  

The loan they will receive will help this group of small business women, of whom Janneth is one.  She says that is the firt time she has belonged to a Pro Mujer group, having been invited by a promotor who came to visit her home.  Janneth now has a busiess knitting shawls.  She wants it known that she began his business three years ago with encouragement from her mother and sister, who also make these products.   The loan Janneth will receive is for increase of capital (purchase  of wool in bulk). She will make the purchase from the wholesale vendors of the city of La Paz, and later after working the l, will sell things in her vending stall.  This type of work allows Janneth to generate resources to support her family, since she lives in a civil union.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Janneth answers that she is pleased with the funding offered by the organization.

loans.use: to buy wool wholesale

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en: Rosa is juggling a business and supervising the renovation of her home. Rosa hopes to live comfortably with a house of good roofing, supported by her loan of PHP 5,000. She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing, with a good repayment record. It matters that Rosa has been given a priority as a microfinance member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). This is what she was thankful for when all her financing needs on her retailing business were supported by PMPC.

loans.use: pay for house renovation.

loans.name: Nardia Pamela

texts.es:
Nardia Pamela tiene 44 años de edad, vive en casa familiar de material rustico, con su hijo de 12 años de edad el cual cursa secundaria en colegio nacional del distrto de Pucará. Nardia Pamela es natural de la zona. Ella vive en la parte rural del distrito de Pucará contando con servicios de agua y luz. Dicho distrito está ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza Nardia Pamela es la venta de productos de belleza, cuenta con clientela propia de la zona, las ventas las realiza en su domicilio asi como en caserios aledaños, cuenta con más de 4 años dedicandose a este rubro. El destino del crédito será para ivertir en su negocio surtiendo con nuevos productos de belleza (talco, pefumes, joyas, maquillaje, entre otros.), con ello le generará mayores ingresos y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida. Para este rubro no hay mayor competencia en la zona y con ello obtiene mejores precios.
texts.en:
Nardia Pamela is 44 years old and she lives in her family home with her son who is 12 years old. Her son who attends secondary school at the national institute in the district of Pucará. Nardia Pamela is originally from this region. She lives in a rural part of the district but she has water and electricity. This district is located in the province of Jaén, in the region of Cajamarca in the north of Peru. 

Narida Pamela sells beauty products for a living and she has her own customer base in the area. She sells her merchandise from her home as well as in other homes. She has more than 4 years of experience. The loan she is asking for will be used to invest in more merchandise to stock her business with, such as beauty products like talcum powder, perfume, jewelry, makeup etc. With more merchandise, she will be able to make more money and be able to improve her quality of life. She has no competition in the area and she can sell her merchandise at low cost prices.

loans.use: purchase merchandise like beauty products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy compost, foliar insecticides, fertilizers, and other products to care for her coffee plants

loans.name: Muazzama

texts.ru: Муаззама родилась в 1983 году. Она разведенная и имеет одного ребенка. Муаззама работает в финансовом отделе государственного учреждения района, ведущем специалистом. Она очень трудолюбивая женщина и выполняет свою работу отлично. Муаззама всегда стремится к саморазвитию. Она 4 года назад поступила в Худжандский Государственный Университет по специальности Банковское дело для получения второго высшего образования. Данное время она является студентом 4 курса данного университета и должна оплатить за учебный договор. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Muazzama was born in 1983. She is divorced and has one child. Muazzama works as a leading specialist at a financial department of the district government institution. She is a very hardworking woman and does her work excellently. Muazzama always tries to advance herself. She was accepted to the Khujand State University 4 years ago to study Banking and obtain a second degree. At the present time, she is a fourth-year student at this university and needs to pay for her tuition. She is requesting this loan to pay for the tuition. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for tuition

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.es:
La socia Antonieta se sigue dedicando al negocio de  fotocopiadora, la socia realiza servicios de fotocopias, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de fotocopiadora.La socia solicita el crédito para comprar papeles y tintas para la fotocopiadora.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Antonieta works in a photocopy store where she helps customers with their various needs. She works from 8am to 5pm and she already has 5 years of experience here. Everything is going well and her dream is to be able to grow the business.

She is asking for a loan so she can purchase more paper and ink cartridges for the photocopy machine.

She is happy for the opportunity to ask for this loan and she promises to make timely repayments.

loans.use: purchase paper and ink for a photocopier.

loans.name: Gladys Ruth

texts.es:
La socia Gladys Ruth se sigue dedicando al trabajo como profesora de niños,la socia por medio de este trabajo quiere salir adelante,el sueño de la socia es tener su jardin de niños.La socia solicita el credito para comprar un televisor para su casa.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Gladys Ruth works as a teacher. She hopes to get ahead in life in this profession and her dream is to have her own kindergarten. She is asking for a loan to purchase a television for her home.

She is happy for the opportunity the loan presents and she promises to make timely repayments.

loans.use: purchase a television.

loans.name: Delia Cleidy

texts.es:
Delia Cleidy tiene 20 años de edad, vive en el caserio de Playa Azúl, en la casa de sus padres dedicada a la venta de productos de belleza, por más de tres años, la casa de Delia Cleidy se encuentra en el distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

Delia Cleidy se dedica a la venta de productos de productos de belleza(maquillaje, prefumes, joyas, entre otros), desde hace tres años. Ella necesita del crédito para la implementacion de su negocio comprando mayor mercadería para sutir y aumentar su stock de productos y asi poder incrementar sus ganacias, para que pueda mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Delia Cleidy is 20 years old and she lives in the village of Playa Azul. She lives with her parents and she earns money by selling beauty products. She has more than three years of experience. Her home is in the district of Pucará, in the province of Jaen, in the region of Cajamarca in the north of Peru.

Delia Cleidy sells beauty products like makeup, perfume, jewelry etc. She needs this loan so she can purchase more merchandise for her business, increase her stock and increase her earnings. More income means a better quality of life for her and her family.

loans.use: purchase more merchandise.

loans.name: Berenice Jhoselyn

texts.es:
Jhoselyn, tiene 20 años, vive con sus abuelos en una casa arrendada en el sector de Natabuela, zona de abundante producción de artesanías hechas en madera las cuales ofrecen dentro y fuera de la provincia, artesanías que son bien creadas que son hechas a manos, los turistas vienen a comprar las dichas artesanías como águilas hechas en madera, Jesucristo, cabezas de cristo viejos, vasijas y otras artesanías más.
La inversión del crédito lo va utilizar en la compra de más productos LEUDINE, esta actividad lo viene realizando por más de un año ofreciendo los productos de puerta en puerta actividad que aprendió por una amiga y también por la necesidad que tenía en esos momentos y que hoy en día es su fuente de ingreso, y con esto puede ayudar en todo lo que necesite su hija y en su hogar ya que ha sido medio difícil adaptarse  a ser madre tan joven con una responsabilidad a esta edad que actualmente está manteniendo pero aun así sigue luchando para demostrar que sola puede llevar adelante su hogar y brindar todo lo mejor a su hija con su pequeño negocio que tiene actualmente.
Jhoselyn agradece a fundación alternativa y a KIVA por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Jhoselyn is 20 years old, and lives with her grandparents in a rented house in the Natabuela area, which produces a lot of artisan woodwork which is sold both in and outside the province. These pieces are well-made, made by hand, and tourists come to buy these items, like wooden eagles, Jesus Christ figures, heads of Christ, vessels, and other craft pieces. 

She will invest the loan in buying more LEUDINE (health and beauty product direct sales brand) products. She has been selling them for more than a year, going door to door. She learned this from a friend and also because she needed it at that time, and now it is her source of income. With this she can help with all the things that her daughter and her household need, as it has been somewhat difficult for her to adapt to being a mother so young, with a responsibility like the one she now has, at her age. But even so, she keeps fighting to show that she can keep her household going by herself, and give her daughter the best with the small business she currently has. Jhoselyn thanks Fundación Alternativa and Kiva for the help they give her.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise and products that she offers

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is married and a mother of three children who attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water.

She sells fruit and green vegetables. She always struggles to improve her grocery stall, trying to sell more and save money in order to have a more formal establishment. Mwanamisi is requesting a loan to buy sacks of fruit and green vegetables for resale.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fruit and green vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Maria Del Rocio

texts.es:
Roció, tiene 36 años, tiene 2 hijos los cuales están estudiando, viven en casa arrendada durante 5 años en sector de Natabuela zona que pertenece a la Provincia de Imbabura sector donde hay turismo, platos típicos como las fritadas Amazonas, zona donde también las personas se dedican a confecciones de ropa que diariamente salen a ofrecer en distintas ferias de la provincia son personas trabajadoras y responsables.
Tiene una sala de belleza en el sector centro de Atuntaqui brinda servicios de corte de cabello, tintes y otros, la inversión que va realizar con el crédito es de incrementar más sillas y herramientas de trabajo para una mejor atención y entender a más clientes en su local y también tener una muy buena presentación de su local para atraer a más gente de la zona, con el negocio solventa todas las necesidades que tiene en su hogar cada mes y ayudar en todo lo necesario a sus hijos para que sigan estudiando y que sean personas de bien en el futuro.
Agradece a Fundación Alternativa por apoyar en la actividad que viene realizando por 2 años y que así sigan adelante brindando su apoyo a las demás personas que necesitan de capital para mantener sus negocios.
texts.en:
Rocio, 36, has two children who attend school.  The family has lived in a rented house for five years in the Natabuela sector which belongs to the Imbabura Province.  In this area there is tourism, regional dishes such as Amazon fritters.  People here also make clothing that they go out to sell daily at the different markets in the province.  They are hard-working, responsible people.

Rocio has a beauty salon in the central part of Atuntaqui where she offers hair cuts, hair color and other services.  She plans to use the loan to buy more chairs and work tools in order to provide better customer service and attend to more people in her shop.  She also wants her shop to be more attractive to people in the area.  Through her business activity she is able to cover the monthly household expenses and help her children with all that is necessary so they can continue their education and be good people in the future.

She is grateful to the Fundación Alternativa for supporting the business she has been in for two years now and hopes they will continue to support other people who need funding for their businesses.

loans.use: To buy chairs for her beauty salon to attract customers.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 64 years old and widowed with five children. Elena works very hard to provide for them.

Elena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like beans, eggs, bread, detergent, soap, canned goods, sanitary pads, etc. to sell.

Elena has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as beans, eggs, bread, detergent soap, canned goods, sanitary pads, etc. 

Elena would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like beans, eggs, bread, detergent, soap, canned goods, sanitary pads, etc. to sell

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya, and at over 6,300 feet above sea level, is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize-producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya.” Many farmers in the region have started projects planting bluegum trees on their land, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. The people around Kitale have been beekeeping for centuries, and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.

Susan is married and has four children. Both she and her husband are farmers. They have been farming for twenty years now and they are currently growing maize, beans, bananas and trees and they also keep livestock. Susan is excited about beekeeping as it will provide her with honey and the bees will help in pollinating their crops.

This is Susan's first loan with Honey Care and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to build a permanent house. Susan's hope for the future is to live a better life.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: pay for tuition and travel.

loans.name: Soledad Gabriela

texts.es:
Soledad es una madre de familia luchadora,  tiene una familia que siempre está unida en las buenas y en las malas, trabaja como ayudante en un puesto en el mercado de su ciudad natal, Sayan.
Su familia y principalmente sus hijos son el motor de su vida, su sueño es poder brindarles una educación y una mejor vida que ella no pudo gozar de pequeña debido a situaciones económicas que se vivían en su hogar en aquel entonces.
Debido al alto deseo que tiene de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, utilizará el préstamo para poder pintarrajear las paredes de su casa y cambiar las cerraduras. Soledad está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva por su generosidad, ya que esto le dará mayor seguridad y comodidad a su familia. Más adelante espera terminar de construir toda su casa para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
