Soledad is a hard-working mother with a family that stays close at all times, through thick and thin.  She works as a market assistant in her native city, Sayan.  

Her children are her motivation in life and her dream is to give them an education and a better life than what she had when she was young due to the poor economic situation she grew up in at home.

Because of a great desire to improve her family's quality of life, Soledad will use the loan to paint the walls of her house and change the locks.  She is grateful to Kiva lenders for their generosity as it will make her family safer and more comfortable.  In the future she hopes to finish building her house for the well-being of her family.

loans.use: To paint the walls of her house and change the locks.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. It is located close to Uganda, and Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano which straddles the two nations and even has a peak at the Kenya-Uganda border. Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway. The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests, and maintenance of tree cover by the area’s residents has helped both preserve the region’s soil and ensured that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage.

John is married and has eight children. He is the Chairperson of a horticultural organization and he runs his own business. He also does farming with his wife. They have been farming for thirty-five years now and they are currently growing maize, beans, vegetables and trees. They also keep livestock and rear fish as well. John is excited about beekeeping as it will earn him some income from the sale of honey and the bees will help in pollinating their crops.

This is John’s first loan with Honey Care and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to educate his children, invest in his farm and improve his living standards. John’s hope for the future is to live a better life.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman with three kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Josephine operates a grocery and vegetable-selling stall; she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a motorcycle transport business in the future. 



With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El comité “Mujeres Trabajadoras” son 18 señoras, cada una de ellas se están esmerando en poder mejorar sus vidas por medio del trabajo en equipo y unido, sumado a las capacitaciones que les da la fundación paraguaya.
Doria es una persona muy trabajadora, que se dedica a muchas labores, en busca de un mejor porvenir de su familia, ella hace manicura, pedicuro y también se dedica a las ventas variadas, ella es una mujer muy dedicada a su familia y a sus seres queridos. Pide este préstamo para la compra de esmaltes, acetonas, alicates y demás y de esa forma poder seguir con su trabajando, dando un buen servicio a sus clientes.
Todas las integrantes están muy motivadas y quieren progresar para mejorar sus vidas y sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Mujeres Trabajadoras" consists of 18 women who work hard to improve their lives through their team work and solidarity.  They also receive training from the Fundación Paraguaya.

Doria is a hard-working person who has many jobs in order to provide for her family.  She does manicures and pedicures and also sells a variety of goods.  She is very dedicated to her family and loved ones.  The loan she is requesting is to buy nail polish, acetone, clippers and other items so she can continue working and giving her customers good service.

All of the members of the group are very motivated and want to prosper in their lives by making more income.

loans.use: To buy nail polish, acetone, clippers and other items.

loans.name: Fokaben Group

texts.fr:
Fokaben est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Hamdallaye de la ville de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien et qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 34 ans et ont au moins 4 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que, des oignons, Habillement, Produits Cosmétiques  et divers. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur douzième prêt de groupe.
Djeneba est un membre du groupe Fokaben, assise au bout et à gauche, vendeuse d’oignons. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter de sacs d’oignons en quantité et en qualités au fur et à mesure qu’elle vend en détail  à une clientèle diverse. Elle se procure au grand marché. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Fokaben comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 135000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Djeneba compte réaliser  155 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
Fokaben is a group of women from the Hamdallaye district of Koutiala City. They know one another well and live in large traditional families with their husbands, children, and other relatives. They average 34 years of age and have at least four children. This group of women does commerce in a variety of goods, such as onions, clothing, cosmetic products, and more. 

To expand their businesses, the group members had decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. They are on their 12th group loan. 

Djeneba, a member of the group Fokaben, is sitting at the end on the left in the photo. She is a vendor of onions. She intends to use her loan to purchase sacks of of onions in quantity over time for sale retail to a diverse customer base. She procures her supplies at the big market. 

While the other members of the group Fokaben plan on making an average profit of 135,000 francs CFA each over the course of the cycle, Ms. Djeneba plans on making 155,000 francs. 

In addition to paying back the loans, the group members use part of the revenues to cope with personal expenses and to increase their business capital. They would like to see bolstered this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso, so that their inventory levels do not drop too low.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of onions

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Benkadi est un regroupement de femmes du 1erquartier de la ville de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien et qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 40 anset ont au moins 3 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que, condiments, fruits et légumes, Boiset divers. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur quinzième prêt de groupe.
Sanata est un membre du groupe Benkadi, arrêtée au bout et à gauche, vendeuse de condiments (poivron, piments, choux, aubergines) et des fruits (goyave, mangues, avocat). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter ces condiments et fruits en quantité et en qualités au fur et à mesure qu’elle vend en détail  à une clientèle diverse. Elle se procure au grand marché. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Benkadi comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 145000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Sanata compte réaliser  170 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
Benkadi is a group of women from the first district of Koutiala City. They know one another well and live in large traditional families with their husbands, children, and other relatives. They average 40 years of age and have at least three children. This group of women does commerce in a variety of goods, such as condiments, fruit & vegetables, firewood, and more. 

To expand their businesses, the group members had decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. They are on their 11th group loan. 

Sanata, a member of the group Benkadi, is standing at the end on the left in the photo. She is a vendor of condiments (black pepper, chili pepper, cabbage, eggplant). She intends to use her loan to purchase these condiments and fruit in quantity over time for sale retail to a diverse customer base. She procures her supplies at the big market. 

While the other members of the group Benkadi plan on making an average profit of 145,000 francs CFA each over the course of the cycle, Ms. Sanata plans on making 170,000 francs. 

In addition to paying back the loans, the group members use part of the revenues to cope with personal expenses and to increase their business capital. They would like to see bolstered this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso, so that their inventory levels do not drop too low.

loans.use: to purchase condiments and fruit

loans.name: Los Rosales Group

texts.es:
Los Rosales es un grupo ubicado en una zona productora de caña donde la mayoria de los habitantes de la localidad se dedica a trabajar en el campo. También se siembran maíz y frijol aunque estos productos son de autoconsumo. En la misma localidad hay un señor muy conocido que se dedica a la cría y venta de mojarra cuyas ganancias son más significativas durante semana santa.

El nombre del grupo surgió por el gusto que los integrantes tienen por las rosas, ellos son: 

Lidia-Venta De Pollo
Margarita- Venta de Bordados
Luis Enrique-Venta De  Refrescos 
Carlos- Venta De Caña
Lourdes-Venta De Ropa
Fortino- Venta De Caña

Doña Margarita tiene  72 años de edad y esta casada con el señor Esteban quien es campesino,doña Margarita se ha dedicado desde hace ya 3 años a bordar y vender servilletas. Algunas de sus clientas compran las servilletas para envolver las tortillas y otras mas para tapar la canasta (con almuerzos) que mandan al campo a su familia. Margarita comenta que antes se dedicaba a vender tortillas hechas a mano pero por complicaciones de salud en las manos, el negocio lo heredó a su hija. Doña Margarita también tiene una segunda actividad: vende bisutería (costume jewelry) y con las ganancias de sus negocios y algunas aportaciones de sus hijos quienes ya son mayores de edad apoya a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. 

Margarita comparte que es abuelita de 9 niños, su gran familia y las risas de sus nietos la llenan de alegría y la motivan para seguir adelante.

En esta ocasión invertirá su préstamo en hilos, agujas, bastidores, servilletas, pulseras y anillos para continuar con ambas actividades.

“Agradezco a VisionFund la oportunidad para invertir en nuestra actividad” expresó Margarita.

*En la imagen: Doña Margarita viste de blusa verde.
texts.en:
Los Rosales is a group that lives in the sugar growing region of their country where the majority of the inhabitants work in the fields. They also grow corn and beans here even though it is not for resale. In the same area, there is a man who is known for raising and selling fish, which is important during Holy Week.

Doña Margarita is a member of this group and she is 72 years old and she is married to Mr. Esteban who is a field worker. Margarita has worked embroidering and selling napkins for the past 3 years. Some of her customers buy her napkins to hold tortillas and others to cover baskets (that they carry their lunch in) that field workers take with them to work. Margarita says that she had wanted to continue sell hand made tortillas, but complications arose because of the condition her hands and so she gave the business to her daughter. Margarita also makes money by designing and making jewelry and with her earnings, and some help from her children, she is able to help her husband with household costs.

Margarita is a grandmother of 9 grandchildren. Her family is large and the laughter of her grandchildren fills her with joy and inspires her to continue working. The loan she is asking for will be used to purchase more thread, needles, looms, napkins, bracelets and rings so she can continue with her multiple income generating activities.

"I am thankful to VisionFund for the opportunity to invest in our activity" says Margarita.

In the photo, Margarita is in the green blouse.

loans.use: purchase thread, needles, napkins, bracelets and rings.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal KANCHARISUN, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Dominga tiene 52 años de edad es soltera y tiene 03 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de artesania, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de chompas entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The borrower belongs to the KANCHARISUN communal bank, located in the Cusco district in Cusco department.

Dominga  is 52 years old, single and has three children. She alternates her daily activities with the crafts business. She has been in her business for a considerable time, and it is going well, thanks to the effort she put into it every day.

She is requesting a loan for the purchase of sweaters and other items. The borrower is grateful for the loan granted and promises to make her instalment payments.

loans.use: To buy sweaters and other items.

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Sabougnouma est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Hamdallaye de la commune de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien et qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 40 ans et ont au moins 5enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que, arachides, fruits et légumes et Habillement. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de groupe.
Assetou est un membre du groupe Sabougnouma, assise au bout et à droite, vendeuse d’arachide. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des sacs d’arachides en quantité et en qualités au fur et à mesure qu’elle vend en détail  à une clientèle diverse. Elle se procure à Koutiala. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Sabougnouma comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 175000CFA  chacune au cours de ce cycle Mme Assetou compte réaliser  190 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
Sabougnouma is a group of women from the Hamdallaye district, in Commune de Koutiala. They know one another well and live in large traditional families with their husbands, children, and other relatives. They average 40 years of age and have at least five children. This group of women does commerce in a variety of goods, such as peanuts, fruit & vegetables, and clothing. 

To expand their businesses, the group members had decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. They are on their third group loan. 

Assetou, a member of the group Sabougnouma, is sitting at the end on the right in the photo. She is a vendor of peanuts. She intends to use her loand to purchase sacks of peanuts in quantity over time for sale retail to a diverse customer base. She procures her supplies in Koutiala. 

While the other members of the group Sabougnouma plan on making an average profit of 175,000 francs CFA each over the course of the cycle, Ms. Assetou plans on making 190,000 francs. 

In addition to paying back the loans, the group members use part of the revenues to cope with personal expenses and to increase their business capital. They would like to see bolstered this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso, so that their inventory levels do not drop too low.

loans.use: to purchase peanuts

loans.name: Soutoura Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe SOUTOURA ont en moyenne 28ans, 2enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à KIMPARANA/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des boissons, du lait et des produits divers.
Les femmes du groupe SOUTOURA sont à leur 1er  prêt solidaire. AMINATA,1èrefemmeassisedela droite vers la gauche sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter20Kgs de sucre, 5Kgs de lait en poudre, 1 carton de savon, 10Litres d’huile et 5 paquet de bonbon. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes.Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de15000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the group called Soutoura have an average age of 28 and on average two children each. They live in traditional extended families in Kimparana/Segou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). These women met because of being relatives, and they buy and sell drinks, milk, and various products. 

The women of the group called Soutoura are on their first solidarity loan. Aminata, the first woman seated from right to left in the photo, intends to use her loan to buy 20 kilos of sugar, 5 kilos of powdered milk, 1 case of soap, 10 liters of oil, and 5 packs of sweets. 

She buys her supplies right there from wholesalers. She makes her sales to a clientele composed of men and women, for cash and often for credit. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 15,000 F CFA which will be used for health, food and clothing expenses and for school fees. Any remainder will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy various products for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a set of furniture for her house.

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Djekafo est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Souroukoukin de la commune de Koury qui se connaissent bien et qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 42 ans et ont au moins 6enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que, poissons fumés, atiéké, arachides et condiments. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur huitième prêt de groupe.
Fatoumataest un membre du groupe Djekafo, arrêtée au bout et à droite, vendeuse de Poissons Fumés. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter dse Poissons Fumés en quantité et en qualités au fur et à mesure qu’elle vend en détail  à une clientèle diverse. Elle se procure à Koury. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Djekafo comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 155000CFA  chacune au cours de ce cycle Mme Fatoumata compte réaliser  175 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
Djekafo is a group of women from the Souroukoukin district, in Commune de Koury. They know one another well and live in large traditional families with their husbands, children, and other relatives. They average 42 years of age and have at least six children. This group of women does commerce in a variety of goods, such as smoked fish, atiéké, peanuts, and condiments. 

To expand their businesses, the group members had decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. They are on their 8th group loan. 

Fatoumataest, a member of the group Djekafo, is standing at the end on the right in the photo. She is a vendor of smoked fish. She intends to use her loan to purchase smoked fish in quantity over time for sale retail to a diverse customer base. She procures her supplies in Koury. 

While the other members of the group Djekafo plan on making an average profit of 155,000 francs CFA each over the course of the cycle, Ms. Fatoumataest plans on making 175,000 francs. 

In addition to paying back the loans, the group members use part of the revenues to cope with personal expenses and to increase their business capital. They would like to see bolstered this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso, so that their inventory levels do not drop too low.

loans.use: to purchase smoked fish

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Danaya est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Medina Coura de la ville de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien et qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 34  ont au moins 3enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que, de pièces de pagnes, fruit et légumes, récipients en plastiques  et divers. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur septième prêt de groupe.
Tata est un membre du groupe Danaya, arrêtée au bout et à gauche, vendeuse de pièces de pagnes. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter de pièces de pagnes de différentes qualités au fur et à mesure qu’elle vend en détail  à une clientèle diverse. Elle se procure au grand marché. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Danaya comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 145000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Tata compte réaliser  160 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
Danaya is a group of women from the district called Medina Coura in the town of Koutiala who know each other well and who live in big traditional families with their husbands, children, and other relatives. They are on average 34 years old and have at least three children each. 

This group of women sell various items such as lengths of 'pagne', fruit and vegetables, plastic receptacles, etc. In order to grow their activities, the members decided to join the credit program of Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their seventh group loan. 

Tata is the member of this Danaya group, standing on the left, who sells lengths of African print cloth (pagnes). She intends to use her loan to buy lengths of cloth of various qualities to replace her inventory as she sells cloth little by little to a diverse clientele. She buys her goods in the big open-air market. 

Whereas the other members of this Danaya group each expect to make an average profit of 145,000 CFA during this loan cycle, Mme Tate expects to make 160,000 F CFA. Besides reimbursing the loan, she will use a part of the income to cover personal expenses and to grow her working capital. 

The women hope to strengthen their partnership with Soro Yiriwaso so that they do not run short of stock.

loans.use: to buy lengths of pagne (brightly colored African print cloth)

loans.name: Nigina

texts.ru: Нигина 37-летняя жительница столицы - города Душанбе. Она живет там с мужем, четырьмя детьми и свекровью. Муж рабочий, а дети школьники. Нигина тоже работает, она занимается швейной деятельностью. Вот уже 5 лет как она берет заказ на пошив женских национальных платьев. Нигина ценит свой бизнес и в настоящий момент хочет расширить его. За счет суммы кредита Нигина хотела бы обновить свою старую машинку, купив новую модернизированную швейную машинку. Таким образом ее работа будет выполняться качественнее и быстрее, и к тому же доход от деятельности тоже увеличится. Поэтому Нигина ждет финансовой поддержки для достижения большего успеха в своей деятельности.
texts.en: Nigina is a 37-year-old resident of the capital city of Dushanbe, where she lives with her husband, four children and mother-in-law. Her husband is a worker and her children are in school. Nigina earns a living sewing. For five years now she has been taking orders for women's dresses in the national style. She highly values her business and wants to expand it. With the loan amount she would like to replace her old sewing machine by buying a new, modern one. This will make her work faster and of better quality and increase her business revenue. Nigina looks forward to financial support to help her make her business more successful.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine to expand her sewing business

loans.name: Mary Luz

texts.es:
Desde que fue pequeña la señora Mary siempre ha sido muy emprendedora y hoy a sus 38 años sigue fiel a su estilo de buscar sus propios ingresos y ser su propia Jefe, trabaja como vendedora de mercancía y gracias a estos puede llevar un alimento a su hogar, a sus padres y poder pagar las diferentes cuentas que aquejan a una persona común. 
En Antioquia el día de amor y amistad más comúnmente conocido como San Valentín se celebra por la época de Septiembre y se está preparando para tener productos para sus clientes, comprara chocolates, lociones, ramos de flores ropa etc. facilitar a sus clientes un detalle para sus seres amados.
Su sueño es seguir progresando y formar una familia e hijos que llenen ese espacio que hace falta en su vida.
texts.en:
Ever since she was little, Mary has been very entrepreneurial.  Now, at 38 years of age, she continues to be loyal to her style of looking for her own income and being her own boss.  She works selling merchandise.  Thanks to her sales, she is able to bring food to her household and to her parents.  She is able to pay to the worrisome bills that the everyday person encounters.

The day of love and friendship in Antioquia, which is commonly known as St. Valentine’s, is celebrated in September.  She is getting ready to have products for her customers.  She will buy chocolates, lotions, flower bouquets, and clothes, etc.  She will supply her customers with something for their loved ones.

Her dream is to continue progressing and to have a family and children who will fill this empty space in her life.

loans.use: to buy chocolates, lotions, flower bouquets, and clothes, etc.

loans.name: Mariana

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Maputo tem 66 anos de idade é viúva mãe de 3 filhos maiores de idade, responsabiliza-se pelo seu único neto que vive em sua casa.
É reformada na saúde e é proprietária de um estabelecimento comercial onde ganha um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa, pois com valor solicitado pretende fazer um muro de vedação da sua casa adquirindo material de construção como areia, pedra, cimento e varões. Este é o seu 3º empréstimo na hluvuku.
Futuramente pretende  aumentar o volume do seu negócio adquirindo produtos da 1ª necessidade e garantir o ensino do seu neto até ao nível superior.
texts.en:
Mariana was born in Maputo, is 66 years old and a widow. She is the mother of 3 children who are all of age and is responsible for her only grandson who lives in her house.

She is retired and owns a commercial establishment - she uses the money she makes from this for her household expenditure. She plans to build a wall around her house with the requested loan amount and will buy construction materials like sand, stone, cement and rods. This is her 3rd loan with Hluvuku.

In future she plans to increase the volume of her business by buying essential products to sell on and to guarantee her grandson's education to college level.

loans.use: buy construction materials like sand, stone, cement and rods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy firewood for resale.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a businesswoman from Ozamiz. She is 58 years old, widowed and has expertise in selling. She runs a little sari-sari store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family.

Monica is a full fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without any record of default. Now, she has applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. 

Monica continues to look for better business opportunities; proof that she has the passion and energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items.

loans.name: Guljahon

texts.ru: Гулжахон жизнерадостная позитивная женщина в возрасте 44 лет. Она живет в районе Шахритус. У нее пятеро детей. Муж Гулжахон работает таксистом. Сама Гулжахон занимается разведением крупнорогатых скотин. Уже 4 года как она занимается бизнесом по откорму и продаже скотов. Ей помогают муж и дети. Гулжахон хочет увеличить поголовье скотов. Для этой цели она берет кредит. Гулжахон собирается таким образом увеличить доходность бизнеса и улучшить жизненные условия семьи.
texts.en: Guljahon is a cheerful and positive woman of 44 who lives in the Shahrituz region. She has five children and her husband works as a taxi driver. Guljahon works in animal husbandry. She has been fattening and selling cattle for four years. She is looking for a loan so she can increase her head count of livestock in order to increase her business revenue and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es: Orlando de 39 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposa y su hijo de 12 años de edad. Él es un hombre que todos los días pone todo lo que está en sus manos para sacar adelante a su hijo con el apoyo de su esposa y su trabajo en el cual presta sus servicios de seguridad. Orlando es un hombre con deseos de superación, es por ello que solicito un crédito a FUSAI con el cual encemento el piso de toda su vivienda quedando satisfecho con los resultados, por lo que ahora solicita un nuevo crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo, polines, lamina, pines y hierro para construir un cuarto en su propiedad.
texts.en:
Orlando is 39 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and 12 year old son. Each day he does everything in his power to raise his child well and provide opportunities for him, with the support of his wife and his job in security services. Orlando is a man with a desire to excel and succeed, which is why we he is requesting a loan through FUSAI. 

He used his previous loan to install a cement floor in his home, and was satisfied with the results. He is currently requesting a new loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, gravel, brick, poles, sheets, pins and iron, to build a room in his property.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, gravel, brick, poles, sheets, pins and iron, to build a room in his property.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
orge es de la ciudad de Ybycuí, es una persona que se está esforzando por ser un profesional exitoso, está estudiando la carrera de especialista en gestión educativa.
Su familia es su principal sostén, que lo ayuda y que siempre han estado con el. Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la cuota de su carrera, de manera a poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en: Jorge is from the city of Ybycuí, and is trying very hard to have a successful professional career. He is studying to be an educational management specialist. His family is his main support system; they help him and have always been there for him. Jorge is requesting this loan to invest in his tuition costs, so to be able to continue his studies.

loans.use: to pay university tuition.

loans.name: Erlina

texts.en:
Erlina is a 55-year-old married woman with five children. She has one child who is still in school.

Erlina is a very hard working entrepreneur. She has a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for five years. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

In the future, Erlina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Flora has been in this business for 4 years. Flora also earns income from electronic mobile load retailing.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Flora has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Fayzimo

texts.ru:
Файзимо живет в маленьком провинциальном городке Нурек. Он расположен в 70 километрах к юго-востоку от 
столицы.
48-летняя Файзимо разведена с мужем и воспитывает детей одна. У нее четверо детей. Дочери 20 лет, а сыновьям по 18, 16 и 15 лет. Дочь студентка, старший сын работает в магазине, а остальные сыновья еще учатся в школе. Сама Файзимо является швеей. Она предоставляет свои услуги по пошиву женских платьев на протяжении 15 лет. Файзимо в данный момент остро нуждается в заемных средствах. Дело в том, что она еще не оплатила за 4-летнее обучение дочери в ВУЗе. Ее дочь Фариза учится в Таджикском Техническом Университете по специальности "Экономика и организация производства". Если они в этом году не вносят оплату за учебу, ее дочь исключат из ВУЗа. Файзимо в надежде получить помщь обратилась за кредитом. Ей нужны 2600 долларов США. Из этой суммы 2300 долларов пойдут на оплату 4-летнего обучения, а остальные 300 долларов для учебных принадлежностей. Файзимо важен этот кредит.
texts.en:
Fayzimo lives in the small provincial town of Nurek, roughly 70 kilometers to the southeast of the capital of Tajikistan.  She is 48, divorced, and is raising her children on her own.  She has four children: a 20-year-old daughter, and three sons ages 18, 16 and 15.  Her daughter is a student, her oldest son works in a store, and the other two sons are still in grade school.  Fayzimo herself works as a seamstress, and has done so for the past 15 years.  

At the moment, Fayzimo is in great need of a loan as she has yet to pay for her daughter's 4-year college studies.  Her daughter, Fariza, is studying at the Tajik Technical University as an economics major.  If her tuition isn't paid this year, her daughter will have to drop out.  As such, Fayzimo is seeking a loan of $2600 USD to help pay for her daughter's education.  This loan is crucial to Fayzimo; $2300 will go towards paying her daughter's tuition, while the remaining $300 will be used to buy school supplies.

loans.use: pay tuition and buy school supplies for her daughter's 4-year undergraduate studies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, brick, iron and labor costs to build a retaining wall for his home.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. 

Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia as one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflowers, sugarcane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region.

Sofia is married and has eight children. Both she and her husband are farmers. They have been farming for 40 years now and they are currently growing maize, beans, vegetables, bananas, and avocadoes and they also keep poultry. Sofia is excited about beekeeping since the bees will help in pollinating their crops.

This is Sofia's first loan with Honey Care Africa and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to invest in her farm. Sofia's hope for the future is to live a better life.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. It is located close to Uganda and Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano which straddles the two nations and even has a peak at the Kenya-Uganda border. Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway. The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests, and maintenance of tree cover by the area’s residents has helped both preserve the region’s soil and ensured that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage.

Violet is married and has ten children. Both she and her husband are farmers. They have been farming for twenty-nine years now and they are currently growing maize, beans, potatoes, groundnuts and bananas. They also keep livestock. Violet is also an Elder in her local Church. She is excited about beekeeping as it will earn her some income from the sale of honey.

This is Violet’s first loan with Honey Care and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to educate her children. Violet’s hope for the future is to live a better life.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. It is located close to Uganda and Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano which straddles the two nations and even has a peak at the Kenya-Uganda border. Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway. The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests, and maintenance of tree cover by the area’s residents has helped both preserve the region’s soil and ensured that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage.

Lydia is single with one child. She runs a milling business and she is also a farmer. She has been farming for twenty years now and she is currently growing maize, beans, bananas, avocados and trees, and she also keeps livestock. Lydia is excited about beekeeping as it will earn her some income from the sale of honey.

This is Lydia's first loan with Honey Care and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to provide for her family. Lydia's hope for the future is to live a better life.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en:
Roseline is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. 

Roseline has operated a water vending business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her dream is to have big water storage in the near future.

 With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase a water tank for storing water for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank for storing water for resale

loans.name: Qurbongul

texts.ru:
Курбонгул занимается фермерством. У нее имеется орошаемый участок земли, на котором она выращивает сельскохозяйственные культуры. Курбонгул занимается растениеводством более 5 лет. Ей помогает ее семья.
Курбонгул замужем и имеет двух детей в возрасте 20 и 17 лет. Самой Курбонгул 43 года. Она живет со своей семьей в районе Шахритус. Сейчас она проводит озимые посевы и для этого нуждается в кредите. Курбонгул на сумму кредита хочет купить качественные семена. Она ожидает поддержки, без которого не может продолжить свою деятельность.
texts.en:
Qurbongul is married and has two children aged 20 and 17. She herself is 43. She lives with her family in the Shahrituz region. She is a farmer and has a plot of irrigated land where she grows crops, a business she has had for more than five years and which her family helps her with.

Qurbongul wants to plant winter crops and needs a loan to buy high-quality seeds so she can do this. She awaits your support, without which she will not be able to continue her business.

loans.use: to buy seeds to plant winter crops

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en:
Timothy lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflowers, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region.

Timothy is married and has two children. He runs a motor bike transport business. He also does farming with his wife. They have been farming for ten years now and they are currently growing maize and horticultural crops and they also keep livestock. Timothy is excited about beekeeping as the bees will help in pollinating their crops.

This is Timothy's first loan with Honey Care and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to invest in his farm and educate his children. Timothy's hope for the future is to have his children educated and to start a business.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Jocelyn is 41 years old and has three children who are in school.

Jocelyn has a bread vending business in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more bread to sell to her customers.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more bread to sell to her customers

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. It is close to Uganda and to Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano which straddles the two nations and even has a peak at the Kenya-Uganda border. Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway. The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests, and maintenance of tree cover by the area’s residents has helped to preserve the region’s soil and to ensure that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage.

Margaret is married and has three children. She is a teacher. She also does farming, with her husband. They have been farming for six years, and currently they are growing maize, beans, bananas, and avocados. Margaret is excited about beekeeping, as it is a project that is not labor-intensive and it will earn her some income, from the sale of honey.

This is Margaret's first loan with Honey Care. She plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to invest in business, so that she can be able to educate her children. Margaret's hope for the future is to live a better life.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials, and start honey production.

loans.name: Petronila

texts.en:
Petronila is a married woman. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Petronila operates a stall selling grocery vegetables. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbours. One challenge she faces is that the cost of transportation to her place of business is very high. 

Petronila decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the KES 30,000, she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya, and at over 6,300 feet above sea level, it is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize-producing regions, earning it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya.” Many farmers in the region have started projects planting bluegum trees on their land, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. The people around Kitale have been beekeeping for centuries, and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.

Leah is married and has five children. She runs her own business. She also does farming, with her husband. They have been farming for twenty years, and currently they are growing maize, beans, fruit trees, and tea, and they also keep livestock. Leah is excited about beekeeping, as the bees will help by pollinating their crops.

This is Leah's first loan with Honey Care. She plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to build a permanent house. Leah's hope for the future is to live a better life.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials, and start honey production.

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. In the early 20th century the area was dominated by English settlers, but the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflowers, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest, solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region.

Monicah is married and has six children. Both she and her husband are farmers. They have been farming for twenty-nine years, and currently they are growing maize, beans and vegetables, and they also keep livestock. Monicah is excited about beekeeping, as the bees will help by pollinating their crops.

This is Monicah's first loan with Honey Care. She plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to invest in her farm. Monicah's hope for the future is to live a better life.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials, and start honey production.

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya, and at over 6,300 feet above sea level, it is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize-producing regions, earning it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya.” Many farmers in the region have started projects planting bluegum trees on their land, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. The people around Kitale have been beekeeping for centuries, and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.

Serah is single and has two children. She is a farmer. She has been farming for eleven years, and currently she is growing maize, beans, vegetables, avocados, and oranges. Serah is excited about beekeeping, as the bees will help by pollinating her crops.

This is Serah's first loan with Honey Care. She plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to invest in commercial farming. Serah's hope for the future is to live a better life.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials, and begin honey production.

loans.name: Estanislaa

texts.en:
Estanislaa is an old client of Fudacion Paraguaya. She is the owner of a store that she opened after sacrificing a lot. This business helps her to cover her family's needs. She states that the previous loan was used to buy supplies, and that helped her a lot.

Today she is requesting a new loan to invest it in the purchase of vegetables, fruits, condiments, drinks, and so on, so that she can keep selling as she's been doing it.

She is thankful for this opportunity because it will help her a lot.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruits, condiments, drinks, and so on.

loans.name: Mwero

texts.en:
Mwero is married, and she has one child, who attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a motorcycle transport business from door to door. In addition, she operates a poultry farming business, by which she earns another stream of income. She sells to restaurant operators and neighbours. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the KES 40,000 loan, she wants to add on her savings, and purchase another motorcycle. She decided to join Yehu to access loans, to boost her businesses and improve her living standard.

loans.use: to purchase another motorcycle.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 46 years old. She is married and together with her spouse, they have been blessed with five children aged between 22 and 12 years.

Jane runs a photography studio, a business she has been in for the last 15 years, earning a monthly income of 60,000 KES. Jane has requested her 5th loan with VisionFund Kenya. She is asking for 100,000 KES which she will use to buy an extra camera in order to improve her business. Jane has a history of successfully repaying her loans.

With the anticipated profits from the business, Jane will be able to expand her business further.

Her hopes and dreams for the future include advancing further by opening other Photography studios nearby.

loans.use: to add another camera in order to improve her business.

loans.name: Loise

texts.en:
Loise lives in Kitale, which is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. At over 6,300 feet above sea level, it is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize-producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya.”

The people around Kitale have been beekeepers for centuries, and the area is dense with strong bee colonies. Many farmers in the region have started projects planting blue gum trees on their land, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. 

Loise is single with two children. She runs a retail business and a boutique. She also does farming. She has been farming for nine years now, and she is currently growing maize and horticultural crops. Loise is excited about beekeeping as it will earn her some income from the sale of honey and the bees will help in pollinating her crops.

This is Loise's first loan with Honey Care, and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to invest in her farm. Loise's hope for the future is to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Sector Norte Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SECTOR NORTE” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Achacachi, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Emily es la Seretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de mantas, venta de comida, tejido de busos, tejido de fajas, venta de humintas, servicio de construcción.
 
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Emily es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de mantas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su amiga quien le enseño la técnica del tejido, es por ella que al conseguir un capital pequeño decide tener su propio taller.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará el aumento del capital (compra lana por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito y el área de salud que ofrece la institución
texts.en:
The "SECTOR NORTE" communal bank will begin its fourth loan cycle with Pro Mujer, through the Achacachi regional hub. The group consists of eight members and is led by a board of directors with Emily serving as its secretary.

The members run various businesses such as weaving blankets, selling food, weaving sweatshirts, weaving belts, selling "humintas" (baked corn tamales), and providing construction services.

The loan that the group will take out will benefit micro-entrepreneurs, including Emily. She says that she joined Pro Mujer a year ago and that she became a member at the invitation of an outreach officer from the institution who went to visit her at her home. Currently, Emily has a business weaving blankets; she mentions that she learned this trade from a friend who taught her the weaving technique. For this reason, when she managed to get a little capital, she decided to have her own workshop.

The loan that she will take out is to increase her capital by purchasing wool wholesale, which she will acquire from the wholesale vendors from the city of La Paz. Then, after making her product, she will sell it at her retail space. This type of work allows her to generate the means to support her family, as she is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the loans and the health care services offered by the institution.

loans.use: to purchase wool wholesale.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth lives in Kitale, which is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. It is located close to Uganda and Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano that straddles the two nations and even has a peak at the Kenya-Uganda border. Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway.

The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests, and maintenance of tree cover by the area’s residents has both helped preserve the region’s soil and ensured that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage.

Ruth is married and has three children. She is a farming consultant and a Sunday School teacher. Both she and her husband are farmers. They have been farming for fifty years now, and they are currently growing maize and beans. Ruth is excited about beekeeping as the bees will help in pollinating their crops. 

This is Ruth's first loan with Honey Care, and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to build a permanent house. Ruth's hope for the future is to live a better life.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam lives in Kitale, which is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. It is located close to Uganda and Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano that straddles the two nations and even has a peak at the Kenya-Uganda border. Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway.

The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests, and maintenance of tree cover by the area’s residents has both helped preserve the region’s soil and ensured that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage.

Miriam is married and has three children. She runs her own business and she also does farming with her husband. They have been farming for three years now, and they are currently growing maize, beans and bananas, and they also keep livestock. Miriam is excited about beekeeping as the bees will help in pollinating their crops. 

This is Miriam's first loan with Honey Care, and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to invest in her farm. Miriam's hope for the future is to live a better life.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Lita is 46 years old and married, with four children. With four children currently in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Lita runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional stocks to sell in her general store.

Lita has been in this business for 20 years and she sells a variety of items, such as ice cream, soft drinks, canned goods, diapers, and noodles. 

In the future, Lita would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell in her general store.

loans.name: José Gilberto

texts.es:
José de 68 años de edad, estudio hasta 2° grado, desgraciadamente sus padres, no contaban con las facilidades económicas, para ofrecerle esta oportunidad. Esta acompañado, su esposa es ama de casa y tiene 8 hijos quienes, ya están acompañados y tienen sus propios hogares.

José trabaja desde los 8 años, ya que sus padres, fueron agricultores y lo motivaron para que aprendiera esta actividad y fuera una persona de bien. Actualmente, José continúa trabajando en la agricultura y produce 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz, también posee 6 cabezas de ganado, y se ha dedicado al negocio de compra y venta de ganado. En estas actividades su esposa esta siempre pendiente para ayudarle, en el cuidado de los animales cuando él no puede y a la vez ayudarle con la siembra de maíz.

El crédito será utilizado para comprar un ganado de repasto, con el cual José se encarga de cuidarlo, para luego comercializarlo y así obtener ingresos por la venta de estos.

El sueño de toda la vida de José, ha sido ser un agricultor y ganadero en grande, y sabe que solo trabajando fuertemente podrá cumplir este sueño.
texts.en:
Jose is 68 years old and studied until 2nd grade. Unfortunately his parents did not have the economic facilities to offer him this opportunity. He is married, his wife is a home maker and he has 8 children who are already married and have their own homes. 

Jose has worked from the age of 8 since his parents were farmers and they motivated him to learn the business and to be a good person. Jose currently continues working in agriculture and produces 7,000 square meters of corn, also has 6 heads of cattle and has earned a living buying and selling cattle. His wife is always available to help him with this work - caring for the animals when he can not and at the same time helping him to plant corn.

The loan will be used to buy a grazing cow for which Jose will take charge of caring for it to later sell and in this way earn income from the sale of this.

Jose's lifelong dream has been to be a large scale farmer and cattle herder and he knows that only by working hard will he be able to fulfill this dream.

loans.use: to buy a grazing cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase spare parts

loans.name: Jose Abad

texts.es:
Jose es un joven soltero de 23 años, con muchas ganas de salir adelante, trabaja como empleado en una empresa de su ciudad natal, Lima. El buen desempeño en su trabajo es el resultado de todos los valores inculcados en él por sus padres. Cada mañana Jose despierta muy entusiasmado y motivado porque quiere darle lo mejor a su familia y está trabajando también para más adelante poder empezar a estudiar una profesión.
Debido a los grandes deseos de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, José utilizará el crédito para comprar un juego de muebles para su familia. Él está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva por su generosidad, quiere que sepan que con esto su familia estará más cómoda y así seguirá luchando día a día por un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Jose is a 23 year old young, single man. He is eager to get ahead and be successful. He works for a company in his hometown of Lima. His good job performance is the result of all the values ​​instilled in him by his parents. Jose wakes up every morning enthusiastic and motivated because he wants to provide the best for his family. He is also working so that he can eventually study for a career. 

Because of his strong desire to improve his family's quality of life, Jose will use the loan to buy a set of furniture for his family. He is very grateful to the Kiva lenders for their generosity, and wants you to know that this loan will make his family more comfortable, and so he will continue to fight every day for a better future.

loans.use: to buy a furniture set for his family's well-being.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to repair her chicken shed and buy chickens for laying.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lucia is 45 years old and has four children who are currently in school.

Lucia has a food vending business in the Philippines. Lucia requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Lucia has been in this business for 7 years. In the future, Lucia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Titus

texts.en:
Hello Kiva lenders! Meet Titus, who has been religiously farming on his half-acre piece of land for the past 3 years. He is happily married, and he and his “heart beat” (his wife) are blessed with 4 lovely children. Titus' upbringing was very challenging, and he never got all the basic needs that he desired, but he promised himself that he would work extra hard to improve his living conditions and also improve the living conditions for his parents.

Titus' primary source of income is crop and dairy farming, and through these occupations he has been able to earn an honest income. Titus passionately loves dairy farming and has even nicknamed one of his cows "Lelmelet."

Titus has a large space of land on his farm, so he wants to increase the number of his dairy cows. However, because he is a small-scale farmer, one challenge he faces is accessing funds. Knowing that organizations such as Kiva support small-scale farmers, Titus feels relieved and knows that his dream of improving his living conditions will be realized.

Titus plans to accumulate the profits gathered and open a feed shop and a milk retail shop. Through these enterprises, he will be able to comfortably take care of his family and siblings and assure them of a bright future. Titus believes that through your loan, you will be delivering the promise of transforming lives.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Mukoma

texts.en:
Mukoma is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over two years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the 20,000 KES she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase grocery items, such as beans, peanuts, and millet.

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr: Mme Fatoumata  est âgée de 40 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle vit dans une famille polygame  dans le quartier Sogomougou de la préfecture de Koutiala, région de Sikasso. Mme Fatoumata exerce les activités commerciales basées sur l’achat et vente de légumes, fruits et piments depuis plus de 11 ans. Cette activité lui procure assez de revenu, sa notoriété est bonne car elle reçoit beaucoup de clients par jour. Pour la bonne satisfaction de sa clientèle et l’agrandissement de son activité, Mme a fait recours à l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso, elle est à son septième cycle de prêt. Ce prêt sera utilisé pour l’achat de piments. Elle s’approvisionne à Koutiala et dans les villages,effectue sa vente au grand marché à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes au comptant. Avec l’agrandissement de son activité, Mme compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qu’elle utilisera pour le remboursement des taux d’intérêt de Soro, satisfaire ces  besoins personnels et investir le reste dans son activité. Elle compte sur le financement de Soro  pour élargir son activité dans le futur.
texts.en:
Ms. Fatoumata  is 40 years old and a married mother of four. She lives in a polygamous family in the Sogomougou district, in Préfecture de Koutiala, Région de Sikasso. Ms. Fatoumata has been working in commerce buying and selling vegetables, fruit, and chili peppers for eleven years. This business brings in enough revenue for her. Her reputation is good, since she accommodates many customers each day.

To meet the expectations of her customers properly and to expand her business, Ms. Fatoumata turned toward the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and is now on her seventh loan cycle. This loan will be used to purchase chili peppers. She gets her supplies in in Koutiala and from villages. And her sales are made to men and women customers paying cash at the market. 

With the expansion of her business, she plans on making a monthly profit of 100,000 francs CFA that will be used to pay the Soro loan interest, to meet her personal needs, and to invest the rest in her business. She is counting on Soro financing to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase chili peppers

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha is a married woman and has been blessed with three children who attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

Tabitha operates a poultry-selling business, which has been operational for over 4 years. She mentioned a disease outbreak causing losses as a challenge she has faced in the business. Tabitha dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future. 

Tabitha joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feeds for her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feeds for her business.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Danaya  est un regroupement de femmes du 1er quartier de la ville de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien et qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 44 ans et ont au moins 5 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que, Condiments, charbons de bois et habillement. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur dix-huitième prêt de groupe.
Djeneba est un membre du groupe Danaya, arrêtée au bout et à gauche, vendeuse de Condiments. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter de Condiments (piments, poivrons, Maggi, sel, poudre de gombo, poudre de feuilles de baobab, ails, soumbala) en quantité et en qualité au fur et à mesure qu’elle vend en détail  à une clientèle diverse. Elle se procure au marché.   
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Danaya  comptent  réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 155 000CFA  chacune au cours de ce cycle Mme Djeneba compte réaliser  170 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
Danaya is a group of women from the first district of Koutiala City. They know one another well and live in large traditional families with their husbands, children, and other relatives. They average 44 years of age and have at least five children. This group of women does commerce in a variety of goods, such as condiments, charcoal, and clothing. 

To expand their businesses, the group members had decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. They are on their 18th group loan. 

Djeneba, a member of the group Danaya, is standing at the end on the left in the photo. She is a vendor of condiments. She intends to use her loan to purchase condiments, such as chili peppers, bell peppers, Maggi [typically bouillon cubes], salt, powdered okra, powdered baobab leaves, garlic, and soumbala [a flavoring made of pounded and fermented nuts or beans] in quantity over time for retail sale to a diverse customer base. She procures her supplies at the market. 

While the other members of the group Danaya plan on making an average profit of 155,000 francs CFA each over the course of the cycle, Ms. Djeneba plans on making 170,000 francs. 

In addition to paying back the loans, the group members use part of the revenues to cope with personal expenses and to increase their business capital. They would like to see bolstered this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso, so that their inventory levels do not drop too low.

loans.use: to purchase condiments, such as chili peppers, bell peppers, salt, and powdered okra.

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Djiguisseme  est un regroupement de femmes du 1er quartier de la ville de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien et qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 39 ans et ont au moins 5 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que, Charbons de bois, Bois de chauffages, Condiments. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt de groupe.
Ami est un membre du groupe Djiguisseme, assise au bout et à droite, vendeuse de charbons de bois et du bois de chauffe. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter de charbons de bois et du bois de chauffe au fur et à mesure qu’elle vend en détail  à une clientèle diverse. Elle se procure dans la brousse.  
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Djiguisseme   comptent  réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 175000CFA  chacune au cours de ce cycle Mme Ami compte réaliser  180 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
Djiguisseme is a group of women from the first district of Koutiala City. They know one another well and live in large traditional families with their husbands, children, and other relatives. They average 39 years of age and have at least five children. This group of women does commerce in a variety of goods, such as charcoal, firewood, and condiments. 

To expand their businesses, the group members had decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. They are on their fourth group loan. 

Ami, a member of the group Djiguisseme, is sitting at the end on the right in the photo. She is a vendor of charcoal and firewood. She intends to use her loan to purchase some charcoal and firewood over time for retail sale to a diverse customer base. She procures her supplies from the countryside. 

While the other members of the group Djiguisseme plan on making an average profit of 175,000 francs CFA each over the course of the cycle, Ms. Ami plans on making 180,000 francs. 

In addition to paying back the loans, the group members use part of the revenues to cope with personal expenses and to increase their business capital. They would like to see bolstered this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso, so that their inventory levels do not drop too low.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal and firewood

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is married and works hard to support her family. For the past ten years, she has had a frozen foods vending business in the Philippines. Marilyn requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more packs of frozen foods to sell.

In the future, Marilyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more packs of frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Tunaweza B Group

texts.en:
Hadija is married and in her late thirties. She has two sons and four daughters, all of whom are in school. Since 2003, she has been running a food business (mamalishe) where she serves soup, tea with snacks, and lunch food (rice, ugali, banana with meat, beans, vegetables). She starts working from 5am to 6pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

From Kiva partner, Tujijenge Tanzania, this will be her first credit request. The loan will be apportioned among TUNAWEZA B, a ten member group. The group members will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

Hadija will use her portion of credit to buy food ingredients for her mamalishe. Her desire is to improve her life and business.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients for her mamalishe.

loans.name: Sabah

texts.en: Sabah is a married 35-year-old woman with five sons. She has a secondary education. She works with her husband at an electronic goods shop. Her family was affected by the last war at Gaza, and her house was destroyed.  She applied for a loan to build the walls of her house before the winter season.  She plans to purchase cement and rubble for the money received. She hopes to be able provide her sons the best living conditions.  Sabah is very grateful to everyone who helps her.

loans.use: to purchase cement and rubble to rebuild her house walls.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a married woman with four children, three of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that is without electricity and water. Her greatest monthly expense is household consumables.

For the past eight years, she has operated a mat weaving business, selling door-to-door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of expanding and establishing a poultry business in the future.

With the requested loan, she wants to purchase sewing materials for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase sewing materials for her business.

loans.name: Mwakikota

texts.en:
Mwakikota is married with six children. She owns a house that does not have electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children.

For the past two years, she has operated a fruit and vegetables business, selling to neighbors and passersby. Her major challenges are high transportation costs to her place of operation and stiff competition.

With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase sacks of fruits and vegetables for resale . She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Hamisi

texts.en:
Hamisi is married with four children. She owns a house that is without electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. Hamisi sold palm leaves for thatching houses for the past year. She sells to her neighbors and people who come to buy from her.

With the KES 10,000 she wants to purchase palm leaves for resale. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income and establish a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase palm leaves for resale.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
This is 38-year-old Mariama. She is married with three children, ages 5, 6, and 15 years old. In 2008, Mariama established her frozen fish business. She began her business to assist the family and follow in her mother's footsteps. Working 6 days a week and 9 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,000,000 every month. She would like a Le 3,000,000 loan to purchase more cartons of frozen fish for resale. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 1,500,000.

In the future, Mariama plans to continue with the loan until she has sufficient capital. Competition and the rainy season are her big challenges. This business has helped her to raise her children. She is looking forward to funds that will help her in developing her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase frozen fish to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a single, 45-year-old woman with two children, ages thirteen and sixteen years old. She has two additional dependants who live with her, as she is supporting their education.

In 2004, Mary established her clothing business to be self-reliant after the war. She sells shirts, T-shirts, suits, jeans, flasks and shoes. Her business is located at the outskirt of town and her main customers are adults. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, she earns about Le 1,527,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan of Le 5,000,000.
