Mary has already received and successfully repaid four loans and now requires a new loan in order to buy shoes, jeans, and dresses. She hopes that this loan will help her to increase the stock and expand her business. In the future, Mary plans to construct another house. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy clothing to resell.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana está estudiando la carrera de profesorado en educación escolar básica, es una persona que quiere salir adelante, y sabe que la única forma de hacerlo es por medio de sus estudios.
Comenta que con la ayuda de su hermana está cubriendo sus gastos, pero que quiere ayudarla, es por eso que pide este préstamo para poder cubrir las cuotas de su carrera.
Sus aspiraciones son la de ser una profesional que ayude a los demás.
texts.en:
Juana is studying to get her degree in teaching primary education. She is a person who wants to get ahead and knows that the only way to do it is through education.

She says that with the help of her sister, she is covering her expenses, but she wants to help her, and so she asks for this loan to be able to cover the costs of her education.

Her aspirations are to be a professional who helps others.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Larisa

texts.en:
Larisa lives in Miasnikyan village of the Armavire region with her husband and daughter. Her son is a 27-year-old migrant worker, who left his motherland with the hope of finding a well-paid job.

Larisa and her husband run their family farm. They keep livestock (two cows, three calves) and cultivate tomato and watermelon. They both work hard to earn a stable income and to sustain their livelihood.

The requested loan of USD 1,700 is very important for Larisa and her farm. She plans to purchase items (forage, fertilizer) and pay for hired workers to organize the cultivation and harvest. The loan will be a big support for this family's farming business and they hope for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for farm inputs (forage, fertilizer) and labor.

loans.name: Urpis De Confraternidad Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “URPIS DE CONFRATERNIDAD”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Alicia tiene 45 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 04 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de ferreteria,la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a su negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones personales, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia, la socia vende pinturas, clavos entre otros.
 La socia solicita el crédito para comprar mercadería como clavos, brochas entre otros.
La persona que sale con la cara tapada no pertenece al banco comunal.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de venta de regalos, ferretería, tienda de abarrotes y artesanía. 
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “URPIS DE CONFRATERNIDAD” communal bank. This bank is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and Cusco department.

Alicia is 45 years old, is partnered and has 4 children. She spends some of her daily work time in her hardware store business. She spends a lot of time working in her business which brings her personal satisfaction. She wants to be able to continue working, so that in this way she can continue supporting her family.  She sells paint and nails among other things.

She asks for the loan to purchase merchandise such as nails and brushes, among others.

The person with the covered face is not part of the communal bank.

The other members' businesses are in gift sales, hardware store, a grocery store, and traditional crafts.

The member is grateful for the offered loan and promises to make the established payments.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as nails and brushes among others.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Hello world, meet Joan. She is a 24-year-old wife and mother of three who does farming for a living. Joan is based in Kapsowar, Kenya. Kapsowar is one of the continent’s most beautiful spots, with scenic land formations, fertile soil, unevenly distributed population, a sense of community and small farms with cattle and hay, as well as small goat and sheep flocks.

For two years, Joan has kept dairy cattle and poultry for commercial milk and egg production. She is known to be very keen on price changes in the market.

Joan is seeking a loan to purchase a dairy cow. In order to make more income to afford farm input costs, she needs to significantly increase her current output. With your loan, the newly acquired cow is projected to produce more than 10 litres of milk per day. Money made from the sale of this milk will enable the entrepreneur to comfortably clear her debt, pay for her children’s education and save. Joan plans to use this loan to impact her family by improving food security.

loans.use: to pay for a dairy cow.

loans.name: Silas

texts.en:
Silas lives on a hilltop in Kapsowar, Kenya with his wife and their two children. From his small, but immaculately clean, mud house he can see a lush valley full of maize, tomatoes, beans, and vegetables. He can also see a bright future, thanks to the income he earns through practicing mixed farming.

Silas passionately loves dairy farming and has nicknamed one his cows “Birir” (from a person’s name). Because of the immense farming knowledge, he has turned his farmland into an open university. Here, hundreds turn up to get trained in the hope that they will replicate his model in their own farmland.

However the biggest challenge he faces is satisfying the demand for milk in his village. The demand is overwhelming. He is seeking a loan to buy another dairy cow. He believes that through the loan he will be able to improve his living conditions and be able to secure the future of his children. Having gone through training with Juhudi Kilimo he is confident that the skills he acquired will help him increase his business and be able to pay back the loan. Silas is confident that if you invest in his dream you will be impacting the life of his family and children.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water and a tank for the family house.

loans.name: Therese

texts.en:
Therese is aged 56 years old. She is married with two children, 22 and 27. Both of them go to school. She has been selling shoes for 18 years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more shoes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to buy a new house.

loans.use: to buy more shoes for sale.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is 52 years old. She is married with twelve children aged between 8 and 28. Eleven of them go to school. 

She has been selling clothes for ten years. With the loan, she would like to buy more clothes for sale. The profits from the business will be used renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy varnish, sandpaper, paintbrushes, and wood to make furniture.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is a married man with three children, ages two to thirteen years old. He describes himself as ambitious. He operates a retail business where he sells meat, and has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be drought, which affects animal health and quality of meat.

He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of meat. His business goal is to expand the business to other towns within five years. He hopes that in the future he will be self-reliant. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more meat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase agricultural products to support her coffee crops.

loans.name: Jaheda

texts.en:
Jaheda is from the village of South Mouyamari in the Jalpaiguri district. Her family consists of her husband and her three sons. She is a 51-year-old housewife who is an illiterate woman; she can sign her name. Her three sons are day labourers. 

However, the low income is not enough to meet the basic needs of their family. Jaheda and her husband, 54-year-old Mosareph, are involved in farming as well. This is an important source of income for them. They grow vegetables and sell the produce in the local market. Thus, they can somehow manage the household expenses.

As life gets more expensive day by day, Jaheda and her husband want to grow their income. They want to cultivate bottle gourds, which are a popular vegetable to the people of their region. A loan will help them to purchase seeds and fertilizer for bottle gourd cultivation.

Jaheda is seeking a loan to run their agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that they will be able to cover the household expenses. So, Jaheda has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and BJS. She wants to give her best to have a successful and profitable business with which they can upgrade their living standard. She also dreams to construct a concrete house for them.

Jaheda is thankful to her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies for bottle gourd cultivation.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis es una persona muy sacrificada, tiene el deseo de progresar y tener una vida mejor. Está estudiando la carrera de administración rural, ya que el sabe que Paraguay es un país muy rico para la agricultura y le gustaría poder aplicar sus estudios a su propio campo de trabajo.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas, y con ello seguir con su meta de ser un profesional exitoso y útil a la sociedad.
texts.en:
Luis is a very self-sacrificing person. He has the desire to progress and have a better life. He is studying for a rural administration degree, since he knows that Paraguay is a country very rich in agriculture and he would like to apply his education to his own field of work.

He asks for this loan to be able to pay his fees, and with it he will continue with his goal to be a successful professional who is useful to society.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to open a store for repairing and selling used electrical goods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new meat grinder for his father's butcher shop.

loans.name: Abel Bonilla

texts.es:
El señor Abel de 46 años de edad es casado y tiene dos hijos que dependen de él,  vive en una colonia de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 10 años a la venta de helados, su venta la realiza de manera ambulante,  sale desde muy temprano todos los días  en su motocicleta a visitar las escuelas, parques y lugares en donde hay presencia de niños ya que son sus clientes mas leales.
Don Abel está Solicitando el préstamo para la compra de helados de fresa, vainilla, chocolate, conos, vasitos, azúcar, etc. que son los productos que sus clientes prefieren, gracias al préstamo desea continuar trabajando y de esa manera proveer mas ingresos para su familia.
Don Abel su sueño es darles una mejor educación a sus hijos y construir su propia casa ya que vive en casa de un familiar, es su séptimo préstamo que solicita.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Septiembre del 2014.
texts.en:
Abel, 46, is married and has two dependent children. He lives in a neighborhood of San Lorenzo in southern Honduras, and for the past 10 years has worked selling ice cream as a street vendor.  He leaves very early every day on his motorcycle to visit the schools, parks, and places where there are children since they are his most loyal customers.

Abel is asking for a loan to purchase strawberry, vanilla and chocolate ice cream, cones, cups, sugar, etc. which are the products that his customers prefer. Thanks to the loan, he wants to continue working and in this way provide more income for his family. 

Abel's dream is to give his children a better education and build his own house since he lives in a relative's house.  It is his seventh loan that he has requested. 


San Lorenzo, Honduras -  September 2014.

loans.use: to purchase strawberry, vanilla and chocolate ice cream, cones, cups, sugar, etc. for his business.

loans.name: Toribia Alberto

texts.es: Toribia de 66 de años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la venta de tamales de gallina desde hace varios años, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, pero también vende de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias, tiene mucha clientela por los buenos precios, Doña Toribia esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de materia prima como: gallinas, maíz, verduras, consomés, tomates, hojas de huerta, etc. asi como los que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias.
texts.en: Toribia, 66, lives in her own house with her family. She has worked selling chicken tamales for a number of years. Her business is located in her house, but she also sells as a street vendor in the various neighborhoods. She has many customers because of her good prices. Toribia is asking for a loan to purchase raw materials such as chickens, corn, vegetables, broth, tomatoes, banana leaves, etc. similar to those shown in the photo to be able to continue with her work which generates good profit.

loans.use: to purchase chickens, corn, vegetables,  broth, tomatoes, banana leaves, etc.

loans.name: Mwanafatime

texts.en:
Mwanafatime is married. She owns a house that does not have electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and fees for her school-going kids.

For the past three years, she has operated a door to door motorcycle transport business. Her major challenges are the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the 50,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) she wants to purchase another motorcycle for business expansion. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to  purchase another motorcycle

loans.name: Sergio Misael

texts.es: Sergio de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, no tienen hijos todavía, el posee un taller de carpintería en su casa de habitación desde hace 6 años, donde elabora diferentes tipos de muebles, tiene clientela ya establecida por la calidad del producto, Sergio está solicitando un crédito para la compra de  madera, clavos, barniz, pegamento, herramientas, etc. para poder continuar con su trabajo ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos.
texts.en: Sergio, 37, lives in his own house with his life partner. They don't have children yet. He has had a carpentry workshop in his house for the past 6 years, where he makes different types of furniture. He has established customers due to the quality of his product. Sergio is asking for a loan to purchase wood, nails, varnish, adhesive, tool, etc. to be able to continue with his work since it is his only source of income.

loans.use: to purchase wood, nails, varnish, adhesive, tools, etc.

loans.name: Miriam Elizabeth

texts.es: Miriam vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y sus hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y refrescos, adicional a eso también vende panes con pollo, es una mujer muy trabajadora que siempre está buscando la manera de poder salir adelante junto con su familia, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería para continuar con sus ventas ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y asi poder tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Miriam lives in her own house with her life partner and their children. She works selling fruit and soft drinks, and in addition she sells hearty chicken sandwiches (panes con pollo). She is a very hard-working woman who is always looking a way to be able to get ahead with her family. She is asking for a loan to purchase more merchandise to continue with her sales since it is her only source of income and in this way to be able to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fruit and soft drinks in bulk.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana de 43 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos en casa propia, ella se dedica a la venta de especies desde hace 23 años, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado que se encuentra cerca de su casa, tiene mucha clientela por ser un producto muy vendible ya que muchas personas que tiene venta de comida la utilizan mucho, Juana está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas especies como achiote, relajo, ajonjolí, etc.  y así poder continuar con sus ventas que le generan buenos ingresos.
texts.en: Juana, 43 years old, lives with her husband and their two children in their own house. She has worked selling spices for the past 23 years. Her business is located in the market which is near her house. She has many customers because it is a very sellable product since many people who sell food use it a lot. Juana is asking for a loan to purchase more spices such as annatto, relajo seasoning mix, sesame, etc. and in this way be able to continue with her sales which generate a good income.

loans.use: to purchase more spices such as annatto, relajo seasoning mix, sesame, etc.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a male Kiva borrower. He has one child. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. 

He also runs a retail business where he sells bread, salt, sugar, flour, and other items. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a busy area, and his primary customers are locals. 

He will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour, and other items for his retail business. 

His business goal is to expand within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be self-reliant. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour, and other items.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 32 years old. She is married with two children, aged 5 and 11. Both of them go to school. 

She has been selling clothes. With the loan, she would like to buy more clothes for sale. 

The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Mwendwa

texts.en: Mwendwa is married and the mother of four children. She describes herself as ambitious, and operates a retail business where she sells salt, sugar, flour and other items. She has been in this business for the last six years, and operates in a busy area where most of her customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge as the high cost of goods, and has requested a Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stocks of sugar, bread, flour, juices and other items to sell. Her goal is to open a wholesale business within five years. She also hopes that in the future, she will be able to buy land. This is her fourth loan from SMEP Microfinance bank. She has successfully repaid the first three.

loans.use: buy more sugar, bread, flour and other items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Georgette

texts.en:
Georgette is a 56-year-old married mother of six children aged between 24 and 32, and all of them go to school. She has been selling photocopy supplies for nine years. 

With the loan, Georgette would like to buy more such supplies to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more photocopy supplies to sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace lives in Kitale, in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia as one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes it a high-potential beekeeping area.

Grace is married, has two children and works as a teacher. She also does farming with her husband. They have been doing this for fourteen years now and are currently growing maize, beans and avocados. Grace is excited about beekeeping because bees will help pollinate her crops.

This is Grace's first loan with Honey Care and she plans to use the money she earns to buy dairy cows. Grace's hope for the future is to live a comfortable life.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials to use making honey.

loans.name: Elija

texts.en:
Elija lives in Sindo, a small town in Homa Bay County, which is located in south-western Kenya, close to both the Tanzanian border and Lake Victoria, Africa's largest lake. Despite the proximity to the lake, water infrastructure in Homa Bay remains quite undeveloped, and inconsistent rains and occasional droughts make life difficult for farmers. Nonetheless, they have adapted to these challenges, particularly by diversifying their crops to include cassava, sunflower, sorghum, bananas, groundnuts and millet, as well as drought-resistant varieties of papaya and mangoes. Although beekeeping has not traditionally been practiced in the region, many individuals have expressed interest in keeping bees and are knowledgeable about their pollination benefits.

Elija is married and has eighteen children. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have been farming for thirty years and are currently growing maize, beans, avocados, mangoes, citrus fruits and sunflower. Elija is excited about beekeeping as it will earn him some income from the sale of honey.

This is Elija’s first loan with Honey Care and he plans to use the money he earns to pay school fees for his children and to provide for his family’s basic needs. His hope for the future is to expand his beekeeping project.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Danaya  est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Koko de la ville de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien et qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 44 ans et ont au moins 5 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que, Fruits et légumes, Maïs, Produits Cosmétiques, Restauration. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur huitième prêt de groupe.
Awa est un membre du groupe Danaya, arrêtée 2ème de gauche à droite, vendeuse de maïs, fruits et légumes. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter de maïs, fruits et légumes au fur et à mesure qu’elle vend en détail  à une clientèle diverse. Elle se procure au marché.  
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Danaya  comptent  réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 195000CFA  chacune au cours de ce cycle Mme Awa compte réaliser  200 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
Danaya is a group of women from the Koko neighborhood in ​​the city of Koutiala who know each other well and who live in large traditional families along with their husbands, children and other relatives. They are on average 44 years old and have at least 5 children.

This group of women are retail merchants of various products such as fruits and vegetables, maize, cosmetics, and food preparations. To increase the size of their business, the members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program and are on their eighth group loan. 

Awa, a member of the Danaya group, is standing second from left to right, and sells maize, fruit and vegetables. She intends to use her loan to buy maize, fruit and vegetables for quick retail sales to a diversified clientele. She resupplies at the market.

While other members of the Danaya group expect average profits of 195,000 CFA francs each during this cycle, Awa expects to achieve 200,000 CFA francs. In addition to repaying the loans, they use some of the income to meet their personal expenses and increase their working capital. 

They want to strengthen this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso to avoid stock shortages.

loans.use: buy maize, fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Zenaido Alejandro

texts.es:
Zenaido es un joven muy inteligente y con muchos deseos de superación, es soltero y vive en Lurin junto a su familia.
Está estudiando la carrera de Contabilidad y para apoyar a sus padres con el pago de la matrícula y sus pasajes , también trabaj como Asistente Contable en una empresa. ÉL sabe que trabajar y estudiar a veces puede ser un poco cansado, pero es un desafío que está superando con mucho entusiasmo porque quiere brindar un mejor futuro para su familia.
Debido a las ganas que tiene de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, él utilizará el préstamo para pintarrajear las paredes de su casa y comprar una puerta de metal e instalarla ya que la que tiene es de madera. Está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva por su generosidad ya que con esto su familia sentirá mayor comodidad y seguridad. Así Zenaido continuará día a día luchando para más adelante poder terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Zenaido is a very intelligent young man and has a great desire to improve himself. He is single and lives in Lurin with his family.

He is studying accounting and to support his parents with the tuition and fees, he also works as an assistant accountant in a business. He knows that to work and study sometimes makes one a bit tired, but it is a challenge that he is overcoming with a lot of enthusiasm because he wants to offer a better future to his family. 

Due to his desire to improve his family's quality of life, he will use the loan to plaster the walls of his house and purchase a metal door and install it since the one they have now is wooden. He is very grateful to the Kiva lenders for their generosity since, with this, his family will feel more comfortable and safe. So, Zenaido will continue fighting day by day in order to, in the future, finish building his house.

loans.use: to plaster the walls of his house and to buy a new door.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter lives in Kitale, in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia as one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes it a high-potential beekeeping region. 

Peter is married and has three children. He is a photographer who has also done farming with his wife for fifteen years now. They are currently growing maize, vegetables and tea and also raise fish. Peter is excited about beekeeping as it will provide him with honey and the bees will help pollinate his crops.

This is Peter’s first loan with Honey Care and he plans to use the proceeds to invest in his farm. His hope for the future is to invest in his farm projects and live a better life.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy manure, leaf foliates and fertilizers, among others and to treat her coffee plants.

loans.name: Doris Mabel

texts.es: Doris de 59 años de edad desde hace 10 años posee una tienda en su lugar de residencia, tiene clientela establecida que la buscan por los buenos precios y la variedad de productos, ella vive en casa propia con su esposo quien es agricultor y le ayuda económicamente, Doña Doris está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería como: sopas, huevos, detergentes, jabón, refrescos, golosinas, granos básicos, etc. para surtir su tienda y así obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Doris, 59 years old, has for the past 10 years had a store in her home. She has established customers who seek her out for her good prices and the variety of products. She lives in her own house with her husband who is a farmer and helps him economically.  Doris is asking for a loan to purchase more merchandise such as soups, eggs, detergent, soap, soft drinks, candies, basic grains, etc. to stock her store and, in turn, get more income.

loans.use: to purchase soups, eggs, detergent, soap, soft drinks, candies, basic grains, etc.

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer De Mollepata Ii Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “NUEVO AMANECER DE MOLLEPATA II”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Mollepata, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Lourdes, la socia tiene 46 años de edad tiene 04 hijos y es casada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales menores como gallinas, cuyes entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio,  la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de cuyes.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de crianza de ganados, negocio de venta de animales ,artesanía.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “NUEVO AMANECER DE MOLLEPATA II” communal bank. This bank is located in Mollepata district, in Anta province, Cusco department. 

Lourdes is 46 years old and has 4 children, and is married. She spends part of her daily work with her business raising small animals such as chickens and guinea pigs, among others. She has been in this business for a good while and it is going well thanks to the determination that she puts into her business each day. She wants to be able to continue working and in this way continue supporting her family.

She asks for the loan to purchase guinea pigs.

The other members work raising cattle, selling animals, and traditional crafts.

She is grateful to those who are part of this dream through this method and promises to meet her payments on the established schedule.

loans.use: to purchase guinea pigs.

loans.name: Jack

texts.en:
Jack lives in Sindo, a small town in Homa Bay County, which is located in south-western Kenya, close to both the Tanzanian border and Lake Victoria, Africa's largest lake. Despite the proximity to the lake, water infrastructure in Homa Bay remains quite undeveloped, and inconsistent rains and occasional droughts make life difficult for farmers in the area. Nonetheless, they have adapted to these challenges, particularly by diversifying their crops to include cassava, sunflower, sorghum, bananas, groundnuts and millet, as well as drought-resistant varieties of papaya and mangoes. 

Jack is the father of eight children, and both he and his wife have been farming for five years now. They are currently growing maize, beans, cassava and sunflower. 

Although beekeeping has not traditionally been practiced in the region, many individuals have expressed interest in keeping bees and are knowledgeable about their pollination benefits. Jack is excited about beekeeping, as it will provide him with honey for food and medicine.

This is his first loan with Honey Care, and Jack plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to pay school fees for his children and to expand his beekeeping project. His hope for the future is to increase the number of his beehives for more honey production

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, manure, and pay labor costs to help with her coffee crop.

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Djekafo est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Hamdallaye de la ville de  Koutiala qui se connaissent bien et qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 28 ans et ont au moins 2 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que de pièces de pagnes, Savons, Chaussures et Habillements. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de groupe.
Mariam est un membre du groupe Djekafo, assise 2ème de la droite vers la gauche, vendeuse de pièces de pagnes. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheterdes pièces de pagnesen qualités au fur et à mesure qu’elle vend en détail  à une clientèle diverse. Elle se procure au marché. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Djekafo comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 125000CFA  chacune au cours de ce cycle Mme Mariamcompte réaliser  140 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
Djekafo is a group of women from the Hamdallaye neighborhood in ​​the city of Koutiala who know each other well and who live in large traditional families along with their husbands, children and other relatives. They are on average 28 years old and have at least 2 children.

This group of women are retail merchants of various products such as lengths of pagnes (colorful West-African fabric), soap, shoes and clothing. To increase the size of their business, the members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program and are on their second group loan.

Mariam, a member of the Djekafo group, is sitting second from right to left, and sells lengths of pagne fabric. She intends to use her loan to buy pagnes for quick reselling to a diversified clientele. She resupplies at the market.

Whereas other members of the Djekafo group expect average profits of 125,000 CFA francs each during this cycle, Mrs. Mariam expects to achieve 140,000 CFA francs. In addition to repaying the loans, they use some of the income to meet their personal expenses and increase their working capital.

They want to strengthen this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso to avoid stock shortages.

loans.use: buy lengths of pagnes (colorful West-African fabric)

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 28 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riego, se dedica a la crianza de pollos y a la agricultura (siembra de maíz), vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida quien vende pupusas y le ayuda económicamente, el joven está solicitando un crédito para la compra de concentrado para los pollos y también para la siembra comprar semillas, fertilizantes, controles de pagas, así como muestra la fotografía para continuar con su trabajo ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y poder tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
This 28 year old young man, who has his face pixilated and lives in a high risk area, raises chickens and grows corn.  He lives in his own house with his life partner, who sells ‘pupusas’ [stuffed tortillas] and helps him financially. 

He is requesting a loan to buy concentrated feed for the chickens.  He will also use the loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, and pest controls for the planting season.  This way, as shown in the photograph, he will continue with his work.  This is his only source of income, and he will be able to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Ladiri Group

texts.fr:
Ladiri est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Hamdallaye de la ville de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien et qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 33 ans et ont au moins 3 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que,de pièces de pagnes,Fruits et légumes, Condiments et Habillements. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de groupe.
Haby est un membre du groupe Ladiri, assise au milieu, vendeuse de pièces de pagnes. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des pièces de pagnes de plusieurs qualités au fur et à mesure qu’elle vend en détail  à une clientèle diverse. Elle se procure au marché. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Ladiri comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 135000CFA  chacune au cours de ce cycle Mme Haby compte réaliser  145 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
Ladiri is a group of women from the Hamdallaye neighborhood in ​​the city of Koutiala who know each other well and who live in large traditional families along with their husbands, children and other relatives. They are on average 33 years old and have at least 3 children.

This group of women are retail merchants of various products such as lengths of pagnes (colorful West-African fabric), fruit and vegetables, condiments and clothing. To increase the size of their business, the members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program and are on their second group loan.

Haby, a member of the Djekafo group, is sitting in the middle, and sells lengths of pagne fabric. She intends to use her loan to buy different quality pagnes for quick retail sales to a diversified clientele. She resupplies at the market.

Whereas other members of the Ladiri group expect average profits of 135,000 CFA francs each during this cycle, Mrs. Haby expects to achieve 145,000 CFA francs. In addition to repaying the loans, they use some of the income to meet their personal expenses and increase their working capital.

They want to strengthen this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso to avoid stock shortages.

loans.use: buy lengths of pagnes (colorful West-African fabric)

loans.name: Balimaya Group

texts.fr:
Balimaya  est un regroupement de femmes du 1er quartier de la ville de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien et qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans et ont au moins 5 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que, pièces de pagnes, Colliers et divers. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur treizième prêt de groupe.
Kossa est un membre du groupe Balimaya, assise au milieu, vendeuse de pièces de pagnes. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter de pièces de pagnes de plusieurs qualités au fur et à mesure qu’elle vend en détail  à une clientèle diverse. Elle se procure au marché.    
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Balimaya  comptent  réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 195 000CFA  chacune au cours de ce cycle Mme Kossa compte réaliser  205 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
Balimaya is a group of women from the first neighborhood in ​​the city of Koutiala who know each other well and who live in large traditional families along with their husbands, children and other relatives. They are on average 35 years old and have at least 5 children.

This group of women are retail merchants of various products such as lengths of pagnes (colorful West-African fabric), necklaces and sundry items. To increase the size of their business, the members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program and are on their thirteenth group loan.

Kossa, a member of the Balimaya group, is sitting in the middle, and sells lengths of pagne fabric. She intends to use her loan to buy different quality pagnes for quick retail sales to a diversified clientele. She resupplies at the market.

Whereas other members of the Balimaya group expect average profits of 195,000 CFA francs each during this cycle, Mrs. Kossa expects to achieve 205,000 CFA francs. In addition to repaying the loans, they use some of the income to meet their personal expenses and increase their working capital.

They want to strengthen this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso to avoid stock shortages.

loans.use: Achat de pièces de pagnes

loans.name: Aida

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VIRGEN DE NATIVIDAD”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Aida  tiene 65 años de edad es casada y tiene 05 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias elaborando pasteles, tortas para los distintos compromisos que solicitan sus servicios, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a su negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones personales, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
 La socia solicita el crédito para comprar harina, azúcar entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The members belong to Virgen de Natividad Communal Bank, located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

Aida, 65, is married and has five children.  She alternates her daily activities making pastry and cakes for a variety of commitments that request her services.  She has worked in her business for a long time and it brings her personal satisfaction.  She wants to be able to keep on working so she can continue to help her family.

Aida's requesting the loan to buy flour, sugar, and other ingredients.

She's grateful for the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, and other ingredients

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Sabougnouma  est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Lafiala de la ville de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien et qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 38 ans et ont au moins 4 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que, Fruits et Légumes, Restauration, Habillement, Savon  et divers. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de groupe.
Kadiatou est un membre du groupe Sabougnouma, assise au bout et à gauche, vendeuse de Fruits et Légumes. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter de Bananes  au fur et à mesure qu’elle vend en détail  à une clientèle diverse. Elle se procure au marché.    
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Sabougnouma comptent  réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 165 000CFA  chacune au cours de ce cycle Mme Kadiatou compte réaliser  185 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
Sabougnouma is a group of women from the Lafiala neighborhood in ​​the city of Koutiala who know each other well and who live in large traditional families along with their husbands, children and other relatives. They are on average 38 years old and have at least 4 children.

This group of women are retail merchants of various products such as fruit and vegetables, food preparations, clothing, soap and sundry items. To increase the size of their business, the members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program and are on their third group loan.

Kadiatou, a member of the Sabougnouma group, is sitting at the far left, and sells fruit and vegetables. She intends to use her loan to buy bananas for quick retail sales to a diversified clientele. She resupplies at the market.

Whereas other members of the Sabougnouma group expect average profits of 165,000 CFA francs each during this cycle, Mrs. Kadiatou expects to achieve 185,000 CFA francs. In addition to repaying the loans, they use some of the income to meet their personal expenses and increase their working capital.

They want to strengthen this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso to avoid stock shortages.

loans.use: buy fruit

loans.name: Lola

texts.ru: Лола уроженка сельского района Шахритус. Она в свои 25 лет замужем и имеет двух детей. Ее муж в селе работает на стройке. Лола, муж и дети живут с родителями мужа. Она у них научилась животноводческой  деятельности. Вот уже 5 лет как Лола занимается разведением коров и телят. Эта деятельность ей нравится, так как не требует тяжелой работы. Лола сейчас хочет увеличить поголовье своих скотов и с такой целью обратилась за кредитом. Она надеетс, что ей не откажут в финансовой поддержке.
texts.en: Lola is from the rural district of Shahrituz.  She is 25 years old, married, and the mother of two children.  Her husband works on a construction site, in the village.  Lola, her husband and her children, live with her husbands' parents.  From them she has learned how to take care of cattle.  Lola has now been raising cows and calves for the past five years.  She likes this activity as it doesn't require strenuous physical work.  She currently wants to increase her cattle headcount, and this is the reason why she is taking a loan.  She hopes that she won't be turned down and that she will receive financial support.

loans.use: to buy a young bull for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es: Leonor de 55 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo quien es agricultor y su hija, ella se dedica a la venta de medicina popular desde hace 20 años, vende de forma ambulante por los diferentes mercados y ya tiene clientela establecida, que la prefieren por que el productos es de buena calidad y por los buenos precios, Leonor está solicitando un crédito para la compra de medicina popular por mayor para continuar con sus ventas para tener junto con su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Leonor is 55 years old. She lives in her own house with her husband who is a farmer and her daughter. She has been dedicated to folk medicine for 20 years. She uses a mobile business model, traveling to different markets. She now has an established clientele who prefer her products for their good quality and prices. Leonor is requesting a loan to purchase wholesale folk medicines in order to continue with her sales so that she and her family can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: purchase wholesale folk medicine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. It is located close to Uganda and Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano that straddles the two nations and even has a peak at the Kenya-Uganda border. 

Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway. The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests, and maintenance of tree cover by the area’s residents has helped both preserve the region’s soil and ensured that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage.

Margaret is married and has four children. She is a teacher. She also does farming with her husband. They have been farming for ten years now, and they are currently growing maize, beans, vegetables, and bananas. Margaret is excited about beekeeping, as the bees will help in pollinating their crops.

This is Margaret's first loan with Honey Care. She plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to buy a cow, invest in horticultural farming, and start a small business. Margaret's hope for the future is to live a better life.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Edy Alexander

texts.es:
Edy de 28 años  de edad soltero residente de Suchitepéquez, se ha dedicado a una de las profesiones más solemnes que existen en toda sociedad como lo es la docencia. El es una persona que está decidido a enseñar a los niños lo que el a aprendido en los años de estudios que el realizo en la comunidad donde el vive.

La  actividad que el realiza es docente en Suchitepéquez desde hace más de cuatro años, pero lo ha sentido desde pequeño.  Sus alumnos lo esperan siempre cada mañana para que Edy le imparta el saber de la vida para el desarrollo de su comunidad.

El motivo de la realización del préstamo es para la compra de terreno que el a anhelado tanto desde un tiempo atrás para  poder dejárselos a sus hijo en un futuro.

También la docencia le ha provisto una fuente económica para el sustento de su familia y de su comunidad.  Su sueño es poder instalar un negocio de internet en la comunidad donde le vive par generar ingresos económico extras de su trabajo.
texts.en:
Edy is 28 years old, single and a resident of Suchitepéquez. He has dedicated himself to one of the most solemn professions which exist in society, that of teaching. He is a person determined to teach children that which he has learned during his years of studying in the community where he lives. 

He has worked as a teacher in Suchitepéquez for more than four years but he has felt it since youth. His students await him each morning to impart on them the knowledge of life for the development of their community. 

The motive for the loan is to buy land that he has since yearned so much for in order to leave it to his children in the future. 

Teaching has also provided him a source of finances for the sustenance of his family and community. His dream is to be able to set up an internet business in the community where he lives to generate extra income from his work.

loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Deyanire Aslyn

texts.es:
Deyanire es una joven emprendedora de 21 años con muchas ganas de salir adelante y vive en Pueblo nuevo junto a su familia. Debido a la difícil situación económica que vivía su familia no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional y empezó a trabajar como Obrera de campo en los diferentes fundos agrícolas de su ciudad, en la actualidad ella cree que le está yendo bien porque se esfuerza bastante, es muy trabajadora y acepta cada nuevo desafío con mucho entusiasmo.
Deyanire está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar un juego de dormitorio, con esto descansará mejor ya que podrá reemplazar el antiguo colchón que tenía que es un poco duro. Gracias a esto seguirá luchando para más adelante empezar a estudiar una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Deyanire is an entrepreneurial youth, 21 years old, with a lot of desire to get ahead. She lives in Pueblo Nuevo with her family. Due to the difficult economic situation that her family lived in she could not study for a professional career and she began to work as a farm hand on the different agricultural estates in her city. Currently, she thinks it is going well for her because she puts in a lot of effort, is a hard worker and accepts each new challenge enthusiastically. 

Deyanire is thankful for the Kiva lenders because with the support they provide she can purchase a bed set. With this she will sleep much better since she can replace the old mattress she had, which is a bit hard. 

Thanks to this she will continue striving to later study for a professional career.

loans.use: to buy a bed set for her bedroom.

loans.name: Rosa Delmy

texts.es:
Rosa de 45 años de edad, estudio hasta 2° grado, ya que sus padres no contaron con los suficientes recursos económicos, para poder ofrecerles esta gran oportunidad a Rosa y sus hermanos. Ahora está casada, su esposo es albañil y tienen 4 hijos, quienes viven junto con ellos. 

Dado de que Rosa no pudo estudiar, sus padres inculcaron en ella y sus hermanos, la responsabilidad y muchos valores que la llevaron a que ella hoy sea una persona de bien. 

Es por esto que desde que tenía aproximadamente 12 años, ayudaba a sus padres en la siembra de maíz y frijol, así fue como aprendió esta actividad. También la necesidad de obtener ingresos, para su familia, la llevo a trabajar como ama de casa y en esta actividad ya tiene aproximadamente 10 años de estar laborando. Todo con el objetivo de sacar adelante a sus hijos y ayudar a su esposo, con los gastos del hogar.


El crédito será utilizado, para comprar  arena, piedra, hierro, cemento y ladrillo, para realizar unas mejoras a su vivienda.

Rosa tiene el sueño de ver mejorada su vivienda por completo. También desea que sus hijos encuentren un buen empleo y que puedan superarse.
texts.en:
Rosa, 45 years old, studied through the 2nd grade since her parents did not have sufficient financial resources to be able to offer this great opportunity to Rosa and her siblings. She is now married. Her husband is a mason and they have 4 children who live with them. 

Since Rosa could not study her parents instilled responsibility and many values in her and her siblings, which have brought her to now be a good person. 

For this reason she helped her parents since she was 12 years old to plant corn and beans which is how she learned this business. The necessity to earn income for her family also lead her to work as a housekeeper and she has now been working in this business for approximately 10 years. 

All of this with the objective to get her children ahead and to help her husband with the household costs. 

The loan will be used to buy sand, rock, iron, cement and brick to make some improvements to her home. 

Rosa dreams of seeing her home improvements completed. She also hopes to see her children find good jobs and be able to excel.

loans.use: to buy sand, rock, iron, cement and bricks to make some improvements to her home.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Meet Patrick, who has been practicing farming for the past 7 years. He lives in the Kisii area of Kenya with his 49-year-old wife. With rainfall throughout the year,  tea and banana farming have worked out quite well for Patrick. He also keeps cattle and poultry that produce milk and eggs for sale. Patrick's biggest challenge is lack of capital. He joined Juhudi Kilimo to get trained on loan management, which was his solution. 

Today Patrick is seeking a loan to purchase a dairy cow.  He is confident that with the daily production of milk, he will repay the loan with no trouble at all. With your loan, he will increase his asset base and his income. Currently, most of Patrick's income goes to his children's education. When asked how his children will benefit from this loan, he replied, "They will enjoy all the imaginable benefits that come with higher income."

loans.use: to pay for a dairy cow

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman and has been blessed with five children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years, Mariam has operated a retail shop business, selling household consumables such as wheat flour, rice and cooking oil. She cites seasonality as her major business challenge.

Margaret is requesting a loan of KES 50,000 to boost her kiosk by purchasing bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves and cooking fat . She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the near future

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves and cooking fat

loans.name: Hope

texts.en:
Hope, 47 years old, is a mother of three children who all attend school. She lost her husband and thus is solely responsible for the family's well being. Hope is mainly a cattle keeper and it is her major source of income, but she gets additional income from rentals.

Hope has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from Ugafode to plant maize and beans. Her dream for the future is to educate all her children up to university and to acquire more land. She faces challenges of bad weather and animal diseases.

loans.use: to hire labor and to buy maize and bean seeds

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. It is located close to Uganda and Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano which straddles the two nations and even has a peak at the Kenya-Uganda border. Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway. 

The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests, and maintenance of tree cover by the area’s residents has helped both preserve the region’s soil and ensured that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage.

Grace is married and has eight children. She is a Church Elder in her local church. She also does farming with her husband. They have been farming for 35 years now and they are currently growing maize, vegetables, avocados and coffee, and they also keep livestock. Grace is excited about beekeeping as it will earn her some income from the sale of honey.

This is Grace’s first loan with Honey Care and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to invest in livestock farming and establish a zero grazing unit for her dairy cattle. Grace’s hope for the future is to live a better life.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase school shoes for sale.

loans.name: Mio Dilcia

texts.es:
Mio Dilcia tiene 33 años, es conviviente, conocida en el medio, por la labor de crianza y venta de animales menores. Vive en casa propia, con conyuge y 02 hijos de 14 y 06 años respectivamente, los cuales estudian en colegio nacional de la zona, su conyuge trabaja como jornalero agrícola en empresa de la zona. Mio Dilcia cuenta con buenas referencias personales, familiares y económicas. Vive en una comunidad ubicada a 36 kms de Chiclayo, pasando Ucupe, en la cual viven personas amables y trabajadoras, dedicadas al comercio, ganaderia y agrícultura.

Mio Dilcia se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores tales como patos, pavos, gallinas y gallos. Ella necesita préstamo para invertir en compra de cerdos y alimentos de engorde para estos, dicha inversión le reportará mayor cantidad en ventas, mejores ingresos, mayores ganancias y por ende podrá mejorar su caldiad de vida.
texts.en:
Mio Dilcia is 33 years old, married, and known for her work of raising and selling small animals. She lives in her own house with her spouse and her two children, who are 14 and 6 years old and attend the national school of the region. Her husband works as an agricultural laborer for a local company. Mio Dilcia has good personal, family, and business references. She lives in a community located 36 km from Chiclayo, past Ucupe. The people that live there are nice and hardworking, and they work in commerce, livestock, and agriculture. 

Mio Dilcia makes a living raising and selling small animals such as ducks, turkeys, hens, and chickens. She needs a loan to buy pigs and feed to fatten them. This investment will increase her sales, raise her earnings, and improve her income. In this way, she will better her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed to fatten them.

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Maria Fe is 35 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Maria Fe runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more groceries like sanitary pads, diapers, shampoo, soft-drinks, beers, etc. to sell.

She has been in this business for 7 years and sells a variety of items such as sanitary pads, diapers, shampoo, soft-drinks, beers, etc. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Maria Fe would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries like sanitary pads, diapers, shampoo, soft-drinks, beers, etc. to sell

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 52-year-old female Ugandan, a widow with four children aged 23, 20, 18, and 16.

Her main business is a boutique where she sells traditional ladies' clothes, but she also gets additional income from farming.

She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from UGAFODE to buy more materials for traditional clothes to sell in her shop.

Her dreams for the future is to buy more land and expand her business. Her main challenge is the seasonality and competition in her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for making clothing to sell.

loans.name: Azuberi

texts.en:
Azuberi is a married woman who has children. She lives in a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

Azuberi operates a stall where she sells fruits and vegetables. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbours. In addition, she sells goats to supplement her income. She faces the challenges of competition and seasonality in her business. 

With the Kshs 50,000 loan, Azuberi wants to purchase sacks of fruits, such as oranges and bananas, and green vegetables to sell. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing a retail shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits, such as oranges and bananas, and green vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Phelister

texts.en:
Phelister lives in Kitale which is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia as one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflowers, sugar cane, millet and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region.

Phelister is married and has 15 children. She is a trader in foodstuffs and also does farming with her husband. They have been farming for 60 years now and are currently growing maize, potatoes, vegetables, cassava and bananas and they also keep livestock. Phelister is excited about beekeeping as the bees will help in pollinating their crops.

This is Phelister’s first loan with Honey Care and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to educate her children and grandchildren. Phelister’s hope for the future is to improve her family’s life.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Jecinta

texts.en:
Jecinta lives in Kitale, which is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia as one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region.

Jecinta is married and has two children. She is a tailor. She also does farming with her husband. They have been farming for three years and they are currently growing maize, beans, vegetables and bananas. Jecinta is excited about beekeeping as the bees will help in pollinating their crops.

This is Jecinta’s first loan with Honey Care and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to invest in her tailoring business. Jecinta’s hope for the future is to live a better life.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Feronica

texts.en:
Feronica lives in Kitale, which is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. At over 6,300 feet above sea level, it is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya.” Many farmers in the region have started projects planting bluegum trees on their land, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. The people around Kitale have been beekeeping for centuries and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.

Feronica is married and has eight children. Both she and her husband are farmers. They have been farming for forty years and they are currently growing maize, millet, vegetables and cassava. Feronica is excited about beekeeping as the bees will help in pollinating their crops.

This is Feronica’s first loan with Honey Care and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to educate her children. Feronica’s hope for the future is to improve her livelihood.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice lives in Kitale which is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya, and at over 6,300 feet above sea level, is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize-producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya". Many farmers in the region have started projects planting blue gum trees on their land, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. The people around Kitale have been beekeeping for centuries, and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.

Eunice is single with seven children. She runs a kiosk and is also a farmer. She has been farming for the past 29 years and currently grows maize, millet, potatoes and bananas: she also keeps livestock. Eunice is excited about beekeeping as it will earn her some income from the sale of honey and the bees will help in pollinating her crops. 

This is Eunice’s first loan with Honey Care and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to buy a dairy cow. Eunice’s hope for the future is to successfully educate her children and improve her family’s life.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in Kitale which is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia as one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflowers, sugar cane, millet and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region.

Mary is married and has seven children. Both she and her husband are farmers. They have been farming for the past 38 years and  currently grow maize, vegetables, bananas and avocados:  they also keep livestock. Mary is also leader in her local church. She is excited about beekeeping as it will earn her some income from the sale of honey.

This is Mary’s first loan with Honey Care and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to educate her children. Mary’s hope for the future is to live a better life.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Isabella

texts.en:
Isabella lives in Kitale, which is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. It is located close to Uganda and Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano which straddles the two nations and even has a peak at the Kenya-Uganda border. Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway. The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests, and maintenance of tree cover by the area’s residents has helped both preserve the region’s soil and ensured that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage.

Isabella is married and has six children. She runs her own kindergarten. She also does farming with her husband. They have been farming for twenty-eight years now and they are currently growing maize, millet, beans, vegetables, bananas and sugarcane. Isabella is excited about beekeeping as the bees will aid in pollinating their crops.

This is Isabella’s first loan with Honey Care and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to invest in her business. Isabella’s hope for the future is to live a good life.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Patister

texts.en:
Patister lives in Kitale which is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya, and at over 6,300 feet above sea level, is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize-producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya". Many farmers in the region have started projects planting blue gum trees on their land, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. The people around Kitale have been beekeeping for centuries, and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.

Patister is married and has 10 children. Both she and her husband are farmers. They have been farming for the past 34 years and currently grow maize, beans, vegetables, cassava and tea. They also keep poultry and cattle. Patister is excited about beekeeping as it will earn her some income from the sale of honey and provide her with honey for food. 

This is Patister’s first loan with Honey Care and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to educate her children and to invest in her dairy farm. Her hope for the future is to live a more fulfilling life.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. 

The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region.

Josephine is married and has four children. Both she and her husband are farmers. They have been farming for thirty-seven years now and they are currently growing maize, vegetables, potatoes and bananas. Josephine is excited about beekeeping as it will earn her some income from the sale of honey.

This is Josephine’s first loan with Honey Care and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to buy a dairy cow. Josephine’s hope for the future is to live a better life.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Mealii

texts.en:
Mealii is a married woman with three kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mealii operates a vegetable stall, and she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces the challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. It is located close to Uganda, and Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano which straddles the two nations and even has a peak at the Kenya-Uganda border. Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway. 

The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests, and maintenance of tree cover by the area’s residents has helped both preserve the region’s soil and ensured that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage.

Emily is single with eight children. She sells farm produce at her local market. She is a farmer. She has been farming for thirty-four years now and she is currently growing maize, beans and potatoes, and she also keeps livestock. Emily is excited about beekeeping as it will earn her some income from the sale of honey and provide her with honey for food.

This is Emily’s first loan with Honey Care and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to educate her children. Emily’s hope for the future is to live a better life.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya, and at over 6,300 feet above sea level, is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya".

loans.name: Trabajando Para  El Futuro Group

texts.es: Esta es la Alcancía “Trabajando Para El Futuro” conformada por 07 mujeres entusiastas y responsables. Julia de 48 años de edad es separada con 03 hijos dependientes.  Ella se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir. Comenzó hace mas de 15 años donde todo le va bien. Su mayor deseo es de comprarse una estampadora para mejorar la calidad y estilo de prendas.  Es por ello que solicitó el crédito para la compra de tela, hilo, botones y tijeras. El grupo “Trabajando Para El Futuro” agradecen a las personas que hicieron posible este crédito. Julia se encuentra de pie en la parte posterior  es la primera del lado izquierdo y viste polo de color negro.
texts.en:
This is the Trabajando Para El Futuro [Working for the Future] communal bank.  It is made up of seven enthusiastic and responsible women.  

Julia, age 48, is separated, with three dependent children.  She works sewing clothing.  She got started over 15 years ago, and everything is going well for her.  Her biggest desire is to buy herself a stamping machine to improve the quality and style of her outfits.  It is because of this that she is asking for a loan to buy fabric, thread, buttons, and scissors.  

The “Trabajando Para El Futuro” group is thankful to the people who made this loan possible.

Julia can be seen standing in the back of the photo.  She is the first person from the lefthand side, dressed in a black top.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, buttons, and scissors

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel lives in Kitale. Rachel is married and has three children. She runs her own business. She is also engaged in farming with her husband. They have been farming for nine years now, and they are currently growing maize, beans, vegetables and fruits. Rachel is excited about beekeeping as the bees will help in pollinating their crops.

This is Rachel’s first loan with Honey Care, and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to pay school fees for her children. Rachel’s hope for the future is to improve her standards of living.

Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. It is located close to Uganda, and Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano which straddles the two nations and even has a peak at the Kenya-Uganda border. Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway. The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests, and maintenance of tree cover by the area’s residents has helped both preserve the region’s soil and ensured that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region.

Esther is married and has eight children. She runs her own business. She also does farming with her husband. They have been farming for fifty years now and they are currently growing maize, vegetables, and bananas and they also keep livestock. Esther is excited about beekeeping, as it will earn her some income from the sale of honey and the bees will help in pollinating their crops.

This is Esther’s first loan with Honey Care and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to invest in her farm. Esther’s hope for the future is to live a comfortable life.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production
